loans.name: Edelma

texts.es: Edelma E. U. tiene 65 años de edad, su estado civil es casada. Doña Edelma tiene 6 hijos y todos trabajan de forma independiente. La actividad económica de Doña Edelma es la compra y venta de ropa usada. Hace más de veinte seis años que se dedica a este negocio ya que tenía la necesidad de poseer un ingreso propio y así sufragar los gastos de la familia. Los propósitos de Doña Ana son de estabilizar su negocio ya que últimamente es muy difícil mantener este negocio ya que la situación en el país es muy difícil. El financiamiento es para capital de trabajo por lo que compraría más ropa usada para su negocio. la cantidad que solicita es de C$ 9.000 córdobas.
texts.en:
Edelma E. U. is 65 years old and married. She has 6 children, all of whom are working and independent. For more than 26 years now, Doña Edelma has worked as a trader, buying and selling used clothing. It has been a means of earning her own income, and of providing for her family. Lately, however, it has been very hard for Doña Edelma to sustain her business because the country as a whole is in a very difficult situation. This loan, of $9,000 Córdobas, would help her stabilize her business, serving as working capital and allowing her to buy larger quantities of used clothing at a time.

Translated from Spanish by Sara Sultan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital to buy used clothing

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Placida Claudia

texts.es:
Placida es socia del Banco Comunal Orcasitas, Placida vive en la comunidad D. Orcasitas que se ubica a 30 minutos D. la ciudad D. Ayacucho.
Placida es casada, tiene 57 años y 8 hijos, Placida junto a su esposo se dedican a la fabricación D. ladrillos artesanales, para lo cual cuenta con el apoyo D. peones, sus ventas lo realiza en la misma comunidad. Además Placida se dedica a la compra D. tara, cochinilla y tuna.
Placida necesita un préstamo D. 900 soles dinero que será invertido en el pago D. los peones que labran los ladrillos.
Los sueños D. Placida son mejorar su negocio y brindar una buena alimentación y estudios a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Placida is a member of the Orcasitas Microfinance Institute. She lives in the community of Orcasitas, which is located 30 minutes away from the city of Ayacucho. Placida is a 57-year-old married mother with 8 children. She and her husband produce handmaD. bricks, for which they have the support of laborers. They sell their products in their own community. Placida also sells tara pods, cochineal insects and prickly pears for a living. Placida needs a 900.00 PEN loan, which will be invested in paying the laborers who cut the bricks. Placida dreams of improving her business and offering her children good nutrition and a good education.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pay laborers

loans.name: Joaquín

texts.es:
Joaquin es socio del Banco Comunal Orcasitas, Joaquin vive en la comunidad de Orcasitas que se ubica a 30 minutos de la ciudad de Ayacucho.
Joaquin es conviviente, tiene 43 años y 3 hijos, Joaquin junto a su esposa se dedican a la fabricación de ladrillos artesanales, para lo cual cuenta con el apoyo de peones, sus ventas lo realiza en la misma comunidad. Además Joaquín se dedica a la agricultura de verduras en sus terrenos de la comunidad de Chacco.
Joaquin necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de abono y para el pago de peones.
Joaquin sueña con brindar una buena educación a sus hijos, darles una estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Joaquín is a member of the Orcasitas Community Bank. He lives in the town of Orcasitas, which is located thirty minutes from the city of Ayacucho. Joaquín is 43 years old and lives with his wife and three children. He and his wife make handcrafted bricks for a living and they count on the help of workers who sell the bricks in their community. Joaquín also works as a vegetable farmer on his plots in the community of Chacco. He needs a loan of $325 that will be used to purchase fertilizer and to pay his workers. Joaquín dreams of providing his children with a good education, giving them economic stability.

Translated from Spanish by Julia Kaplan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase soil and pay his sales workers

loans.name: Nubia Del Socorro

texts.es:
La señora Nubia M. desde hace 16 años se dedica a su negocio de venta de colchones el cual posee siendo este el ingreso con el cual mantiene a su familia. Es de importancia destacar que ella ha logrado mejorar las condiciones de su negocio porque ha sabido aprovechar los crédito brindados por Ceprodel.

El motive por el cual ella espera  una vez más en Ceprodel es porque requiere de un Nuevo crédito para la compra de colchones y así ofertarlos en su localidad y generar ingresos que le sirvan para mantener su hogar.
texts.en:
Ms. Nubia M. has been making a living by selling mattresses for the past 16 years. She owns the business and it gives her the income she needs to support her family. It is important to highlight her accomplishments in improving the conditions of her business. She has known how to take advantage of the loans she has received through Ceprodel. The reason why she is hoping for another loan through Ceprodel is because she needs money to buy more mattresses that she can sell them to her customers at her store and this will help her to make more money to support her family.

(Translated by Ashlee of San Roque High School)

Translated from Spanish by San Roque School, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase Mattresses

loans.name: Paulina Fortunata

texts.es:
Paulina es socia del Banco Comunal Orcasitas, Paulina vive en la comunidad de Orcasitas que se ubica a 30 minutos de la ciudad de Ayacucho.
Paulina es casada, tiene 43 años y 2 hijos, Paulina tiene una tienda en su casa en donde vende abarrotes en general, carnes, verduras, actividad que realiza todos los días con la ayuda de su hija. Además Paulina vende comida los días sábados y domingos en el estadio de su comunidad.
Paulina necesita un préstamo de 900 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de azúcar, arroz y aceite.
Los sueños de Paulina son que sus hijos tengan una buena educación y aumentar su negocio.
texts.en:
Paulina is a member of the Orcasitas Community Bank. She lives in the community of Orcasitas about 30 minutes from the city of Ayacucho. Paulina is 43 years old and is married with two children. She has a store in her house where she sells general groceries, meats, and vegetables every day with the help of her daughter. Paulina also sells food on Saturdays and Sundays in the community stadium. Paulina needs a loan of $300 that will be used to buy sugar, rice, and oil. Paulina's dreams are to give her children a good education and to grow her business.

Translated from Spanish by Julia Kaplan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of sugar, rice, and oil

loans.name: Lidia Candelaria

texts.es:
La señora Lidia es socia del Banco Comunal “El Comercio”, del barrio San Andrés, en el distrito de Desaguadero, Provincia de Chucuito, Departamento de Puno; tiene 25 años de edad, es madre soltera y tiene a su cuidado 01 hijo, asimismo posee estudios de primaria completa. 
Ella Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 02 años, su negocio es el engorde de ganado y su comercialización, así como la venta de productos y accesorios de limpieza y higiene (cremas dentales, para zapatos, escobillas, etc.); su primer préstamo fue de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, con lo que pudo adquirir ganado menor para engorde y su venta en las ferias de Zepita.  
Actualmente requiere un nuevo préstamo de S/. 1500.00 Nuevos soles, el mismo que se comprometa a pagar en 03 cuotas mensuales, con dicho préstamo desea adquirir ganado mayor (toros) para engordarlos y venderlos en las ferias ganaderas de Zepita o Huacullani; asimismo desea seguir mejorando su negocio de venta de artículos de limpieza e higiene; su anhelo es comprarse una casa propia en Desaguadero, puesto que aún sus padres la vienen acogiendo, finalmente ella desea educar a sus hijito y apoyarlo en todo lo que requiera.
texts.en:
Señora Lidia is a member of the El Comercio Communal Bank, which is located in San Andrés, in the district of Desaguadero, in the Province of Chucuito, in Puno. She is 25 years old and the single mother of one son. She has been working with the Manuela Ramos Movement for 2 years now. Lidia raises livestock to sell in Zepita's markets and also, sells cleaning products and toiletries (toothpaste, shoe polish, brushes etc.). Her first loan was of 500 soles, which she used to buy young livestock, raising them and eventually, selling them. Now, she is requesting a loan of 1,500. soles, which she will repay in 3 installments, so that she can buy some bulls to raise for the market, either in Zepita or in Huacullani. Also, she would like to continue to improve her second business, her trade in cleaning products and toiletries. Lidia dreams of buying her own house in Desaguadero, even though many people - including her parents - are renters. More than anything however, she wants to be able to give her son an education and to support him in every way.

Translated from Spanish by Sara Sultan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase livestock and cleaning products

loans.name: Guadalupe

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Managua capital de Nicaragua, la señora Guadalupe G. se ha caracterizado por ser una persona muy esforzada que posee su propio negocio de elaboración y venta de alimentos los cuales comercializa ella misma todos los días con el propósito de mantener su hogar.

Es importante destacar que ella se ha caracterizado por ser una excelente cocinera y para esto se esfuerza a diario. La razón por la cual ha solicitado el crédito es para la compra de materia prima para la elaboración de dichos alimentos y  así continuar en su negocio.
texts.en:
Living in Managua, the capital of Nicaragua, Señora Guadalupe G. runs a business making and selling meals. She works very hard, every day, in order to maintain her home. It is important to emphasize that she is known as an excellent cook, and she continues each day to work hard at making the best food possible. She has asked for this loan so that she can buy the ingredients of her meals and in this way, continue running her business.

Translated from Spanish by Sara Sultan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients

loans.name: Ana Fabiola

texts.es: Ana Fabiola B. S. tiene 26 años de edad, su estado civil es soltera. Doña Ana no tiene hijos. La actividad económica de Doña Ana es la compra ropa y cosméticos. En la actualidad la actividad de la Joven Ana Fabiola la ofrece en su tienda situada en su casa de habitación la que dirige con el apoyo de su Señora Madre, también participa en el taller de costura de su Mama es ahí que nace su interés por ser comerciante hace mas de 11 años que se dedica a este negocio. Los propósitos de Ana son de obtener muy buenos ingresos ya que esta interesada en complacer a sus clientes por lo que así  obtendría fama. El financiamiento es para capital de trabajo para la compra de ropa, cosméticos y calzado. La cantidad que solicita es de C$ 20.000 córdobas.
texts.en:
Ana Fabiola B. S. is 26 years old and single; she does not have any children. Ana sells clothing and cosmetics. Young Ana Fabiola currently has a store in her home from which she sells with her mother's help. She in turn helps her mother in her dressmaking business, which is how she became interested in becoming a businesswoman 11 years ago, at which time she started her own business. Ana's goals are to make a good income as she cares very much about satisfying her customers as it is they who will make her reputation. The loan is for working capital to buy clothing, cosmetics and footwear. She is asking for C$20,000 cordobas.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Paulina

texts.es:
Paulina es socia del Banco Comunal Los Sauces de Compañía, Paulina vive en la comunidad de Compañía que se encuentra a 40 minutos de la ciudad de Ayacucho.
Paulina es viuda, tiene 55 años y 5 hijos, Paulina viaja a las ferias 2 veces por semana de donde compra cereales, tubérculos, animales, productos que vende en su comunidad.
Paulina necesita un préstamo de 900 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de haba, maíz, papa.
Los sueños Paulina es mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
Paulina is a member of the Los Sauces de Compañia Communal Bank. She lives in the community of Compañia, which is about forty minutes from the city of Ayacucho. Paulina is 55 years old and is widowed with five children. She travels to street markets twice a week, where she buys cereals, tubers, and animals and she then sells these products in her community. Paulina needs a loan of $300 so that she can buy beans, corn, and potatoes. Paulina's dream is to improve her business.

Translated from Spanish by Julia Kaplan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase beans, corn, and potatoes

loans.name: Vicenta

texts.es:
Vicenta es socia del Banco Comunal Los Sauces de Compañía, Paulina vive en la comunidad de Compañía que se encuentra a 40 minutos de la ciudad de Ayacucho.
Vicenta es conviviente, tiene 27 años y 1 hijo, Vicenta junto a su esposo se dedican a la fabricación de ladrillos artesanales, para lo cual cuenta con el apoyo de peones, sus ventas lo realiza en la misma comunidad. Vicenta además tiene una pequeña tienda de abarrotes en su casa.
Vicenta necesita un préstamo de 900 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de leña, carbón.
Los sueños de Vicenta son mejorar su negocio y comprar un carro para transportar sus productos-
texts.en:
Vicenta is a member from the Communal Los Sauces. Vicenta lives in the community of Compañía, 40 minutes away from the city of Ayacucho. She is 27 years old, married and has one son. Vicenta and her husband work togerher making bricks. She hires day laborers to help and she sells her product in her community. Vicenta also owns a small store that is connected to her home and is where she sells groceries. Vicenta needs a loan of $300 (900 Soles), money that will be used to invest in firewood and charcoal for making the bricks. Her biggest dream is to make her business bigger and better and she also wants to buy a car so that she could transport her product.

(Translated by Sonia of San Roque High School)

Translated from Spanish by San Roque School, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the purchase of firewood and charcoal for making bricks.

loans.name: Pelagia

texts.es:
Pelagia es socia del Banco Comunal Los Sauces de Compañía, Paulina vive en la comunidad de Compañía que se encuentra a 40 minutos de la ciudad de Ayacucho.
Pelagia es casada, tiene 45 años y 4 hijos, Pelagia compra ladrillos de los productores de su comunidad y los comercializa en la ciudad de Ayacucho, para lo cual alquila carros. Además vende leña en el mercado de abastos de la ciudad de Ayacucho.
Pelagia necesita un préstamo de 900 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de leña.
Los sueños de Pelagia son tener capital propio, construir una casa para sus hijos.
texts.en:
Pelagia lives in Compañía, about 40 minutes from Ayacucho city, and is a member of the Los Sauces de Compañía Communal Bank. She is 45, married, and has 4 children. Pelagia buys bricks from local producers and sells them in Ayacucho, transporting them in rented trucks. She also sells firewood in Ayacucho's markets, and needs a loan of 900 soles to buy more firewood to sell. Pelagia dreams of having the resources to build a house for her children.

Translated from Spanish by Sara Sultan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy firewood

loans.name: Hilda

texts.es:
La señora Hilda es socia del Banco Comunal “Corazones unidos”, del distrito D. Desaguadero, en la Provincia D. Chucuito, Departamento D. Puno; tiene 76 años D. edad, D. estado civil viuda, tiene 01 hija. 
Ella Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 08 años, ella posee un negocio D. elaboración y comercialización D. tortas y bocaditos; su primer préstamo fue D. S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, monto que sirvió como capital adicional en la compra D. insumos para su negocio (batidora, leche, harina al por mayor, azúcar, etc.).  
Actualmente ella desea prestarse un monto adicional D. S/. 3000.00 Nuevos soles, el mismo que se comprometa a pagar en 04 cuotas mensuales, con dicho préstamo podrá adquirir ingredientes al por mayor (harina, azúcar, etc.) y mercadería adicional (chipis, carinto y bocaditos, productos envasados D. la marca Gustosi) para venderlos en las ferias locales D. Desaguadero, D. donD. llevan sus productos a otras ferias D. la región y D. Bolivia; ella desea continuar con su negocio y su anhelo es ayudar a su hija en sus estudios superiores.
texts.en:
Hilda is a member of the communal bank Corazones Unidos in the Desaguadero district, province of Chucuito, Puno department. She is 76 years old. She is a widow and has one daughter. She has worked with the Manuela Ramos Movement for 8 years. She has a business making and selling sandwiches and snacks. Her first loan was for 300.00 PEN. She used this to buy consumables for her business (mixer, milk, bulk flour, sugar etc.) Now she would like an additional loan of 3000.00 PEN which she promises to repay in 4 monthly installments. With this loan she would be able to buy ingredients in bulk (flour, sugar, etc) and additional merchandise (snacks and Gustosi brand canned goods) to sell at the local fairs in Desaguadero. She also sells her products at other regional fairs and in Bolivia. She wants to continue with this business, and her goal is to help her daughter with her higher education.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients such as flour, sugar, etc. and additional merchandise to sell at fairs

loans.name: Rocío

texts.es: Rocío, junto a su esposo, vela siempre por el bienestar de sus dos hijos, a quienes logró brindarles una casa donde puedan crecer  libremente. La paciencia, arte y creatividad que posee le dieron la oportunidad de dedicarse a la elaboración de collares y pulseras que aprendió a realizar desde soltera, ahora que se casó trata de ayudar a su esposo realizando este trabajo. Es por eso que sale todas las tardes rumbo a su taller que se encuentra a unas cuadras de su casa, donde diseña sus collares y demás accesorios, pues todos los fines de semana, sale a vender y distribuir en las tiendas que se encuentran en el centro de la ciudad. Estos pendientes han tenido gran acogida y cada fin de semana las damas de la ciudad visitan las tiendas con el fin de encontrar modelos nuevos para su colección, lo que incrementa los pedidos de Rocío. Ahora ella desea especializarse y estudiar  para mejorar sus diseños y poner una tienda donde pueda vender directamente según las exigencias y pedidos que le hagan. Este es su noveno préstamo con MFP y desea seguir trabajando con el mismo compromiso  dentro de su banco comunal, pues acceder a los servicios que le brinda la institución le ayudó a mejorar su negocio. Los 2000 soles que solicita es para adquirir grandes cantidades de materia prima para su producción con cuyas ganancias espera instalar posteriormente, su tienda en el centro de la ciudad.
texts.en:
Rocio and her husband always pray for the well-being of their two children, whom they are able to provide with a home where they can grow freely. Being patient, creative and artistic gave her the opportunity to dedicate herself to making necklaces and bracelets that she learned how to make when she was single. Now that she is married she helps her husband by doing this activity. Every afternoon she goes to her workshop that is located a few blocks from her house, where she designs her necklaces and other accessories. On the weekends, she goes out to sell and distribute her products at the stores downtown. Her jewelry has been well-accepted and the ladies of the city visit the stores where her jewelry is sold to find the newest pieces of her collection. This increases Rocio’s orders. Now she would like to study and specialize in order to improve her designs and start a store where she can sell her jewelry directly according to the orders her customers make. This is her 9th loan with MFP and she hopes to continue working with the same commitment with her community bank. Having access to these services has helped her improve her business. The 2000 soles she is asking for are to buy large quantities of materials for her jewelry production. She will use the earnings to open her own store in the downtown area.

Translated from Spanish by Rachel Crouch, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Materials for jewelry making

loans.name: Dionisia

texts.es:
Dionisia es socia del Banco Comunal Los Sauces de Compañía, Paulina vive en la comunidad de Compañía que se encuentra a 40 minutos de la ciudad de Ayacucho.
Dionisia es casada, tiene 64 años y 12 hijos de los cuales 1 vive con ella, Dionisia compra tara, cochinilla, tuna, también alquila terrenos de donde cosecha tara, sus productos los vende a los intermediarios.
Dionisia necesita un préstamo de 700 soles dinero que será invertido en el pago del alquiler de terrenos.
El sueño de Dionisia es mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
Dionisia is a member of the community bank “Los Sauces de Compañía”. She lives in the village of Compañía, located 40 minutes from the city of Ayacucho. Dionisia is 64 years old, married, and has 12 children, one of whom lives with her. Dionisia buys tara plants, cochinilla (a type of insect), and prickly pears that she then sells to middle-men. She also rents some land where she grows the tara plant. Dionisia needs a loan for 700 soles that she will invest in paying for her rented land. Dionisia’s dream is to improve her business.

Translated from Spanish by Rachel Crouch, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Land rental

loans.name: Herlinda

texts.es:
Herlinda es socia del Banco Comunal Los Sauces de Compañía, Paulina vive en la comunidad de Compañía que se encuentra a 40 minutos de la ciudad de Ayacucho.
Herlinda es conviviente tiene 29 años y 2 hijos, Herlinda junto a su esposo se dedican a la agricultura de verduras variadas, sus productos los comercializan en le mercado de abastos de la ciudad de Ayacucho. Además Herlinda se dedica a la fabricación de ladrillos.
Herlinda necesita un préstamo de 900 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de tierra.
Herlinda sueña con mejorar su negocio y que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Herlinda is a member of the community bank “Los Sauces de Compañía”. She lives in the village of Compañía, located 40 minutes from the city of Ayacucho. Herlinda is 29 years old and lives with her common-law husband and 2 children. Herlinda and her husband both work in agriculture—growing various vegetables. They sell their vegetables in the market in the city of Ayacucho. Herlinda also works as a brick-maker. She needs a loan for 900 soles that she will use to buy land. Herlinda dreams of improving her business and seeing her children become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Rachel Crouch, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy land

loans.name: Horacio

texts.es:
Horacio es socio del Banco Comunal Los Sauces de Compañía, Paulina vive en la comunidad de Compañía que se encuentra a 40 minutos de la ciudad de Ayacucho.
Horacio es conviviente, tiene 30 años y 1 hijo, Horacio se dedica a la fabricación de ladrillos artesanales, para lo cual cuenta con el apoyo de peones, sus ventas lo realiza en la misma comunidad.
Horacio necesita un préstamo de 900 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de tierra.
Horacio sueña con educar a sus hijos y cambiar de negocio por otro mas rentable.
texts.en:
Horacio is a member of the community bank “Los Sauces de Compañía”. He lives in the village of Compañía, located 40 minutes from the city of Ayacucho. Horacio is 30 years old and lives with his common law wife and their son. Horacio works as an artisan brick-maker, and he counts on the help of several employees. He sells his bricks in his own community. Horacio needs a loan for 900 soles that he will use to buy land. Hoarcio dreams of educating his children and changing his business to something more profitable.

Translated from Spanish by Rachel Crouch, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy land

loans.name: Evangelista

texts.es: La Señora Evangelista C. tiene la edad de 58 años, su estado civil es casada. Doña Evangelista no tiene hijos. La actividad económica a la que Doña Evangelista se dedica es  la venta de mercadería en general como ropa, calzado y cosmético. Hace más de 4 años que se dedica a este negocio por lo que da inicio con capital propio pero solo con la ayuda de los financiamientos se ha beneficiado. Los propósitos de Doña Evangelista son de incrementar su inventario ya que así podrá ofrecer variedad a sus clientes. El financiamiento es para capital de trabajo ya que viaja hasta Managua para realizar las compras de ropa interior, bolsos y cosméticos. Los deseos de Doña Evangelista son de crecer con su negocio para ampliarlo y obtener los ingresos necesarios. La cantidad que solicita es de C$ 10.000 córdobas.
texts.en:
Mrs. Evangelista C. is 58 years old and married. She does not have any children. Evangelista works selling general merchandise like clothes, shoes and cosmetics. She started her business four years ago with her own capital, but her business has grown only with of the help from these loans. Evangelista plans on increasing her inventory so she can offer more variety to her customers. The loan is for working capital that she can use when she travels to Managua to buy undergarments, purses and cosmetics. Evangelista would like to increase her business in order to earn more money. The amount she is asking for is C$10,000 cordobas.

Translated from Spanish by Rachel Crouch, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es: Elizabeth tiene 49 años, vive en una humilde casa  que con mucho esfuerzo construyó con el fin de habitar junto a su esposo, su hijo y donde también acogió a su sobrina. Hace 5 años que está dedicada a la crianza de animales menores, actividad que inició desde que perdió gran parte del capital de su negocio de venta de carne de pollo, pues las circunstancias que se presentaron impidieron que siguiera trabajando en ello, sin embargo consiguió una manera de ganarse la vida sin tener que salir de su hogar. Encontrando en la crianza de animales una  buena oportunidad, gracias a la gran demanda que hay en la venta de estos animales, pudo instalar al poco tiempo un corral en el patio de su casa, espacio donde ahora alimenta y engorda a sus animales para luego venderlos a los comerciantes y a algunas avícolas que realizan pedidos cada mes. En el futuro Elizabeth desea tener una tienda, para no tener solo una sola actividad económica, con el fin de incrementar sus ingresos y que eso le permita mejorar su casa y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia. Este es su 13avo préstamo con MFP, y toda su temporada en la institución le ha ayudado a mejorar su calidad de vida, en lo económico y sobre todo en la parte social. Ella invertirá 1500 soles en mercadería para su bodega, productos de primera necesidad, de esta manera iniciar poco a poco a surtir su pequeña tienda.
texts.en:
Elizabeth is 49 years old and lives in a humble house that she built with great effort. She lives there with her husband, her son and her niece. For the past five years she has worked raising small animals. She started this business when she lost most of her money from her business selling chicken meat. Although circumstances prevented her from continuing to do that job, she found a way to earn a living without having to leave her home. Raising animals is a good opportunity and thanks to the large demand in sales of these animals she was able to add a small henhouse in her yard. She raises and feeds the animals and later sells them to vendors and merchants who give her orders every month. In the future Elizabeth would like to have a store, in order to have more than one source of income and increase her earnings. This would allow her to improve her home and the quality of life for her family. This is her 13th loan with MFP and her time with this institution has helped her improve her quality of life, both economically and, above all, socially. She will invest the 1500 soles in general merchandise, and begin to stock her small store little by little.

Translated from Spanish by Rachel Crouch, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase merchandise to stock her store

loans.name: Gregoria

texts.es:
La señora Gregoria es socia del Banco Comunal “El Comercio”, en el distrito de Desaguadero, Provincia de Chucuito, Departamento de Puno; tiene 50 años de edad, ella es Viuda, sin embargo se esmera por cuidar a 01 de sus 05 hijos (los demás tienen sus propia familia). 
Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 05 años, su negocio es el la compra y venta de Telas; su primer préstamo fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, con lo que pudo adquirir mercadería (Tela de diferente calidad) de la ciudad de la Paz – Bolivia.  
Actualmente ella viene comercializando su mercadería en la ciudad de Arequipa y Puno a donde llevas dichos productos; es por esta razón que necesita mas capital para ampliar su negocio; y viene solicitando un nuevo préstamo de S/. 3000.00 Nuevos soles, el mismo que se comprometa a pagar en 03 cuotas, con el préstamo ella podrá adquirir mas mercadería (Telas) de Bolivia para venderlos al por mayor; su anhelo es tener en el futuro su casa propia en la ciudad de Desaguadero o Arequipa y continuar trabajando  constantemente hasta tener una gran empresa.
texts.en:
Gregoria is a member of the community bank “El Comercio”, located in the Desaguadero district of Chucuito, Puno, Peru. She is 50 years old and is widowed and still cares for one of her five children (the rest have their own families). She has worked with the Manuela Ramos movement for the last 5 years. Her business is to buy and sell material and cloth. Her first loan was for 300 soles which she used to buy merchandise (different quality cloth) from the city of La Paz, Bolivia. Today she sells her merchandise in the cities of Arequipa and Puno. She has to transport her products there and this is why she needs more capital to increase her business. She is asking for a loan for 3,000 soles, which she will repay in three installations. With the loan she will buy more material from Bolivia and sell it to wholesalers. In the future she hopes to have her own home in Desaguadero or Arequipa and to continue working constantly until she has a large business.

Translated from Spanish by Rachel Crouch, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buy material/cloth

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es: Yolanda tiene 47 años, vive en la casa que heredó de su madre junto a su esposo y a su hijo con quienes se muestran como una familia muy trabajadora e involucrada con el bienestar de todos. Desde muy joven le encantaba la cocina, ya que era el lugar donde mayor tiempo pasaba con su madre, quien le enseñó las recetas que poco a poco fue aprendiendo y con el paso de los años fue creando sus propios ingredientes, hasta que un día se dio cuenta que sus dones estaban perfilados a hacer de ella una experta cocinera; y empezó con la venta de comida. Esta actividad tiene sus ventajas como trabajar dentro de su hogar, pero en contraste está el enorme sacrificio que tiene que realizar cuando hay que trasladar los alimentos y pedidos a otros lugares alejados, pues las largas horas llegan agotarla demasiado. Es por ello que desea dedicarse paralelamente a la compra y venta de automóviles, pues ella y su pareja descubrieron que es un negocio muy rentable y no requiere de esfuerzo físico, sino de capacidad de negociación. Yolanda es fiel a MFP, viene trabajado hace 3 años con la institución y tiene la intención de seguir haciéndolo, junto a su grupo, pues su integración es muy favorable. Invertirá 1000 soles en la compra de utensilios de cocina, los que requiere para mejorar la atención a sus clientes e incrementar la cantidad de porciones que vende.
texts.en:
Yolanda is 47 years old and lives with her husband and son in the house that she inherited from her mother. They are a hardworking family who cares about the wellbeing of everyone. Yolanda has always loved cooking, since she spent a lot of time with her mother in the kitchen while growing up. Her mother slowly taught her all of the recipes and over the years she began adding her own ingredients. One day she realized that she had a gift for cooking and she began to sell her food. The advantage of her job is that she gets to work from home, but it is also an enormous sacrifice to transport her food orders to faraway places. The long hours are very tiring for her. Because of this she decided to also begin working in buying and selling automobiles. She and her husband discovered that this is a very profitable business that does not require a lot of physical strength but rather a capacity for negotiation. Yolanda is loyal to MFP—she has been working with them for 3 years and intends to continue doing so, along with the other members in her group. She will invest 1,000 soles in kitchen supplies that she needs in order to improve her service for her customers and increase the amount of food that she sells.

Translated from Spanish by Rachel Crouch, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Kitchen supplies

loans.name: Esteban

texts.es:
Esteban es socio del Banco Comunal 30 de junio.
Esteban tiene un puesto en el mercado Nery García en donde vende calzados para todas las edades, sus productos los adquiere en la ciudad de Trujillo y Lima. Además Esteban es maestro constructor, actividad que realiza en sus tiempos libres.
Esteban necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de calzados escolares.
Esteban sueña con tener una tienda en un local propio y tener los ahorros suficientes para sus hijos.
texts.en:
Esteban is a member of the community bank “30 de junio”. He has a booth at the Nery Garcia market where he sells shoes for all ages. He gets his products from the cities of Trujillo and Lima. He is also a master builder in his spare time. Esteban needs a loan for 1,000 soles that he will invest in shoes for schoolchildren. He dreams of having his own store and of saving money for his children.

Translated from Spanish by Rachel Crouch, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: shoes

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es: El Señor Julio Cesar V. M. tiene 50 años de edad, su estado civil es soltero. Don Julio tiene 3 hijos y todos estudian. La actividad económica de Don Julio es brindar el servicio de transporte del personal al ingenio San Antonio. Hace mas de diez años que ofrece los servicios de transporte al ingenio San Antonio, el posee un bus que es el que ocupa para realizar los viajes y transportar al personal a los campos de corte de caña. Los propósitos de Don Julio son de seguir brindando los servicios al Ingenio. El financiamiento es para capital de trabajo ya que tiene que comprar el repuesto de llantas y combustible. La cantidad que solicita es de C$ 10.000 cordobas.
texts.en:
Mr. Julio Cesar V. M. is 50 years old and is single. Julio has 3 children who are all students. Julio works as a driver for the employees of the San Antonio plant and has done so for the last 10 years. He has a bus that he uses for the trips and he takes people out into the fields to cut sugar cane. Julio plans to continue providing his services to the plant. This loan is for working capital to buy tires and fuel. He is asking for C$ 10.000 cordobas.

Translated from Spanish by Rachel Crouch, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Lina Estela

texts.es:
Lina  es socia del Banco Comunal 30 de junio.
Lina es soltera, tiene 26 años y vive con sus padres, Lina junto a su mama tienen una tienda en donde venden abarrotes en general, bebidas, helados, realizan recargas virtuales, actividad que realiza todos los días en sus tiempos libres, Lina es estudiante de Ingeniería Química.
Lina necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de tarjetas telefónicas y recargas virtuales.
Los sueños de Lina son culminar sus estudios, ejercer su profesión y llevar sus padres de vacaciones.
texts.en:
Lina is a member of the June 30th Communal Bank. She is a single 26 year old and she lives with her parents. Lina and her mother have a store where they sell general groceries, drinks, ice cream, and virtual refills of cellphone minutes. She works every day in her free time and is also studying chemical engineering. Lina needs a loan of $325 that will be used to purchase phone cards and virtual refills for the store. Lina dreams of finishing her studies, practicing her profession, and taking her parents on vacations.

Translated from Spanish by Julia Kaplan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase phone cards and virtual refills

loans.name: Jorge Aurelio

texts.es:
Jorge es socia del Banco Comunal 30 de junio.
Jorge es casado, tiene 70 años y 12 hijos de los cuales solo 1 hija vive con ella, Jorge tiene un taller de carpintería en su casa , donde realiza trabajos a pedido de sus clientes, también compra y vende maderas.
Jorge necesita un préstamo de 3000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de maderas.
Los sueños de Jorge son incrementar su negocio y comprar una maquina para implementar su taller.
texts.en:
Jorge is a member of the June 30th Communal Bank. He is 70 years old and married with 12 children, though only one of his daughters lives with him. Jorge has a woodshop in his house where he makes custom-ordered products and buys and sells lumber. Jorge needs a loan of $950 that will be used to purchase lumber. Jorge dreams of expanding his business and buying a machine for his woodshop.

Translated from Spanish by Julia Kaplan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase lumber

loans.name: Yamille Del Carmen

texts.es: Yamille del Carmen
texts.en: Yamille del Carmen

loans.use: Working capital

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Agustin

texts.es: El señor Agustín y su esposa la señora Ana María tiene dos hijos, el labora para una empresa como `promotor donde tiene una antigüedad de 4 años, su esposa realiza platillos para su venta, ingresos que entran para el bienestar de la familia, ya que son muy unidos y responsables, ellos tienen poco tiempo obtuvieron, su casa por lo tanto desean colocarle las protecciones para mayor seguridad de su hogar e hijos.
texts.en:
Agustín and his wife Ana María have two children. He has worked as a developer for a company for four years, and his wife makes and sells meals. Their income goes toward their family's well being, as they are united and responsible. They recently obtained a house, and want to increase its protection to improve security for their home and children.

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Home protection

loans.name: Zareth Guadalupe

texts.es:
La señora Zareth Guadalupe tiene una concesión  de una C. de abarrotes y venta de diversos productos, con una antigüedad de 3 años administrando con éxito este negocio. 
La señora Zareth E. y su esposo le han ido haciendo mejoras a su casita para brindarle a la familia una mayor comodidad, lo cual hace efecto del porque están solicitando este crédito, ya que es para la construcción de una barda lateral.
texts.en:
Zareth Guadalupe owns a chain grocery store selling various products, and has run this business successfully for three years. Mrs. Zareth E. and her husband have been making improvements to their house to make their family more comfortable. They are requesting this loan for the construction of a side wall.

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construct a side wall

loans.name: Yolanda Estefania

texts.es:
La socia,  Sra.:Yolanda;  es natural del distrito D. saylla que está ubicado a 45 minutos D. la ciudad del Cusco en carro.

Ella tiene 63 años D. edad es casada y tiene 5 hijos, todos ellos casados, la Sra. Yolanda, es propietaria D. 2 chicharronerias, (es un plato elaborado con carne D. cerdo previamente cocinada y luego azada o frita, le acompaña al plato maíz dulce y papas doradas y una ensalada  D. hierba buena y cebollas); uno D. sus restaurantes esta ubicado en la ciudad del Cusco y el otro en el distrito D. saylla, el nombre D. su chicharronería se llama “korikancha”,  ella invertirá el capital D. trabajo en la compra D. carne D. cerdos y en la implementación D. sus restaurantes.

La socia agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante el banco comunal y se compromete a realizar los pagos en las fechas establecidas.
texts.en:
Yolanda is a native of the district of Saylla, located 45 minutes from the city of Cusco by car. She is 63 years old, married, and has five children, all of whom are married. Yolanda is the owner of two restaurants selling chicharrón (a dish of cooked and fried pork served with sweet corn, potatoes, and a salad of mint and onions). One of her restaurants is located in the city of Cusco and the other in the district of Saylla. Her restaurant is named "Korikancha". She will invest in the purchase of pork and the operation of her restaurants. She appreciates and values the loan from the communal bank and promises to make her repayments by the established dates.

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: San Juana

texts.es:
La señora San Juana labora para un restaurante de la ciudad, su esposo el Sr. Saúl labora para una constructora como albañil. 
Ella esta solicitando este crédito para pagar la diferencia de Infonavit para poder obtener su casita y adquirir un patrimonio familiar.
texts.en:
San Juana works in a restaurant in the city. Her husband, Saúl, works as a mason for a builder. She is seeking this loan to pay the difference to Infonavit [a home loan company] to buy their house and acquire family property.

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Acquire a home

loans.name: Cornelia

texts.es:
La socia Cornelio, es natural del distrito de saylla, este distrito está ubicado a 45 minutos de la ciudad del Cusco en carro.

La socia tiene 36 años de edad es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos de 17 y 13 años; ella alterna sus actividades domésticas con la agricultura (cultivos maíz, cebada) y la crianza de animales menores (cuyes, cerdos). La socia utilizará el préstamo, para alquilar terrenos y así poder cultivar mas productos.

La socia está muy agradecida con el préstamo otorgado y valora el apoyo dado y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos en el plazo determinado.
texts.en:
Cornelia is from the Saylla district which is located 45 minutes from the city of Cuzco by car. She is 36 years of age, lives with her partner, and has two children who are 17 and 13. She alternates her domestic activities with agriculture (farming corn and barley) and raising small animals (guinea pigs and pigs). She will use the loan to rent land and be able to grow more produce. She is very thankful to have her loan approved and values the support given and is committed to making the payments in the predetermined period of time.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Meinecke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To rent land, buy and sell animals

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita S. is a fish vendor. She is 47 years old and has 5 children. Her husband is a fisherman. Whenever her husband catches plenty of fish she sells them to her regular buyers. She also buys fish from other fishermen. She retails all the fish and earns a reasonable profit which she uses to feed and clothe her family. 

She is requesting a loan of Php 15,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy fishing materials. She will buy fishing nets as well as bait. Some of her loan she will use to start a new business. She dreamed of having a small store someday. In that way, she has another source of income to pay the tuition and book fees of her children.

CEVI provides its clients with credit assistance to manage their businesses. It also supplies training and insurance coverage to make their businesses grow.

loans.use: To buy fishing materials

loans.name: Sonia

texts.en:
Sonia E. owns a small "sari-sari" store. She is 43 years old and has 6 children. She came from a family of fisherman and her husband, Melchor E. is also a fisherman. Fishing and the sari-sari store business are their only source of livelihood. They want to increase their earnings to be able to send all their children to college. 

Sonia is asking for a loan of Php 15,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy additional stocks for her sari-sari store. And every time her husband catches plenty of fish, she will also sell fish in their village.

CEVI provides Sonia assistance to run her business, including credit, training and insurance coverage to grow her small sari-sari store.

loans.use: To buy additional merchandise for her store

loans.name: Flordelis

texts.en:
Flordelis A. is a vendor who sells fish, which she buys from fishermen in her village.  She delivers them to her regular buyers and earns enough money to cover daily family expenses.

She is 52 years old and has 3 children.  Aside from fish, she dreamed of having another business.  In the future she wants to have a small store so she can give more support to her family.

Flordelis is asking for a loan of 15,000PHP from CEVI.  She will use the loan to buy additional fish nets, bait and to repair her boat.  Fishing is her only means of livelihood. The loan will truly help Flordelis sustain her business and start a new business.

CEVI helps its clients start and have their own business. They give them credit, trainings and insurance coverage.

loans.use: To buy fishing nets, bait and repair her boat

loans.name: Mae

texts.en:
Mae D. is a "sari-sari" store owner. She is 55 years old and has one child.  She started her business using her small savings of Php 2,000.  Through the years, she was able to manage and sustain her business, which she uses to clothe and feed her family. She wanted all her children to graduate from college, so when they are older they could find better jobs to support their future families.

Mae is requesting a loan of 18,000PHP from CEVI.  She will use the loan to buy additional stock for her store. The loan will help Mae attract more customers and earn bigger income for her children.

CEVI gives its client credit, trainings and insurance coverage. Through CEVI micro financing efforts, more and more are able to start and make their business grow.

loans.use: Buy additional merchandise for her store

loans.name: Eng

texts.en:
Mr. Eng K., 61, is a widower with seven children: two sons and five daughters. The family lives in a small village along National Road Number Five, about 17 km from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. Two of his daughters are garment factory workers, one son is a motor sale commissioner, two children attend school, and the other two are married and live outside the family home.

Eng has been selling porridge for over six years. He buys ingredients from Prek Phnao market to cook and sell in his village. Eng is in the process of building new house, but he doesn’t have enough money to pay the building fee. He is requesting a loan of $1000 to use for this purpose.

loans.use: To add to his own money to finish building his house.

loans.name: Sreymom

texts.en:
Mrs. Sreymom B., 40, and her husband, Mr. Saroeun Chann, 44, married in 1985 and have four children: three sons and one daughter, who is a silk weaver. Two sons attend school, and the other one stays at home. The family lives on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia.

Sreymom has been a silk weaver for twenty-five years, a skill she learned from her mother. She sells her finished products to the middleman who then takes them to sell in Phnom Penh. Mr. Saroeun Chann has been a security guard in a company in Phnom Penh for eight years. One of her sons is in university so she is asking for her first loan of $200 to pay tuition fees for her son.

loans.use: To pay tuition fees for her son who is in university

loans.name: Sreymom

texts.en:
Mrs. Sreymom C., 36, and her husband, Mr. Mony Chhum, 40, married in 1993 and have six children: four sons and two daughters. Four of their children study at the school in the village and the others are still young. The family lives on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia.

Sreymom has been a silk weaver since 1990. It’s a skill she learned from her mother. She sells her finished products to the middleman, who then takes them to sell in Phnom Penh. She also taught her husband to become a silk weaver. Sreymom is asking for the loan of US$ 350 to purchase silk materials for her weaving business.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials for her weaving business

loans.name: Chum

texts.en:
S., 31, has been doing local farming for more than ten years in the village. She currently owns a medium-sized plot of farmland where she and her husband earn a living planting rice and some vegetables. The couple now has two children who are still young and attend school, and they live in Kompong Cham Province, Cambodia.

S.'s business is growing so she right now has gained more income. To enlarge the successful business and to earn more income, S. is applying for a loan to hire a neighbor's farmland and some farming materials for her growing crops. (She and her family are pictured.)

loans.use: To hire a neighbor's farmland and some farming materials

loans.name: Juditha

texts.en:
Juditha A. is a "sari-sari" store owner.  She is 35 years old and has 4 children.  Aside from her store, she is raising chickens in their backyard.  She and her husband are working their best to send their children to school.  Juditha dreamed of having a small eatery someday.

She has been a CEVI client for 4 years.

Juditha is asking for a loan of 14,000PHP from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy additional stock to attract customers. She believes that her loan will bring her good income.  In this way, she will have more to give her children to pay their tuition, books and other school projects.

CEVI is helping her sustain her store.  Juditha receives credit, trainings and insurance coverage to help her business grow.

loans.use: Buy additional stock for her store

loans.name: Som Oeurn

texts.en: Mrs. Som Oeurn T. is a villager in Srey Chey village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice. Her husband, Mr. Loek Tet, is a palm-juice tapper. Although they try to work hard, they still earn less than enough income to support their household. In order to improve their living conditions, Mrs. Som Oeurn T. decided to ask for a loan to buy a cow for breeding to earn more income for her family. She is 34 years old and the mother of two children who are attending the local school. Her husband is shown on the right of the photo.

loans.use: To buy a cow for breeding to earn more income for her family.

loans.name: Phanny

texts.en: Mrs. Phanny N. is a farmer in Sophy village in Takeo province. She owns a plot of land to cultivate both rice and vegetables. Her husband, Mr. Hang Morn, is a cow breeder. Since his cow breeding business is doing well, he wants to expand it. Thus, Mrs. Phanny N. decided to ask for a loan to buy two more cows for breeding to earn more income to support her family. She is 39 years old and the mother of two children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory while the other is attending the local school. She and her husband are presented in the picture.

loans.use: To buy two more cows for breeding to earn more income to support her family.

loans.name: Chinda

texts.en: Mrs. Chinda S. is a villager in Peach En village in Takeo province. She is a traditional healer. In this business, she can earn a small income to support her family. She decided to ask for a loan to buy piglets and pig food and to build a piggery for a pig breeding business. She hopes to increase her income and improve the living conditions of her family with this loan. Mrs. Chinda S. is a 36-year-old widow with two children, one of whom is a driver in a company while the other is attending the local school.

loans.use: To buy piglets and pig food and to build a piggery for a pig breeding business.

loans.name: Sophea

texts.en: Mr. Sophea N. lives in Tonle village in Takeop province, with his wife, Mrs. Meb Dynal. Mr. N. is a chicken breeder. His wife is a farmer who cultivates both rice and vegetables on a plot of land they own. On their plantation, Mrs. Dynal faces a problem because her field is far from an irrigation system. Thus, Mr. N. decided to ask for a loan to buy a pump machine to support the field to make his crop more productive. He is a 27-year-old father of a child who is too young to work or study. His wife is presented on the right of photo.

loans.use: To buy a pump machine to irrigate the field

loans.name: Chea

texts.en:
Chea N. is 52 years old and a resident of Kompong Cham Province, Cambodia, where she and her husband make a daily income by growing vegetables on their own farmland in the village. The family currently grows corn, cabbages, and rice. They are widely known in the business because they learned the skill from their grandparents.

The couple has been married for years and has five children: three are single and the others are married and live separately. The family are facing a problem due to the water system which is far away from their crops so that Chea N. is applying a loan to buy a pump for irrigating crops.

loans.use: To buy a pump for irrigating crops

loans.name: Sopheap

texts.en: Mrs. Sopheap S. lives in Sophy village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a piece of land where she cultivates rice. Aside from this plantation, she is a pig breeder. Her husband, Mr. Ang Samruol, is a construction worker. Even though they both have careers, they still do not earn enough income to support their family. Thus, Mrs. Sopheap S. decided to ask for a loan to buy two cows for breeding. She wants to earn more income to provide a better life for her family. She is 30 years old and the mother of two children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory while the other four years old and too young to work or study. Her husband is shown on the right of the picture.

loans.use: To buy two cows for breeding

loans.name: Zonie

texts.en: Zonie O. is a 44-year-old married mother of three.  Two of her children are in college, and one is in high school.  Zonie will use the money from this loan to buy more dried fish for re-sale, a venture she started with money she earned from retailing rice.  She sets up her dried fish stall on a corner in three different towns on market days, and while business is good, travel is often difficult because she lacks her own means of transportation.  She hopes to be able to save enough to buy a truck so she can haul her goods to and from the market more easily.  Zonie also wants to have enough income to support the rest of her children's education.

loans.use: To buy dried fish for re-sale

loans.name: Sidth

texts.en: Mrs. Sidth T. is a villager in Chi Chrab village in Takeo province. She is a grocer who owns a small grocery store. Her husband, Mr. Koem Ra, is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. Aside from this plantation, he is a motor taxi driver. Even though they have different businesses, they want to breed pigs to increase their income. Thus, Mrs. Sidth T. decided to request a loan to buy four piglets and pig food for breeding to earn more income to support her family. She is 29 years old and the mother of two children, one of whom is attending the local school while the other is too young to work or study. She and her husband are presented in the picture.

loans.use: To buy four piglets for breeding and pig food

loans.name: Sokhon

texts.en: Mrs. Sokhon K. is a farmer in Srae Vong village in TaK. province. She owns a piece of land where she cultivates rice. On her plantation, she faces an obstacle: she usually hires a laborer with two oxen to plow her field. For this she must pay much money. In order to solve this problem, she decided to ask for a loan to buy a second ox so she can plow her own field and reduce her expenses. Mrs. Sokhon K. is 42 years old and the mother of five children. Two of her children are employed in a garment factory while the others are attending the local school. Her husband, Mr. Horm Pao, is a motorbike middleman. Her husband is shown on the left in the photo.

loans.use: To buy a second ox so she can plow her own field and reduce her expenses.

loans.name: Lin

texts.en: Mrs. Lin C. lives in Tonle village in Takeo province. She owns a piece of land where she cultivates rice. Mrs. Lin C. is applying for a loan to buy a cow for breeding to earn more income. She is 42 years old and the mother of four children. Two of her children are employed in a garment factory while the others are attending the local school. Her husband, Mr. Chuon Chanthy, is a palm juice collector. Her husband is shown on the right in the photo.

loans.use: To buy a cow for breeding to earn more income.

loans.name: Toeur

texts.en: Mrs. Toeur S. is a farmer in Chhey Chrab village in Takeo province. She owns a plot of land where she cultivates rice. Her husband, Mr. Sok Saren, earns an income by renting out a threshing machine he owns to other villagers. Even though they both have different businesses, they still earn less income than they need to support their family. Thus, Mrs. Toeur S. decided to ask for a loan to buy timbers to build a house for her family. She is 40 years old and the mother of four children. One of her children is employed in a garment factory while the others are attending the local school. Her husband is shown on the right in the photo.

loans.use: To buy timbers to build a house for her family.

loans.name: Sorn

texts.en: Mrs. Sorn S. is a villager in Tonle village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land where she cultivates rice. Aside from this plantation, she is a Khmer cake seller. She has a problem with her plantation because she usually pays a lot of money to plow the field. Thus, Mrs. Sorn S. decided to request a loan to buy a second ox to plow the field. She is a 50-year-old widow with a child who is employed in a garment factory.

loans.use: To buy a second ox

loans.name: Yom

texts.en: Mrs. Yom S. lives in Tonle village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a piece of land to cultivate rice. Aside from this plantation, she and her husband, Mr. Meb Kang, are sellers. Since this business is going well, they want to sell door-to-door. Thus, Mrs. Yom S. decided to ask for a loan to add to her savings to buy a motorbike to sell her products. She is 43 years old and the mother of five children, one of whom is a hard-working man while the others are enrolled in the local school. She and her husband are shown in the picture.

loans.use: To add to her savings to buy a motorbike

loans.name: Rin

texts.en:
A modern wooden house located in Kompong Cham Province belongs to Mrs. C.'s family. C. is 30 years old and a mother who has given birth to two children. The children are still young and are pupils. She is married to Bun Thorn, 30, who is a taxi driver for a company.

C. currently is a domestic produce trader: She always buys produce in bulk from the farmer to store in the family home and then resell to make an income.

C. is requesting a loan of $500 in order to purchase potatos and green beans to sell. The loan will help C.'s family attain a better standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase potatos and green beans to sell

loans.name: Vannak

texts.en: Mrs. Vannak P. is a villager in Hong Heng village in Takeo province. She is a painter and a farmer who owns a small piece of land where she cultivates rice. She is applying for a loan to buy a cow for breeding to earn more income since both of her businesses cannot support the family. Mrs. Vannak P. is a 49-year-old widow with four children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory while the others are enrolled in the local school.

loans.use: To buy a cow for breeding

loans.name: Khoeurn

texts.en: Mrs Khoeurn U., a 44-year-old mother of six children, is from Sophy village in Takeo province. Three of her children attend the local school whilst the other three are in employment (including one in a garment factory and another in a bread shop). Khoeurn U. is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. Her husband, Mr En Van, is a fisherman and also a construction worker. Since En Van works far from home, he usually pays a considerable sum to take a motor taxi to work. Khoeurn U. is therefore asking for a loan to buy a motorbike for her husband in order to reduce her expense. She and her husband are both shown in the picture.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for her husband

loans.name: Vanny

texts.en: Mrs Vanny A., a 52-year-old mother of six children, lives in Sophy village in Takeo province. Two of her children are Chinese noodle sellers who own a small restaurant, and three of the children are enrolled in the local school. Vanny A. has a successful pig breeding business and wants to expand it by purchasing two more piglets. She would use the rest of loan to buy a cow for breeding. Her husband, Mr Nuon Sothea, is a farmer who owns a piece of land to cultivate rice. He is also a construction worker.  Vanny A. and her husband are both shown in the picture.

loans.use: To purchase two piglets, and also a breeding cow

loans.name: Yim

texts.en: Mrs Yim M., a 50-year-old mother of five children, lives in Sophy village in Takeo province. Three of her children are employed and the others are enrolled in the local school. Yim M. is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. Her husband, Mr Orn Sarun, is a construction worker. Although they work hard, they earn insufficient income to support their household. Yim M. has therefore decided to ask for a loan to buy a breeding cow to earn more income. She and her husband are both shown in the picture.

loans.use: To buy a cow for breeding

loans.name: Prak

texts.en: Mrs. Prak S. is 49 years old and lives in Hang Heng village in Takeo province. She is a grocer who owns a small grocery store. Her husband, Mr. Duol Kheang, is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. This couple has four children, two of whom are employed in different positions while the others stay at home to do housework and help their parents work. Mrs. Prak S. is requesting a loan to buy a sewing machine and some cloth so that her third child can earn more income. She and her husband are shown in the picture.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine and some cloth.

loans.name: Soth's Group

texts.en:
This group of borrowers consists of four people. Its leader, Mrs. Soth S., 54, is a widowed mother who has given birth to three children; all three of them are single and still live in the family home. She sell fish and some vegetables in the busy local market, which can make a daily income of about US$ 2.50 per day. To help support the family's food needs, one of her sons is a fisherman.

The family's living conditions are not so good because their house is too old and broken frequently. Therefore, Soth S. is asking for a loan to repair her old house and proposes to use half of the loan to buy fish to sell.

The other three borrowers are:

S. who sells fish in the market and needs a loan to purchase fish for sale;

T. who is a fish seller and asking for a loan to buy fishing implements for her husband's business; and

T. who has been selling for a long time and she now requests a loan to purchase more fish to sell.

The borrowers are people living in Siem Reap province, Cambodia.

loans.use: To repair her old house

loans.name: Dewa Ayu Utari

texts.id: Sebagai Ibu Rumah tangga Dewa Ayu Utari sangat tekun bekerja, Utari menjual lauk pauk berkeliling dari rumah kerumah dan juga keliling dipasar Melaya.Dengan modal awal Rp.2.000.000 Utari membeli bahan-bahan untuk lauk pauk dan juga sayur-sayuran .Jenis lauk pauk seperti sate babi,sate laut,ikan pepes pindang,tribang ,lemuru, sayur sayuran seperti srombotan klungkung,sayur urap dan plecing kangkung. Utari bangun pagi-pagi jam 4 pagi sudah berangkat kepasar melaya untuk membeli bahan-bahan yang akan dimasak .Sampai dirumah Utari sudah mulai masak beraneka macam masakan ,Utari dibantu oleh suaminya menantunya dan juga mertuanya.Pukul 12 siang Utari sudah mulai berkeliling untuk menjajakan dagangannya sampai habis,karena masakannya enak-enak dagangannya Utari tidak pernah tersisa bahkan sering ada yang tidak kebagian.Keuntungan yang diperoleh kira-kira Rp.80.000,keuntungan ini dipakai untuk memenuhi kebutuhannya karena anak-anaknya sudah semua tamat SMA dan tidak melanjutkan lagi karena tidak punya cukup biaya untuk melanjutkan keuniversitas. Rumahnya dibangun ditanah sendiri dengan bangunan yang cukup permanen. Harapannya dengan pinjaman yang diperoleh dari Dinari dipakai untuk menambah   modal usahanya.
texts.en:
As a housewife, Dewa Ayu Utari, is a diligent worker, she sells variety dishes around her house from house-to-house and also besides the Malay market. With an early funding of Rp.2.000.000 Utari buys ingredients for the variety side dishes and also vegetables. Variety dishes like pork satay, seafood satay, grilled preserved fish, and a variety of vegetables. Utari wakes up early by 4 am already headed to the Malay market to buy ingredients, which need to be cooked. Returning home, she immediately commences cooking several types of dishes. Her husband and in-laws assist Utari. By 12 noon, Utari already started her rounds peddling her merchandise until they are all sold, as her cooking is delicious thus no leftover merchandise even frequently some are insufficient to distribute. Profit earned approximately Rp.80.000, this profit will be used for fulfill their needs as the children completed high school and did not continue schooling due to inability to pay for university education. Their home built on land they owned is adequately permanent. She hopes to use this loan from Dinari as additional funding for the business.

Translated from Indonesian by Pheng Tan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: be the capital

loans.name: Margaretha Undap

texts.id: Margareta Undap seorang ibu rumah tangga yang rajin bekerja ,untuk membantu suaminya Made Sanda yang sudah pensiunan ABRI.Margareta menjual berbagai kebutuhan rumah tangga diwarungnya seperti makanan,minuman, sabun,rinso, rokok dan lai-lain. Dengan modal awal Rp.1.000.000,- Margareta  membeli bahan-bahan dipasar Melaya yang tidak jauh dari rumahnya. Margareta mulai membuka warungnya pada pagi hari pukul 09.00 pagi sampai sore hari jam 6 sore .Keuntungan yang diperoleh sebesar Rp.50.000,- perhari . Keuntungan ini dipakai untuk memenuhi kebutuhannya dan juga pendidikan  anaknya yang duduk di kelas 6 SD . Rumahnya dibangun sendiri ditanah orangtua dengan bangunan semi permanen. Harapannya dengan pinjaman yang diperoleh dari Dinari, Margareta  akan menambah modal usahanya untuk membeli tambahan barang dagangan sehingga barang dagangannya lebih lengkap dan segala kebutuhan pelanggannya tersedia. Dengan tersedianya segala kebutuhan pelanggan, Margaretha yakin penjualannya akan meningkat dan akan menambah keuntungan yang didapatnya.
texts.en:
Margareta Undap a housewife and industrious worker, helps her husband, Made Sanda, who already retired. Margareta sells various household essentials like snacks, drinks, soap, cigarettes and others in her stall. With an earlier loan of Rp.1.000.000,- Margareta buys materials from the Malay market not far from her home. Margareta begins business at her stall at 9 am in the morning until 6 pm in the evening. Profit earned daily was Rp.50.000,-. This profit is used to fulfill essentials and also her child’s education expenses, now in grade 6. Her home is self-built on elderly land with semi permanent materials. She hopes with this loan from Dinari, She can increase the business funding.

Translated from Indonesian by Pheng Tan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: be the capital to buy more merchandise

loans.name: Evelina

texts.en:
Evelina has owned a small food vendor store in the Kihesa neighborhood of Dodoma for 5 years. She belongs to Dodoma Road "A" east group loan (Group code 2018). She currently earns an average monthly profit of US$ 60. Every day she works for 9 hours at her business.

She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more food items for her business. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.

Evelina is 44 years old, married, and has two children: ages 27 and 25. She also cares for four additional dependents.

loans.use: To buy more food items for her business.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary has owned a small food vendor store and has been a chicken seller in the Kihesa neighborhood of Dodoma for 6 years. She belongs to Dodoma Road "A" east group loan (Group code 2018).  She currently earns an average monthly profit of US$ 65. Every day she works for 12 hours at her business.

 
She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more food items and chickens for her business. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.  


Mary is 37 years old, married, and has five children: ages 16, 14, 7 and 2. She also cares for one additional dependent.

loans.use: To buy more food items and chickens for her business.

loans.name: Ni Putu Susiyani

texts.id: Ni Putu Susiyani,seorang ibu rumah tangga yang punya kegemaran memelihara babi dirumahnya,disamping memelihara babi susi juga membuat jaitan dan juga kalau ada pesanan jajan pel-pelan untuk hari raya Susi juga membuatnya.Dengan modal  awal Rp.2.000.000 Susi membeli 2 ekor babi induk. Setelah dipelihara selama 6 bulan induknya mempunyai anak sebanyak 6 ekor dan induk yang satunya 7 ekor. Anak babi dipelihara selama 2 bulan dan laku terjual Rp.300.000 oerekor. Susi memberi makan babinya dua kali sehari pada pagi dan sore hari. Selain memberi dedak dan poral, Susi juga memberikan daun-daunan seperti daun pisang,daun talas, batang pisang. Sebelum diberi makan babinya dimandikan dulu dan kandangnya dibersihkan sampai bersih. Keuntungan yang diperoleh sebanyak Rp.80.000 perekor. Setelah dikurangi biaya pakan. Keuntungannya dipakai untuk membantu suaminya Ketut Gede Meirawan yang bekerja sebagai petani untuk memenuhi kebutuhan keluarga dan juga kebutuhan 1 anaknya yang berumur 4 tahun dan belum bersekolah. Pinjaman yang diperoleh dari Dinari diharapkan dapat membeli beberapa ekor babi lagi dan sisanya untuk biaya pakan babinya. Rumahnya dibangun ditanah sendiri dengan bangunan yang cukup permanen. Harapannya agar usahanya lebih maju dan berkembang.
texts.en:
Ni Putu Sisiyani, a housewife whose hobby is to rear pigs at home, besides rearing pigs, Susi also sews and also if there are requests for soft holiday snacks Susi also make them. With earlier funding of Rp.2.000.000 Susi buys 2 breeder pigs. After rearing for as long as 6 months, the breeder pigs bore as many as 6 and 7 piglets. The piglets are reared for as long as 2 months and in demand sold for Rp.300.000 each. Susi feed the pigs twice a day, in the morning and evening. Besides feeding rice and bran feed, She also gives leaves like banana leaves, taro leaves, and banana stems. Prior to feeding, the pigs are washed first and the stall cleaned. Profit earned for each pig is as much as Rp.80.000, after deducting payment for supplies. This profit will be used to assist her husband who works as a farmer to cover the family expenses, including a pre-school child aged 4. Loan from Dinari is hoped will enable the purchase of several more pigs and the balance to pay for rearing supplies. Her home is built on owned land with sufficiently permanent materials. She hopes her business will progress and develop.

Translated from Indonesian by Pheng Tan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buy piglets and feed

loans.name: Ni Wayan Wiarni

texts.id: Walaupun diusia senja,namun Ibu Wayan Wiarni harus terus berusaha karena suaminya Bapak Ketut Luwer, mengalami struk sejak satu tahun yang lalu. Wiarni memelihara banyak babi dibelakang rumahnya. Dengan modal awal Rp.2.000.000 Wiarni membeli 2 ekor induk babi ,setelah dipelihara selama 6 bulan,induk babi mempunyai anak sebanyak 6 ekor,karena tidak laku dijual akhirnya Wiarni memelihara anak babinya untuk penggemukan. Wiarni memberi makan babinya dua kali sehari pada pagi dan sore hari,selain dedak dan poral Wiarni juga memberikan daun-daunan seperti daun pisang,daun talas,batang pisang dan juga ampas tahu. Harapannya pinjaman yang diperoleh dari Dinari Wiarni akan menambah 1 induk babi lagi dan juga bibit untuk penggemukan dan sisanya untuk biaya pakan. Rumahnya dibangun ditanah sendiri dengan bangunan yang cukup permanen dan anaknya sudah menikah dan tinggal bersama suaminya.
texts.en:
Even though in her twilight years, nevertheless madam Wayan Wiarni must carry on a business as her husband, mister Ketut Luwer, had a stroke just a year ago. Wiarni rear many pigs behind her home. With earlier funding of Rp.2.000.000 Wiarni purchased 2 breeder pigs, and after rearing as long as 6 months, the breeder bore 6 piglets, as there was low demand, instead of selling them, eventually Wiarni raise the piglets to be fully grown pigs. Wiarni gives feeds to the pigs twice a day in the morning and evening, besides a mixture of rice and bran, she also gives leaves like banana leaves, taro leaves, banana stems, and also soybean pulp. Hopefully, with this loan from Dinari, Wiarni can add another breeder pig and also piglets for rearing and the balance to pay for supplies. Her home is built on owned land with materials that are sufficiently permanent and her daughter is married and living with her husband.

Translated from Indonesian by Pheng Tan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buy a saw and piglets

loans.name: Georges

texts.en: Georges is a 46-year-old married man with three children, living in Aana in the Bekaa valley in Lebanon. He has worked in landscape and agricultural care since 1995. He is asking for $1,200 for the purchase of a lawnmower and pesticide sprayer for further expansion.

loans.use: Purchase of a lawnmower and pesticide sprayer

loans.name: Salim

texts.en: Salim is a 20-year-old young man, living in Bar Elias in the Bekaa Valley. His father helped him open a shoe shop in 2006, where he sells used and new shoes. Today Salim is requesting $1,000 in order to buy a computer for better shop management.

loans.use: To buy a computer

loans.name: Urcisina

texts.en:
Urcisina C. is a sari-sari (variety) store owner. She is 37 years old and has 2 children. She started her business in 1993. Her business is doing well. She plans to make it bigger to support the needs of her family. Aside from the store, she also has a rice field. Urcisina uses her harvest to feed and clothe her family. She and her husband work together to meet their needs.

She is requesting a loan of Php 8,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy coconut wine and bananas for her store. Her loan will definitely help her to attract more customers. " With my loan, I could compete well in the market," she said.

CEVI helps people start up and run their own business. They provide credit, training, and insurance coverage to all their clients.

loans.use: To purchase coconut wine and bananas for re-sale

loans.name: Tita

texts.en:
Tita M. is a 53-year-old married mother of seven. Her husband is a farmer, and five of her children are still in high school. Tita runs a 'sari sari' store, a small variety shop that sells beverages, snacks, and everyday household staples. (The photo of Tita posted with this profile shows her out in front of her shop.) She also sells vegetables from time to time.

Tita plans to use the money from this loan to buy inventory for her store, and hopes her income will be steady enough for her to continue to support her children's education.

loans.use: To purchase inventory for a small retail variety store

loans.name: Ni Ketut Suriani

texts.id: Periode pinjaman I dengan DINARI dilalui oleh Ketut Suriani dengan hasil yang menggembirakan. Keuntungan dari penjualan babi peliharaannya setelah dipotong pokok pinjaman ke DINARI mencapai Rp.200.000,- per bulannya. Tentunya hasil ini membuat ekonomi keluarganya menjadi lebih baik dari sebelumnya karena hasil ini mampu menambah penghasilan suaminya untuk membiayai kebutuhan sehari-hari. Melihat ketekunan Ketut Suriani dalam memelihara babi maka DINARI pun kembali membantu dengan pinjaman periode II yang tentunya memang menjadi harapan Ketut Suriani. Pinjaman ke II ini mengalami peningkatan dari sebelumnya menjadi Rp.6000.000,- dengan jangka waktu 6 bulan. Pelunasan akan dilakukan pada akhir periode pinjaman dengan anggapan semua babi peliharaan sudah terjual. Ketut berencana akan membeli 8 ekor babi pada periode ini, dengan harga per ekor Rp.350.000,-. Beberapa diantaranya akan dipelihara hanya 3 bulan, sisanya baru akan dijadikan penggemukan selama 6 bulan. Uang pinjaman ini juga akan digunakan untuk membeli pakan babi selama 6 bulan masa pemeliharaan. Tentunya Ketut berharap hasil yang didapatkan akan semakin bertambah sehingga mampu membuat ekonomi keluarga menjadi lebih baik lagi.
texts.en:
The period of loan I with Dinari had completed by Ketut Suriani yielding good results. Profit from sale of the reared pigs after deducting the loan from Dinari achieving Rp.200.000,- per month. Definitely this yield improved the economic condition of the family over prior condition as this yield increased to the husband’s income for covering daily expenses. Observing Ketut Suriani’s diligence in rearing pigs, Dinari is willing to again aid with loan for period II that certainly is hoped by Ketut Suriani. This loan II will naturally increase over the prior one to Rp.6.000.000,- with a maturity period of 6 months. Repayment will be at the end of the period with the assumption that all the pigs would have been sold. Ketut plan to purchase 8 pigs for this period, costing Rp.350.000,-. Several among then will be reared for 3 months, the balance will reared up to 6 months. The money from this loan will also be used to buy supplies for the 6 months during the rearing period. Definitely, Ketut hoped the yield achieved will continuously increase until is able to improve the famil’s economic condition.

Translated from Indonesian by Pheng Tan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buy piglets and feed

loans.name: Mom

texts.en: Mrs. Mom P. is a farmer in Hang Heng village in Takeo province. She owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. Aside from this plantation, she is a rice middleman. Her husband, Mr. Lounh Sou, is a construction worker and helps with his wife’s business. Now Mrs. Mom P. is applying for a loan to buy two cows. She will breed them to earn more income and will also use them to plow the field. She is 33 years old and the mother of four children who are attending the local school. She and her husband are presented in the picture.

loans.use: To buy two cows for breeding and plowing a field

loans.name: Alice

texts.en: Alice C. is a 52-year-old mother of three children, one of whom is still in primary school.  She is separated from her husband.
