The members of the group Nyètaa are four in number and are all married women in mostly monogamous families. The women average 36 years of age and 3 children each and live in the Bananissabakoro district of Ségou on the banks of the Niger River (fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

As district neighbors, the women essentially do commerce in various goods. In order to bolster their working capital, they decided to join the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso, with which they are on their fifth group loan after having repaid the preceding loans.

This loan will be used to buy: six bolts of Wax pagnes (colorful West African cloth), two boxes of skin cream, one box of perfume, twenty sacks of charcoal, two cart-loads of firewood, and one bale of used clothing composed of shirts, pants, T-shirts, shorts, and bedsheets. Supplies of Wax pagnes and beauty products are gotten in Bamako (capital of Mali); the used clothing, charcoal, and firewood are gotten at the Ségou fair. Sales are made at the retail level, cash or credit accepted, in a shop located by the edge of the asphalt near the 1st District police station, and at the grand marketplace of Ségou. The customers are composed of men and women.

The group members hope to realize an average monthly profit of 42,500 francs CFA that will be used to repay the loan and to meet personal requirements.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothing, beauty products, firewood, and charcoal

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy merchandise for resale

loans.name: Rashida's Group

texts.en: K. Rashida is the chairperson of the Bugembe Katwe group in Jinja. She is a business woman who sells new clothes, mostly ladies’ and girls’ wear.  Recently she has added children's clothing. This is her eighteenth loan with the group. She has benefited by being able to construct rental houses as well as to pay school fees for her children, one of whom is at the University. She buys her clothes from Kampala twice a week and always has a large stock of new clothes. Rashida needs a new loan to be able to buy more clothes for sale. (The credit officer for the group, Richard, is also in the photo.)

loans.use: Buy more new clothes to sell.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet D. is thirty-three years old. She is married and has two daughters and a son, who are all currently in the basic school. She lives with her family at Kwahu Da in the Eastern region of Ghana. Janet’s husband is food crop farmer. Janet runs a grocery store to help provide for the family. She has been in business for three years. She sells items such as tins of milo, milk, sugar, bread, canned fish, etc. Janet buys her goods from wholesalers in the big cities nearby, such as Kumasi. 

She seeks a loan to expand the size of her store and also to buy goods in bulk. She hopes to increase her profit margin, which will enable her save more for her family, especially for her children’s education. She belongs to a trust bank group called Heaven. Members in this group guarantee for one another, as social collateral, in order to access loans and to support one another in handling the repayment of loans.

loans.use: To buy groceries in bulk.

loans.name: Linda

texts.en:
Linda N. is thirty-four years old. She is married and has two daughters and a son who are all currently in the basic school. She lives with her family at Kwahu Da in the Eastern region of Ghana. Linda’s husband is a food crop farmer. She also runs a table-top grocery shop to help her husband provide for the family. She has been in business for two years now.

Linda sells items such as "gari", rice, groundnuts, tins of tomatoes, milk, sugar, etc. Linda procures her goods from wholesalers in the big towns around such as Nkawkaw. She is seeking a loan to expand the size of her shop and also buy goods in bulk. She hopes to increase her profit margin to enable her to save more to support her family, especially her kids' education. She belongs to a trust bank group called Heaven. Members of this group guarantee for one another as social collateral to access the loan and support each other in handling repayment of the loan.

loans.use: To procure groceries in bulk

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy sacks of rice, corn, beans, and peanuts for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To refurbish his motor

loans.name: Felicia

texts.en:
Felicia A. is fifty-four years old. She is married and has three children – two females who have completed senior high school. The last-born, a male, is still in junior high school. Felicia lives with her husband, a farmer, and her children in Kwahwu Da, a farming community in the Eastern region of Ghana. Her husband cultivates food crops.

Felicia is a trader and has been in business as long as nine years. She trades in groundnuts (peanuts) and sells on a small table-top. Groundnuts are one of the popular food ingredients used in many homes for the preparation of soup and sauces. They have a very good flavor and people enjoy eating them roasted.

Felicia sells her groundnuts on one of the principal streets in her community where most of the townfolk are normally found. She says she buys the groundnuts from the distributors in her community and surrounding towns. She wants a loan to procure bags of groundnuts in bulk. Felicia belongs to a trust bank group called Heaven. Members in this group guarantee for one another as social collateral to access the loan and support each other in handling repayment of the loan.

loans.use: To procure bags of groundnuts in bulk

loans.name: Mutesi's Group

texts.en:
M. Mutesi is the Secretary of Bugembe Katwe group in Jinja. She is a married lady with a business selling used clothing in Jinja Central market. She has a stall where she displays her merchandise and being able to sell from one place has enabled her to win regular customers in addition to having inventory to sell to them with the help of loans.

Mutesi says that before the loans, she had a very small house with her family but now things have changed since they have expanded and still do. She needs another loan to help with buying 2 bales of clothing for sale.

loans.use: Buying 2 bales of used clothing for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a hair dryer and also beauty products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To supply his shop

loans.name: Diana

texts.en:
Besides being an entrepreneur, Diana A., 35, takes care of her four children. Three are in basic school and one has not started school yet. She wants to make sure that she is financially able to support all of her children to the highest degree of education possible. She lives with her husband, a farmer, and her children in their own house at Kwahu Da, a farming community in the Eastern region of Ghana. She also runs a grocery shop to help her husband provide for the family. She has been in business for five years now.

Diana is expecting higher profits if she receives her loan. She will be adding more products to her grocery stall in the community. Her grocery products sell very quickly after she purchases them. Also, she will be adding slippers and plastics to her store to diversify her trading.

Diana is a member of the community group called Heaven. Members in this group guarantee for one another as social collateral to access the loan and support one another in handling repayment of the loan.

loans.use: To purchase groceries in bulk.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more merchandise for resale

loans.name: Nakayenga Eva Group

texts.en:
N. Eva is 33 years of age; she is single with no children. She rents a two-roomed house where she stays alone. She eats three meals a day and her greatest expense is paying rent for her house and buying food.

N. Eva has a poultry farm where she looks after hens. She works seven days a week and she receives about three customers a day. She has done this business for five years now. The main challenge she finds in this business is that chicken feed is very expensive.

She has been with MCDT for four years now and the reason why she chooses to work with MCDT is because she needed capital to increase her stock. She has received 8 loans from MCDT. She will use this loan to increase her stock and also buy some working assets.

loans.use: increase her stock

loans.name: Emelia

texts.en:
Besides being an entrepreneur, Emelia A., 31, takes care of her four kids. Currently, all the kids are at primary school level. She wants to make sure that she is financially able to support all of her children to the highest degree of education possible. She lives with her husband, a farmer, and her children in their own house at Kwahu Da, a farming community in the Eastern region of Ghana. She also runs a grocery shop to help her husband provide for the family. She has been in business for four years now.

Emelia is expecting higher profits if she receives her loan. She will be adding more products to her grocery stall in the community. Her grocery products sell very quickly after she purchases them. Also, she will be adding soft drinks to her store to diversify her trading.

Emelia is a member of the community group called ‘Anigyee’ (meaning Happiness). Members in this group guarantee for one another as social collateral to access the loan and support one another in handling repayment of the loan.

loans.use: To purchase groceries in bulk

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: N. Grace is 32 years old. She owns a restaurant in Ibanda town which she has been running for 4 years. Grace is using the loan to purchase more cooking utensils, food, and drinks. She also wants to complete her house with 4 rooms in order to rent it out and get some money. Grace is married with one child.

loans.use: purchase more cooking utensils, food, and drinks.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Besides being an entrepreneur, Esther A., 51, takes care of her five kids. Currently, one of the males has graduated from the university and others are pursuing education in senior and junior high schools. She wants to make sure that she is financially able to support all of her children to the highest degree of education possible. She lives with her husband, a farmer, and her children in their own house at Kwahu Da, a farming community in the Eastern region of Ghana. She also runs a grocery shop to help her husband provide for the family. She sells products like evaporated milk, candies, toiletries, pomade, bottled water, etc. She has been in business for four years now.

Esther is expecting higher profits if she receives her loan. She will be adding more products to her grocery stall in the community. Her grocery products sell very quickly after she purchases them. Also, she will be adding vegetables and spices on top of table to diversify her trading.

Esther is a member of the community group called ‘Anigyee’ (meaning Happiness). Members in this group guarantee for one another as social collateral to access the loan and support one another in handling repayment of the loan.

loans.use: To purchase groceries in bulk

loans.name: Lillian

texts.en: Miss K. Lillian owns a salon in Mbarara town. She has been running the business for 6 years. She obtained the loan funds to purchase more items for the salon. Lillian is married with one child.

loans.use: To purchase more hair dryers, hair oils and hair steamers

loans.name: Nalusiba Night Group

texts.en:
N. Night is 30 years of age. She is married with three children, aged 5 months to 16 years. She rents a one-roomed house with her family and she also looks after two other children of her relatives. She has two meals a day and her greatest expenses in a month are rent for her house and food.

She operates a bar and she rents a shop to do this business; she works seven days a week and she receives about thirty customers a day. She has done this business for two years now and so far she hasn’t met any kind of challenge.

She has worked with MCDT for one year; she has also worked with her group for one year. The reason why she chose to work with MCDT is because it gives out loans without security. She will use this loan to increase her stock. And she hopes that one day she will be able to buy a plot of land and build a house.

loans.use: increase her stock

loans.name: Andrey

texts.en:
Andrey is married with one child. He owns a small business that sells pop drinks (pop and mineral water) in bulk. His business is located at the market and many retail vendors get their goods from Andrey. Low prices and good client service help him to keep repeat clients. Andrey has been in this business for 5 years. This is the only income for this family.

Andrey would like to borrow 12,000 UAH to increase the assortment. Andrey is a talented entrepreneur and wants to develop his business even further.

loans.use: to increase the assortment of drinks

loans.name: Silvio Antonio

texts.es: Silvio Antonio M. A. tiene 36 años de edad, su estado civil es casado. Don Silvio tiene 2 hijos y todos estudian. La actividad económica de Don Silvio es una joyería. Hace más de 16 años que se dedica a esta actividad ya que dio inicio a este negocio a la edad de 9 años por que su Papa le enseño y con el apoyo de los créditos ha logrado mejorar su negocio. Los propósitos de Don Silvio son de  mejorar las condiciones de su local ya que es muy pequeño. El financiamiento que el solicita es para capital de trabajo ya que tiene que comprar suficiente material para la elaboración de prendas. Sus deseos son de comprar un local propio y no pagar la renta del local que posee actualmente. La cantidad que solicita es de C$ 7.000 córdobas.
texts.en:
Silvio Antonio M. A. is 36 years of age and married. Mr. Silvio has two children who currently study. Mr. Silvio's economic activity is a jewelry store. He has worked in this job for more than 16 years and he started this business at the age of 9 when his dad taught him. With the support of the loans he has been able to improve his business. Mr. Silvio's goals are to improve the conditions of his premises since it is very small. The loan he requests is for supplies for work since he has to buy sufficient materials to make jewelry. He desires to buy his own location and not have to pay to rent the one he is currently using. The amount he requests is 7,000 Cordobas.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Meinecke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Supplies for work

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en: K. Mariam owns an electric shop with items like switches, sockets, electric wires and many others in Lyantonde trading centre. She obtained the loan funds to purchase more equipment and this will boost the business. Mariam has 1 child, age 6. She is a single mother who is working hard to obtain land and grow a banana plantation to better their lives.

loans.use: To purchase switches, sockets, and electric wires.

loans.name: Hadijah

texts.en: N. Hadijah owns a grocery shop in the central market of Mbarara. She has been in the business for 8 years and is doing well. Hadijah obtained the loan funds in order to purchase more items like rice, "posho" (cornmeal porridge), sugar, and beans to increase her inventory. Hadijah has 5 children.

loans.use: To purchase more items like rice, posho, sugar, beans, cooking oil

loans.name: Fred

texts.en: M. Fred owns a shop in Rwebikona Mbarara where he sells spare parts. He has been in the business for over 12 years. He is using the loan funds to purchase more spare parts so as to enlarge the business. Fred has 2 children whom he plans to look after well alongside the success of the business.

loans.use: To purchase more spare parts

loans.name: Haydee De Los Angeles

texts.es: La Joven Hydee de los Ángeles M. tiene la edad de 58 años, su estado civil es soltera. La actividad económica de Doña Hydee es la venta de películas y comida. Hace más de 10 años que se dedica a este negocio y en un pequeño establecimiento exhibe sus productos el desafío que ha tenido que atravesar con su negocio es  la competencia con los otros establecimientos. Los propósitos de Doña Hydee son de obtener mas mercadería ya que así podrá ofrecerles a sus clientes lo que ellos solicitan. El financiamiento es para capital de trabajo por lo que ya que invertirá en la compra de videos, películas y granos básicos. Sus deseos son de proporciónale mejoras a su establecimiento ya que no presenta las condiciones adecuadas para sus clientes. La cantidad es de C$ 3.500 crodobas.
texts.en:
Young Hydee de los Ángeles M. is 58 years of age and is single. Ms. Hydee works selling movies and food. She has worked in this business for more than 10 years and in a small stand she exhibits her products. The challenge she has had to overcome with her business is competition with other establishments. Ms. Hydee's goals are to obtain more merchandise to be able to offer her customers what they request. The loan is for business capital that will be invested in the purchase of videos, movies, and basic grains. She desires to gradually improve her establishment since the current conditions are not suitable for her customers. The amount she is requesting is 3,500 cordobas.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Meinecke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy capital

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Martin

texts.en: Mr. M. Martin is a 36-year-old businessman. He owns a grocery shop in the Butare trading centre in Ishaka. Martin has been in the business for over nine years. He is using the loan funds to purchase more items like rice, posho, cooking oil, sugar, and salt in order to expand his shop. He is married, has six children and a side income from his banana plantation.

loans.use: To purchase more items like rice, posho, cooking oil, sugar, salt.

loans.name: Namakula Rose Group

texts.en:
Namakula R. is 47 years old, and married with seven children. She rents a two-room house with her family. She has two meals a day, breakfast and lunch. Her greatest expenses are school fees for her children and rent for her house.

Namakula R. has a retail shop for her business and she buys her products from a nearby market. She works seven days in a week. She has had this business for five years now and it is her first business. Her main challenge is that since her shop is near the market she has to share her customers with so many other people doing business there. This has reduced the number of clients she has. She has been with MCDT for four years now and she has been with her group for four years. The reason why she joined MCDT is because she wanted to get capital to increase her stock. She will use this loan to buy a variety of items to sell in her shop.

loans.use: To purchase more stock

loans.name: Jackson

texts.en: B. Jackson is 50 years old and he owns a coffee plantation in the Kinyamugusha Bugomora cell in Ishaka. Jackson has been in the business for over 12 years. He is married with six children. He uses some of the profits from the business to look after the family. He is using the loan funds to work on the field in order to increase output.

loans.use: To purchase better seeds for the plantation.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more switches, sockets and electric wires

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther A. is 47 years old. She is married and has four children. She says three have graduated from senior high school and the fourth is currently studying in junior high school. She lives with her family in their own house at Kwahu Da, a farming community in the Eastern region of Ghana. Esther works hard to support her husband and provide for the family. Her husband is a farmer who cultivates food crops and all kinds of vegetables. Esther sells foodstuffs. She sells plantain, cassava, yam, etc on a tabletop by the roadside. She buys her goods from the farmers in the surrounding villages. She has been in business for four years. She also distributes the cassava and plantain to local ‘chop bar’ (restaurant) operators. She wants a loan to buy the foodstuffs on large scale so that she can cut down on costs (with less frequent trips to procure the goods) and maximize profit.

Esther is a member of the community group called Heaven. Members in this group guarantee loans for one another and support one another in handling repayment of the loan.

loans.use: To buy foodstuffs in bulk.

loans.name: Martha Guadalupe

texts.es: Martha Regina Solís Moreno tiene la edad de 34 años, su estado civil es casada. Doña Martha tiene dos varones. La actividad económica de Doña Martha es la venta de productos de limpieza. Hace más de 11 años que se dedica  a este negocio y con los financiamientos obtenidos es que compra los productos  para abastecerse lo suficiente y ofrecerlos a sus clientes. Los propósitos de Doña Martha son de comprar productos en mayor cantidad y disminuir los viajes para conseguir los productos. El financiamiento es para capital de trabajo ya que así podrá comprar los productos solicitados por sus clientes. Los deseos de doña Martha son de conseguir una mejor manera para ofrecer sus productos ya que actualmente la forma en que lo realiza es recorriendo las calles. La cantidad que solicita es de C$ 5.000 córdobas.
texts.en:
Martha Regina Solís Moreno is 34 years old and married. Martha has two sons. Martha sells cleaning products. She has had this business for more than 11 years and with the financing she is buying products to stock her business sufficiently so as to be able to sell to her customers. Martha plans on buy products in large quantities and reduce the number of trips needed to obtain the products. The financing is for working capital so that she can buy the products her customers seek. Martha wishes to find a better way to offer her products because today the way she sells is as a street vendor. She is seeking C$ 5.000 córdobas.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Pinamang

texts.en:
Pinamang A. is a 20-year-old young lady. She is single and enjoys trading, the business through which she makes a living. She completed junior high school but could not further her education due to financial difficulty. She decided to learn a trade and started selling little things like palm oil, vegetables oil, tomatoes, onions etc. on top of a table in front of their family house at Kwahu Da, a farming community in the Eastern region of Ghana.

Pinamang trades to support her mother and take care of her siblings in school. She buys boxes of tomatoes, peppers, etc from farmers who come from surrounding villages. She sells them at affordable prices. She sells mostly to households and food vendors in her community. She has been in business for the past three years. She wants a loan to buy oil and vegetables in large quantities so she can increase her profit margin.

She is a member of the community group called Heaven. Members in this group guarantee loans for one another and support one another in handling repayment of the loan.

loans.use: To procure tomatoes, palm oil, onions etc. in bulk.

loans.name: Safina's Group

texts.en: N. Safina is the chairperson of Kajekaire group in Jinja. This is the first loan the group is getting from Pearl Microfinance and they decided to do so because they wanted to improve their livelihood through recapitalizing their businesses.  Safina has a business selling new clothes for young girls and children. She moves around the trading centers in her village and to a few nearby daily markets. This is because she does not have enough stock to cater to the bigger market yet; there is a lot of taxation once you go to many markets. She has two children and she would like to see them grow into responsible citizens by educating them. Safina needs a loan to buy more clothes from Iganga.

loans.use: To buy more bales of clothing to sell.

loans.name: Bertha

texts.es:
La señora Bertha, pertenece al banco comunal “Mujeres Unidas” de la Comunidad de Carancas, distrito de Desaguadero, Provincia de Chucuito, Departamento de Puno; de 36 años de edad, no tiene hijos, y posee estudios de primaria incompleta. 
Trabaja con el movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 06 años e inicio su negocio de engorde de ganado menor (porcinos) con un préstamo de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, que invirtió en la compra de alimento y semovientes y los comercializó en las ferias locales del distrito de Desaguadero. 
Actualmente requiere un préstamo de S/. 2000.00 Nuevos soles, para poder dar un giro a su negocio e invertir en el engorde de ganado vacuno, de esta manera con el préstamo adquirirá alimento balanceado y semilla para poder mejorar sus pasturas; ello le permitirá comercializar sus vacunos a un mejor precio en las ferias ganaderas de Ilave y Pilcuyo, con las ganancias pretende adquirir mas vacunos para engorde, así como brindar una ayuda económica para sus padres. Finalmente se compromete en cumplir con los pagos de dicho préstamo, según lo acordado con las socias de su grupo.
texts.en:
Bertha belongs to the Communal Bank “Mujeres Unidas” (United Women) of Carancas, Desaguadero district, Chucuito province, Puno department. She is 36 years old, doe not have children, and did not finish primary school. She has been working with Manuela Ramos for 6 years and began her business raising small animals (pigs) with a S/.300.00 loan which she invested in buying food and livestock and sold them in the local markets in Desaguadero. Today she needs a loan for S/.2000.00 in order to be able to expand her business and invest in raising cattle. With the loan she will acquire balanced food and seed in order to improve her pastures. This will enable her to sell the cattle at a better price in the cattle markets in Ilave and Pilcuyo. With the earnings she plans to acquire more cattle to raise, and in this way provide economic help for her parents. Finally she promises to make her loan payments, according to the agreement of the group members.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in raising cattle by buying balanced food and seed for pastures

loans.name: Yevgeniya

texts.en:
Yevgeniya is married with two teenage sons. She lives in the town of Kamenka. Yevgeniya runs a business selling household items, books, gifts and office supplies. She works in one of the local markets of Kamenka. Her vending kiosk is spacious and big which allows her to re-stock her supplies and increase her inventory. Moreover, the location of her kiosk is very favorable. 

Yevgeniya has been in this business for 11 years. She has over 40,000 Grivnas invested in this business. Her monthly income is about 7,000 Grivnas. Yevgeniya fills a niche no one else works in at the market which helps her keep her sale rates high. Moreover, her natural liveliness and cheerfulness help her find new potential clients and keep friendly relationships with her fellow entrepreneurs. Yevgeniya is seeking a loan of 12,000 Grivnas to purchase additional merchandise.

loans.use: To purchase additional merchandise

loans.name: Estela

texts.es:
La señora Estela C. D. M. pertenece al banco comunal “Mujeres Unidas” D. la Comunidad D. Carancas, distrito D. Desaguadero, Provincia D. Chucuito, Departamento D. Puno; D. 51 años D. edad, tiene 6 hijos y no cuenta con estudios. 
Trabaja con el movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 07 años y se inició con un préstamo D. S/. 300.00 nuevos soles monto que invirtió en su negocio D. compra y venta D. coca en las ferias D. Desaguadero.
Actualmente ella requiere el préstamo D. S/. 2800 nuevos soles como capital adicional, para poder incrementar la oferta D. coca en los mercados regionales D. Puno y Arequipa, donD. se percibe una mayor demanda, según refiere; por otro lado pretenD. adquirir ganado para engorD., dada la alta demanda D. carne en la actualidad, con ello brindará una mejor ayuda económica a sus menores hijos.
texts.en:
Mrs. Estela C. D. M. belongs to the Communal Bank “Mujeres Unidas” (United Women) of Carancas, Desaguadero district, Chucuito province, Puno department. She is 51 years old, has 6 children, and no formal schooling. She has worked with Manuela Ramos for 7 years and began with a loan for S/. 300.00 nuevos soles which she invested in buying and selling coca leaf in the Desaguadero markets. Today she needs a loan for S/. 2800 nuevos soles as additional capital in order to be able to increase her coca leaf sales in the regional markets of Puno and Arequipa, which she experiences the highest demand. On the other hand she would also like to acquire cattle to raise, given the high demand today for meat, as it will be able to proviD. greater economic assistance to her young children.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Selling coca leaf and buying cattle to raise and sell as meat

loans.name: Yelena

texts.en:
Yelena is an entrepreneur from Kamenka. She sells bedding, towels, terrycloth robes and other bath accessories in one of the city markets. Yelena started this venture with the help of her friends who lent her the amount she needed to get going. Yelena has been in business for eight years. Currently, her turnover capital is about 10,000 Grivnas. Monthly net profit is about 3,000 Grivnas. 

Yelena loves what she is doing and is looking forward to the future. She is grateful for the opportunity this business has given, not only to provide for herself, but also to help her children. It has always been hard to provide for her family after she lost her husband and became a widow. Today she raises her younger son on her own. Her elder son lives separately. We are hoping the current loan of 7,000 Grivnas will help Yelena’s business stay stable in this spring season when crisis has affected many small businessmen all around the Ukraine. Yelena has promptly repaid 37 loans to Nadiya Ukraine without any delinquencies.

loans.use: To open an additional vending facility

loans.name: Dina

texts.es:
La señora DINA C. F., pertenece al banco comunal “Mujeres Unidas” de la Comunidad de Carancas, distrito de Desaguadero, Provincia de Chucuito, Departamento de Puno; de 40 años de edad, tiene 4 hijos, y posee estudios de secundaria incompleta (hasta tercero de primaria). 
Trabaja con el movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 07 años y su primer préstamo fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles que invirtió en su negocio de engorde de porcinos (venta como carne y en pie) y su venta en las ferias del distrito de Desaguadero y de Ilave.
Actualmente requiere un préstamo de S/. 2000.00 nuevos soles, para poder invertir en infraestructura (corrales mejorados) y adquirir mayor capital pecuario (porcinos) y alimento balanceado (afrecho, maíz molido, vitaminas, etc) con ello podrá iniciar un sistema de crianza mejorada y vender su producto en mejores condiciones de calidad a otros mercados de la región; con las ganancias pretende ampliar este negocio y ayudar a la economía familiar, finalmente se compromete en cumplir con los pagos del préstamo, según lo acordado con las socias de su grupo y con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos.
texts.en:
Dina C. F. belongs to the Mujeres Unidas ('United Women') community bank of Carancas, in the Desaguadero district of the Chucuito province. She is 40-years old, has four children, and has an incomplete secondary education (she went to school until the third grade). She has worked with the Manuela Ramos program for seven years. Her first loan was for 300 PEN that she invested in her business of fattening pigs (whose meat she then sells, traveling on foot) and in her sales at markets in the districts of Desaguadero and Ilave. Dina now needs a loan of 2,000 PEN to invest in infrastructure (improved pig pens), and to acquire better livestock and nutrient-balanced feed (bran, ground corn, vitamins, etc.). With these things she can improve her system of raising pigs and sell higher quality products than are sold at other markets in the region. With her profits she expects to expand her business and improve her family's financial situation. Finally, she promises to make her loan payments according to the agreement made by the members of her group with Movimiento Manuela Ramos.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Investment in infrastructure and purchase of more pigs and nutrient-balanced feed.

loans.name: Eugenia

texts.es:
La señora Eugenia C. C., pertenece al banco comunal “Mujeres Unidas” del distrito de Desaguadero, Provincia de Chucuito, Departamento de Puno; de 23 años de edad, con 3 hijos, posee estudios de secundaria incompleta (segundo de secundaria). 
Trabaja con el movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 5 años e inició su negocio con ventas de bebidas y compra y venta de maíz al mayor, con un préstamo inicial de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, que invirtió como capital inicial en el distrito de Desaguadero. 
Debido a la alta demanda de maíz en los mercados de Arequipa y Tacna, ella pretende ampliar su mercado como proveedora, para lo cual requiere un préstamo de S/. 3000.00 nuevos soles, que le permitirá comprar más maíz y adicionalmente pocor y distribuirlo en los referidos mercados. Finalmente se compromete a pagar las cuotas puntualmente.
texts.en:
Eugenia C. C. belongs to the Mujeres Unidas ('United Women') community bank of Desaguadero district, in the Chucuito province of the department of Puno. She is 23-years old, has three children, and has an incomplete secondary education (she finished two years of secondary school). She has worked with the Manuela Ramos program for five years. She started her business, selling drinks and buying and selling wholesale corn, with her first loan of 300 PEN, which she used as her initial capital investment in Desaguadero. Due to the high demand for corn in the Arequipa and Tacna markets, Eugenia expects to expand her market as a supplier. Therefore she needs a loan of 3,000 PEN, which will allow her to buy more corn and also popcorn, to distribute in the previously mentioned markets. Finally, she promises to make her loan payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of corn and popcorn for distribution in market.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.es: Doña Gladys es una mujer de noble corazón y muy cariñosa, sobre todo con su esposo y sus cuatro hijos a quienes ha tratado siempre de ofrecerles lo mejor para su desarrollo, y gracias a la casa que logró instalar, sus hijos han crecido bajo un techo donde pasaron los mejores años de su infancia. Su deseo de progreso la condujo a trabajar en la venta de cosméticos, actividad que con el tiempo ha aprendiendo a manejar y ha administrar, pues en un inicio tenía deudas por falta de pago, pero se percató que lo más importante es ser constante en el cobro y atender muy bien a sus clientes. Después de obtener experiencia  fue creciendo poco a poco y ahora está a punto de ser una de las jefas de promotoras de la línea que vende, pues su gran capacidad la llevaron a ser una de la mejores consultoras de belleza. Estos resultados la motivan a seguir adelante, y espera que con el tiempo no solo sea una empleada más, sino ser una directora y tener un stand de diversa variedades de productos para que las personas no tengan que esperar la entrega de sus pedidos sino tener la facilidad de encontrar los mejores productos en su tienda. Gladys trabaja con MFP más de cuatro años, este es su octavo préstamo, y junto a sus compañeras de grupo, trata de seguir trabajando con mucho compromiso y responsabilidad. Ella con los 800 soles que solicita aprovechará las ofertas de los catálogos y adquirirá grandes cantidades de productos para venderlos a mejores precios y generar ingresos adicionales en su negocio.
texts.en:
Gladys is a very noble-hearted and caring woman, especially with her husband and their four children, to whom she has always tried to offer the best for their development. Thanks to the house she was able to build, her children have grown up under a roof where they have passed the best years of their childhood. Her desire to advance led her to work selling cosmetics, which she has learned to manage over time. In the beginning, she was owed many debts, but came to realize that being constant in collection and attending to her customers was most important. After obtaining some experience, her business grew little by little and now she is about to become one of the head promoters of the line she sells, as her great abilities have made her one of the best beauty consultants. This motivates her to continue advancing, and she hopes that with time she will not be just another employee, but rather a manager with a stand of diverse products so people will not have to wait to place orders--they will have the convenience of finding better products in her store. Gladys has worked with MFP for more than four years; this is her eighth loan. Along with her group companions, she strives to keep working with much commitment and responsibility. With the 800 soles she is soliciting, she will take advantage of catalog discounts and acquire greater quantities of products to sell them at better prices and generate an additional income in her business.

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise

loans.name: Gladys

texts.es: Gladys es una mujer muy trabajadora, pues a sus 54 años logró invertir en los estudios de sus hijas quienes después de acabar sus estudios tuvieron la oportunidad de ir a trabajar al extranjero, quedando tan solo ella y su esposo en su hogar. Su habilidad con los peinados y cortes de cabello la motivaron a seguir practicando y capacitándose en la moda que hace 20 años viene realizando. En un inicio practicaba con sus hijas, quienes la apoyaban de la misma forma en la atención de sus clientes, pues en su mayoría visitaban los centros comerciales donde debía peinar y embellecer a las promotoras, lo cual le resultaba muy rentable porque tenía un ingreso seguro. Pero con el tiempo, sus hijas tuvieron la oportunidad de trabajar en el exterior y doña Gladys se quedó sola, sin embargo con el respaldo de su esposo instaló un salón de belleza dentro de su domicilio, donde trabaja y atiende todos los días, ya que esta actividad la llena de alegría y la compañía de sus clientes cubren el vacío que dejaron sus hijas. Gladis desea tener una sucursal en el mercado, donde pueda incrementar su clientela y hacer reconocida su salón de belleza. Este es su 7mo préstamo con MFP, su permanencia y esfuerzo la ayudaron a madurar en su negocio y salir adelante educando a sus hijas. La compra de  insumos para atender en un centro de belleza son costosos, pues requiere de varios productos, en los cuales invertirá Gladis 1000 soles para así seguir trabajando embelleciendo a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Gladys is a very hardworking woman. At 54 years of age, she was able to invest in the education of her daughters, who had the opportunity to travel abroad after completing their studies, leaving just her and her husband at home. Her abilities with hairstyles and haircuts motivated her to keep practicing and training in fashion as she has been for 20 years. In the beginning, she practiced with her daughters, who supported her just as much in attending to her customers. They mostly visited shopping centers where they combed and styled promoters, which she found very profitable because it was a secure source of income. But over time, her daughters had the opportunity to work abroad, and Gladys was left alone. Backed by her husband, however, she installed a beauty salon in her home, where she worked every day because this activity filled her with joy and the company of her customers filled the void left by her daughters. Gladys hopes to have a branch in the market, where she can increase her clientele and make her beauty salon known. This is her seventh loan with MFP. Her tenure and effort helped her mature in her business and get ahead educating her daughters. The inputs for working in a beauty salon are costly, and she requires various products. She will invest 1000 soles in order to keep working to beautify her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase products and goods for beauty salon

loans.name: Hermelinda

texts.es:
La señora Hermelinda C. C., pertenece al banco comunal “El Comercio”, del distrito de Desaguadero, Provincia de Chucuito, Departamento de Puno; de 27 años de edad, de estado civil casada, con 01 hijo, con estudios de primaria completa. 
Trabaja con el movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 05 años, su negocio es la compra y venta de combustible, para lo cual solicitó un préstamo de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles. 
Ella requiere tener mayor capital, para lo cual necesita un préstamo de S/. 2500.00 nuevos soles, monto que invertirá en la compra de combustible nacional al por mayor para distribuirlo a los compradores de Bolivia, para obtener ganancias y en el futuro ampliar el giro de su negocio a la venta de maíz amarillo en los mercados de Arequipa, ella decide invertir en este negocio en bien del sustento de sus hijos y es consciente de pagar sus cuotas en el momento oportuno, según lo acordado con su grupo.
texts.en:
Mrs. Hermelinda C. C. belongs to the "El Comercio" communal bank in the district of Desaguadero, province of Chucuito, department of Puno. She is 27 years old, married with one child, and has completed her primary studies. She has worked with the Manuela Ramos movement for five years. Her business is buying and selling fuel, for which she sought a loan of 300 soles. She needs better capital, and thus needs a loan of 2500 soles. She will invest this in the purchase of domestic wholesale fuel to distribute to Bolivian buyers so she can obtain her wages and in the future expand her business to sell yellow corn in the markets of Arequipa. She decided to invest in this business for the sake of supporting her children and will pay her dues in a timely manner, as determined by her group.

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase domestic fuel

loans.name: Maria Jesús

texts.es: Maria Jesús es una mujer muy amable, el amor con que habla de su esposo y sus dos hijos demuestran su gran corazón, y habitar con ellos en armonía es su prioridad. Hace poco pudo conseguir con mucho esfuerzo su propio terreno donde acaba de construir su casa. En el trascurso de su vida siempre le atrajo la cocina, pues tuvo desde pequeña el gran interés de preparar platillos en su hogar, notando su madre este interés, le fue enseñándole lo necesario para cocinar. Sin embargo, Maria Jesús no tenía en mente solo aprender, sino hacer de esta actividad un medio para empezar a trabajar, y desde hace 15 años es la única actividad económica que viene realizando. Todos los días prepara la comida para sus comensales, pues aquellos que probaron por primera vez su deliciosa sazón estuvieron muy complacidos en que pueda prepararles todos los días sus alimentos, los cuales ella se los lleva al mediodía a sus respectivos trabajos. Maria Jesús está consciente que con el tiempo las cosas irán cambiando y quiere  especializarse en la preparación de platos típicos para variar su menú y sobre todo, instalar un restaurante, donde sus clientes puedan degustar con mayor comodidad de su comida. Este es su octavo préstamo con MFP, y todo este tiempo le sirvió para ir mejorando su negocio y también para relacionarse con las personas. La compra de utensilios y mesas es indispensable para todos aquellos que se dedican a la venta de comida, pues las personas exigen higiene y comodidad. Para Maria Jesús su prioridad ahora es brindar comodidad a sus clientes, y con la cantidad que solicita podrá mejorar en la atención de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Maria Jesús is a very kind woman. The love with which she speaks of her husband and their two children demonstrates her big heart, and living in harmony with them is her priority. Recently, and with much effort, she was able to obtain her own land where she built a house. In the course of her life, cooking as always appealed to her, and she was very interested in preparing dishes in her home. She told her mother about this interest, and she began teaching Maria what she needed to know about cooking. Maria Jesús didn't just have learning in mind; she wanted to use this activity as a means to start working, and it has now been her sole economic activity for 15 years. Every day, she prepares food for her diners. Those who tried her delicious seasoning for the first time were happy to have her prepare their meals every day, and she brings food to their respective workplaces at midday. Maria Jesús is aware that things change with time, and wants to specialize in the preparation of typical dishes to vary her menu. More than anything, she wants to establish a restaurant where her customers can enjoy her food more comfortably. This is her eighth loan with MFP, and it has served her in improving her business and also allowing her to meet people. The purchase of utensils and tables is indispensable for those working in food sales, because people demand cleanliness and comfort. For Maria Jesús, the priority is offering her customers comfort, and with the loan she seeks she can improve the service to her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase cooking utensils and tables

loans.name: Stepan

texts.en:
Stepan is single. He lives in Korolyovo and runs a small business offering hairstyling services in his hometown. He is a talented and creative hairdresser who has been in business for over 10 years. His monthly income is about 5,000 Grivnas. His expenses don’t usually exceed 2,000 Grivnas a month.

Stepan has been dreaming about opening his own beauty place for awhile. He believes beauty makes this world brighter and helps people smile more often. Stepan is seeking a loan of  9,000 Grivnas which would be a significant investment in his dream.

loans.use: To open his own beauty salon

loans.name: Eric

texts.en:
Eric N. is 45 years old. He is married and has five children (two males and three females). They are all currently in school at the polytechnic, senior high and junior schools. He says one of the daughters is learning a trade. His wife trades to support him financially.

Eric lives with his family in a rented apartment in a small farming community called Nkwateng in the Eastern Region of Ghana. The major occupation of the residents, the men in particular, is farming.

Eric owns a palm plantation. He does not sell the raw, harvested palm fruits but adds value to it by producing palm oil. He also procures additional palm fruits from nearby farms to increase his production. Eric distributes to customers who come to buy in bulk and retail.

He wants a loan to procure palm fruits in bulk so that he can produce in bulk and distribute to his increasing number of customers. He aspires to complete a building project with the proceeds that will accrue from his business.

loans.use: To procure palm nuts

loans.name: Bacilia

texts.es:
La señora Bacilia A. C., pertenece al banco comunal “El Comercio”, del distrito de Desaguadero, Provincia de Chucuito, Departamento de Puno; de 43 años de edad, de estado civil casada, con 5 hijos, posee estudios de primaria completa. 
Trabaja con el movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 04 años e inició su negocio de comercialización de abarrotes al por mayor y menor con un préstamo inicial de 300 soles, que invirtió para poder incrementar su capital de trabajo en su negocio en el distrito de Desaguadero. 
En el momento ella requiere un préstamo de S/. 3000.00 nuevos soles, para poder aumentar su capital, invirtiendo en comprar 5 quintales de azúcar, arroz y otros para su negocio, con el compromiso firme de cumplir con sus pagos.
texts.en:
Mrs. Bacilia A. C. belongs to the "El Comercio" communal bank in the district of Desaguadero, province of Chucuito, department of Puno. She is 43 years old, married with five children, and has completed her primary studies. She has worked with the Manuela Ramos movement for four years. She began her retail and wholesale grocery selling business with an initial loan of 300 soles, which she invested in working capital for her business in the district of Desaguadero. Now she needs a loan of 3,000 soles to increase her capital, purchasing five quintals of sugar, rice and other goods for her business, with a firm commitment to complete her repayments.

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase five quintals of sugar, rice, etc.

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina is married. She is an entrepreneur from Vinogradovo where she sells children’s clothing in the central city market. She launched this business 5 years ago. One of the important factors of its growth has been financial assistance she received from Nadiya Ukraine. Presently, she has 15,000 Grivnas in gross income. Her monthly profit is about 4,000 Grivnas.

Marina is hoping to continue growing her business. She is requesting a loan of 7,000 Grivnas to expand her vending capacity. She believes additional funding will help her keep a stable position in the market in this time of crisis and ensure consistent development of her trade. One of Marina’s long-term goals is opening a new vending facility.

loans.use: To expand her vending business

loans.name: Moraima

texts.es: Moraima es una madre muy dulce y entusiasta, su hijo y su esposo son el reflejo del gran cariño y apoyo que les brinda, juntos vienen construyendo la pequeña casa que compraron hace varios años. Sus deseos por mejorar la llevan a que cada día sea un día de oportunidades, motivándola  a salir todas las mañanas a los supermercados donde realiza sus compras, pues su actividad es  la venta de ropa y cosméticos que distribuye a sus vecinos y amigos, a quienes deja a crédito las prendas que luego tendrá que cobrar cada semana. Esta actividad tuvo sus inicios cuando su hijo ingresó a trabajar en estas cadenas de tiendas de moda y motivó a su madre acercar estas prendas a las personas de su distrito, las que en su mayoría no tiene tiempo, ni dinero para visitar estos locales, para no tener problemas con los precios Moraima espera las liquidaciones para tener mayor capacidad de compra y vender a costos muy accesibles, este afán de progresar hicieron que tenga el anhelo de tener una boutique. Para ello viene trabajando hace 4 años con MFP, este es su séptimo préstamo, lo que ha sido de gran ayuda dentro de su negocio, como también la relación con sus compañeras de grupo con quienes cuenta siempre en diversas circunstancias. Moraima invertirá 1000 soles en la compra de mercadería en liquidación de verano y adquirir mayor cantidad de prendas que podrá ofrecer.
texts.en:
Moraima is a sweet and enthusiastic mother. Her son and husband are a reflection of the great care and support she gives them. Together, they are performing construction on the small house they bought several years ago. Her desire to improve led her to see every day as a day of opportunity, motivating her to go out every morning to the supermarkets where she does her shopping. She sells clothing and cosmetics, which she distributes to her neighbors and friends who take the clothes on credit and pay her weekly. This business began when her son started working at a chain of clothing stores and motivated his mother to bring those fashions closer to the people of her district who don't have the time or money to visit those stores. To avoid high prices, Moraima waits for sales so she can purchase more and sell at very accessible prices. This eagerness to advance comes from her desire to own a boutique. She has been working with MFP for four years; this is her seventh loan. It has been a great help to her business, and she can always count on the women in her group during any circumstance. Moraima will invest 1,000 soles in the purchase of summer sale merchandise, acquiring a greater quantity of products to sell.

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia D. is thirty-four years old. She is married and has given birth to three children, two males and one female. All of her children are currently in basic school. As a resourceful wife, Lydia trades to support her husband financially. Her husband is a professional electrician. She lives with her family in a rented apartment in a small farming community called Nkwateng in the Eastern Region of Ghana. The major occupation of the dwellers, the men in particular, is farming.

Lydia is into trading. She runs a cold store in her community. She procures her goods from big cold store operators in Kumasi, a nearby city, at wholesale prices and sells at retail prices to her customers. She says nearby smaller townfolk come to buy in cartons to retail. The majority of her customers are food vendors. Her cold store is situated by the road side.

Lydia makes good sales because of the strategic location of her store. She has been in business for eight years. She wants a bigger working capital to increase the quantity of stocks she procures. It is her dream to help her husband put up a structure for the family.

loans.use: To procure fresh fish and meat

loans.name: Facunda

texts.es:
La señora Facunda A. P. es socia del Banco Comunal “El Comercio”, en el distrito de Desaguadero, Provincia de Chucuito, Departamento de Puno; tiene 36 años de edad, ella es casada y tiene a su cuidado 04 hijos, ella acabo sus estudios de primaria completa. 
Ella Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 10 años, su negocio es el engorde de ganado menor y mayor y la comercialización de frutas según la temporada; su primer préstamo fue de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, con lo que pudo adquirir ganado menor para engorde y su venta en las ferias de Zepita.  
Actualmente ella quiere seguir trabajando con su banquito comunal, ya que le va bien en su negocio. Por ello requiere un nuevo préstamo de S/. 3000.00 Nuevos soles, el mismo que se comprometa a pagar en 03 cuotas, el préstamo le será útil para adquirir ganado menor (ovinos y porcinos) para seguir con su negocio de engorde de ganado y su venta en las ferias ganaderas de Zepita; asimismo también quiere invertir en su negocio de frutas según la temporada; su anhelo es comprarse su casa propia en Desaguadero y apoyar en los estudios de sus hijos en el colegio, hasta que sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Mrs. Facunda A. P. is a member of the "El Comercio" Community Bank in the district or Desaguadero, Chucuito Province, in the zone of Puno. She is 36 years of age, married, and has four children under her care. She has finished her primary school studies. She has worked with the Manuela Ramos Movement for 10 years. She works buying animals to fatten and to sell later and also sells fruit according to what is in season. Her first loan was for 500.00 nuevos soles, which allowed her to purchase more animals to resell in the fairs of Zepita. She currently wants to keep working with her little community bank, since it is going well for her business. She needs a new loan of 3,000.00 nuevos soles, which she will repay in 3 installments. The loan will be used to buy sheep and pigs to continue in her business of fattening livestock and selling them in the livestock fairs in Zepita. She will also continue to invest in her fruit business according to the season. Her desire is to buy herself her own home in Desaguadero and to support the education of her children until they are professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Meinecke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy livestock (sheep and pigs) and invest in her fruit business.

loans.name: Susie

texts.es: Susie tiene 33 años, se caracteriza por ser una mujer trabajadora, pues con constancia pudo brindar protección y cuidado a sus hijos y esposo con quienes vive, y quienes forman parte de un equipo de trabajo. Sus deseos de tener un hogar feliz la motivaron desde muy joven a trabajar en diversas actividades, dentro de ellas, encontró en la lavandería un negocio muy rentable, ya que las personas acuden todos los días a las lavanderías a dejar varias prendas que por motivo de tiempo y trabajo no pueden lavar. Notando esta necesidad Susie aprovechó la oportunidad e instaló en su domicilio una pequeña lavandería, que en sus inicios solo funcionaba con una solo máquina, mas ahora tiene tres, que consiguió con mucho esfuerzo. Pero ella no desea  conformarse con lo que tiene hasta ahora, sino que tiene pensado abrir sucursales, pues tanto ella como su esposo tienen la iniciativa de trabajar el doble que hasta ahora para logragralo. Este es su noveno crédito con MFP, y espera seguir desarrollándose como socia activa dentro de  su banco comunal, ya que sus compañeras son muy entusiastas y comprometidas. Con el dinero que solicita comprará insumos necesarios para el lavado de ropa y brindar permanentemente sus servicios a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Susie is 33 years old, and she is a hard worker. With perseverance she has been able to provide shelter and care for her children and husband. She lives with them, and they are part of her work team. From a young age she wished to have a happy home. This motivated her to work in various areas. Among these she found the laundromat to be very profitable. People go to the laundromat everyday to leave the clothes that they cannot wash because of time or work. Susie noticed this need, and she took advantage of the opportunity to set up a small laundromat in her home. In the beginning she only had one machine. With much effort she now has three machines. She does not want to be satisfied with what she has now. She would like to open up branch laundromats. Both she and her husband have the initiative to work double what they work now in order to achieve this goal. With the loan she is asking for she will buy the supplies needed to wash clothes and offer regular services to her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy products for her laundromat

loans.name: Kitimbwa Mixed Group

texts.en:
Proscovia Nairuba is a wedding coordinator. She does all the arranging of the wedding cake, the wedding clothes, and the decorations. In Uganda, it is traditional for special gift baskets to be prepared and given to the bride and groom in a very ceremonial way at the wedding. These baskets should be covered with decorations that match the decorations at the rest of the wedding. All of the cars involved in a wedding also have some ribbon tied around that matches the wedding’s colors. Proscovia is responsible for all of these arrangements.

For the wedding clothes, Proscovia has a dress that she rents out for 100,000 USH. This allows her to make a large profit because she can either loan her own, which makes her the most money, or she can rent one from a friend for about 40,000 USH. This means that she can earn anywhere between 60,000 – 100,000 USH just on the clothing for the wedding. Then for decorations she can earn anywhere from 80,000 – 100,000 profit per wedding.

Proscovia has 2 workers that help her with all of the arrangements needed for this business. She also has a side business selling women’s tops and bracelets. She employs two people who sell these items for her in the surrounding markets.

Proscovia and her husband have 3 kids together that they care for, and she has one, who is the oldest, that is just hers and that she provides everything for. With the money that she makes, she is now able to send this oldest girl to boarding school. This is a dream come true for her.

Proscovia is requesting a loan of 700,000 USH to purchase two veils for weddings she is coordinating this month. She will also use part of the loan to buy some more women’s tops and bracelets for re-sale.

loans.use: To purchase 2 veils, some women's tops, and some bracelets

loans.name: Marithza

texts.es:
La señora Marithza, pertenece al Banco Comunal “El Comercio”,  del distrito de Desaguadero, Provincia de Chucuito, Departamento de Puno, de 20 años de edad, de estado civil soltera, no tiene hijos, y posee estudios de secundaria completa.
Trabaja con el movimiento Manuela Ramos hace un año, ella se dedica a la venta de golosinas y galletas al mayor y productos variados (enseres de primera necesidad), su primer préstamo fue de 500 nuevos soles para mejorar su capital de trabajo.  
Ella desea solicitar un nuevo préstamo de S/. 1500.00 nuevos soles,por lo que se compromete en pagar en 03 cuotas mensuales,con dicho créditos lo invertiría para mantener su negocio y adquirir nuevos productos tales como: arroz en saco, fideos en bolsa, azúcar en bolsa, etc; los que serán distribuidos en el mercado local de Ilave, finalmente se compromete a pagar puntualmente su préstamo.
texts.en:
Marithza is a member of the Community Bank "El Comercio" of the Desaguadero District in the Province of Chucuito in Puno. She is 20 years old and she is single. She does not have any children and she completed high school.

She has been with the Manuela Ramos (Kiva Field Parnter) movement for the past year. She sells sweets and cookies wholesale and other varied products (primary needs items). Her first loan was for 500 nuevos soles and used it as working capital funds.

She requests a new loan of S/.1500 nuevos soles, which will be repaid in 3 monthly installments. With said loan, she will invest in the maintenance of her business and to acquire new products such as: sacks of rice, bags of pasta, bags of sugar, etc. These products will be sold in the market in Ilave. And finally, she promises to pay back her loan on time.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase new products such as rice, pasta, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Asana

texts.en:
Asana G. is married and the mother of one girl who has yet to start school. She is 33 years old. She lives with her daughter and husband in a rented apartment in a small farming community called Nkwateng in the Eastern Region of Ghana. The major occupation of the residents, the men in particular, is farming. Her husband works with a local road-construction firm.

Asana sells beverages to support her husband financially. She prepares porridge, tea, wheat porridge, rice porridge, oats, etc., and sells them in the mornings. Asana sells on a table by the roadside with the help of an assistant. She also sells some of the beverages in the local school compound to the pupils. She procures her materials from Kumasi at cost-effective prices.

Asana has been in business for four years. She says she wants a loan to buy the materials in bulk. It is her dream to help her child have access to a good education.

loans.use: To procure provisions to make beverages

loans.name: Yrma

texts.es: Yrma es una mujer muy laboriosa y comprometida con su trabajo y con su familia, pues es madre de tres hijos y junto a su esposo adquirieron una cada donde viven y trabajan al mismo tiempo. En el pasado, su papel de joven madre la limitó a realizar algunas actividades, pero encontró la manera de romper los límites e instaló en su casa un restaurante, donde toda la familia trabaja desde hace 20 años y no tuvo que descuidar la atención de sus hijos, por el contrario, ellos fueron de gran apoyo, logrando juntos, que su negocio sea uno de los más concurridos en su distrito. Además, lo que atrajo a las personas a este restaurante fue la deliciosa sazón de Yrma, y gracias a la demanda pudieron mejorar y ampliar su local, el cual por el pasar de los años se ha ido deteriorando y necesita remodelaciones, pues desea tener un restaurante reconocido y prestigioso, y para conseguirlo requiere de mucha inversión pues las remodelaciones son muy costosas. El iniciar este crédito con MFP la está ayudando a hacer sus deseos realidad, y espera que con el trascurrir de los años pueda ser una cliente permanente. Yrma tiene proyectado invertir 3000 soles en la reparación del techo de su local, pues su mal estado perjudica el adecuado servicio y ambiente que sus clientes merecen.
texts.en:
Yrma is a hardworking woman and very dedicated to her work and to her family. She is mother of 3 children and together with her husband they acquired a home where they live and work at the same time. In the past, her life as a young mother limited from her activities, but she soon found a way to break through those limits and set up her home inside of a restaurant, where the family has been working for the past 20 years. She didn't have to leave her children, but quite the opposite, they were of great support to her, together working to make their business one of the best in their district. In addition, what was most attracted customers to this restaurant was Yrmas delicious cooking, and thanks to the great demand they were able to improve and expand their business. But with the passage of time it has been deteriorating and needs renovations. She dreams of having a restaurant that is well known and prestigious, and to attain that dream she needs significant investments, given that renovations are so costly. She contacted MFP (Kiva Field Partner) and they are helping her to make her dreams a reality and she hopes that with the passing years she will be a permanent client. Yrma has planned to invest 3000 soles in the roof renovations of her business. The poor state of the roof impedes adequate service and the ambiance that her clients deserve.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To repair her restaurant's roof.

loans.name: Maura

texts.es:
Maura tiene sesenta y dos años no obstante su alegría es contagiante y el optimismo con que mira hacia el futuro también. Ella junto con su esposo maneja una zapatería  ubicado en un local propio situado dentro de un mercado.

Desde 1991, que se animaron a poner un negocio propio. Anteriormente su esposo trabajaba en un a compañía como electricista. Una vez que abandono aquel trabajo por su jubilación no dudó en abrir una zapatería pues él ya tenia conocimientos sobre refacción de zapatos. 

Maria lleva cinco años contando con los préstamos de EDAPROSPO, gracias a ellos a podido implementar mejor la zapatería. Por ahora desea mantener la producción y cantidad de trabajo. Por otro lado, ella también es propietaria de un auto que lo hace trabajar como taxi para poder contar con un ingreso más de dinero y con ello poder pagar los estudios de su menor hijo.
texts.en:
Maura is 62 years old, but her happiness and the optimism with which she looks towards the future is contagious. She, together with her husband, manages a shoe store located in their own shop in a market. In 1991 they decided to venture out and set up their own business. Previously her husband worked for a company as an electrician. Once he left his job on retirement he didn't hesitate to open up a shoe store because he had shoe-repair knowledge and skills. Maura has been with EDAPROSPO (Kiva Field Partner) for the past 5 years, and thanks to them she has managed to improve the shoe store. For now she wishes to maintain the production and quality of the business. She is also the owner of a car that she uses as a taxi to be able to have a second source of income, to be able to pay their youngest son's tuition.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase materials for the shoe store.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Faustina

texts.en:
Faustina B. is married and the mother of one boy. Her son has completed junior high school and is currently learning a trade. She is 39 years old. Faustina lives with her son and her husband in a rented apartment in a small farming community called Nkwateng in the Eastern Region of Ghana. The major occupation of the residents, the men in particular, is farming. Her husband is a mason by profession and a farmer as well.

Faustina is into trading activities. She sells textile materials and other fashion accessories, such as dressing bags, wristwatches, footwear, etc. She sells in her community by hawking.

Faustina procures her goods from Accra and other nearby cities. She has been in this business for 12 years and wants a loan to buy variety of accessories. It is her dream to help her child to have access to the best education.

loans.use: To buy fabrics and fashion accessories

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es:
La señora Mercedes A. C., pertenece al banco comunal “El Comercio” del distrito de Desaguadero, Provincia de Chucuito, Departamento de Puno; de 45 años de edad, de estado civil casada, con 5 hijos, con estudios de primaria completa. 
Trabaja con el movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 2 años e inició su negocio  de venta de bebidas y golosinas (gaseosas, galletas, cerveza) y productos de primera necesidad según la demanda del mercado. Para este negocio ella realizo un préstamo inicial de 300.00 Nuevo  soles.
Actualmente ella requiere un préstamo de 2,500.00 Nuevo soles, para poder comprar más mercadería tales como: cajas de galletas, golosinas, paquetes de gaseosas, enlatados frescos, cerveza enlatada, etc.  Así como arroz, azúcar fideos en saco, De tal forma que pueda ampliar su negocio y convertirse en distribuidor al por mayor, lo que permitirá generar más ganancias  y mayor solvencia económica familiar. Asimismo ella se compromete en pagar sus cuotas puntuales según lo acordado con su grupo.
texts.en:
Mrs. Mercedes A. C. belongs to the community bank El Comercio in the Desaguadero district of the Chucuito province in the Puno zone. She is 45 years old, is married, has 5 children, and has completed her primary school studies. She has worked with the Manuela Ramos movement for 2 years. She started her business of selling drinks, sweets (sodas, cookies, beer), and other much needed products according to the market demand. For this business she received an initial loan of 300.00 PEN. Now she needs a loan of 2,500.00 PEN to be able to buy more merchandise like: boxes of cookies, sweets, sodas, canned goods, beer, rice, sugar, packaged noodles, etc. This way she could increase her business and become the best distributor. This would generate more earnings and lead to better economic solvency for her family. She promises to make her payments on time as agreed upon by her group.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise like cookies, soda, rice, sugar, noodles, etc.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama A. is 35 years old. She is married and has given birth to one daughter and two sons. One of her children is in senior high school while the rest are in the basic school. She lives with the children and her husband in a rented apartment in a small farming community called Nkwateng in the Eastern Region of Ghana. The major occupation of the residents, the men in particular, is farming. Her husband works with a local forest division.

Ama sells beverages to support her husband financially. She prepares porridge, tea, wheat porridge, rice porridge and oats, and fries doughnuts as well. She sells on a table by the roadside from the afternoon until evening.

Ama procures her materials from Kumasi at cost-effective prices. She has been in business for six years. Ama says she wants a loan to buy the ingredients in bulk. It is her dream to help her children have access to a good education.

loans.use: To procure ingredients

loans.name: Susi Alejandrina,

texts.es:
Susi, junto con su esposo, maneja una carpintería donde fabrican todo tipo de muebles. El negocio ya lleva más de diez años en funcionamiento. 

La idea de tener una carpintería provino de su esposo, quien antes se dedicaba a la cocina, trabajando en una pollería. Luego de ello, trabajó como chofer. En ese entonces, ambos iban ahorrando parte de sus ganancias en sus respectivos trabajos, pues la idea de abrir una carpintería ya la tenían y necesitaban empezar comprando las principales máquinas para el taller.

Anteriormente, Susi también estuvo trabajando en la pollería, pero poco a poco ha ido aprendiendo todo lo necesario para hacer que su desempeño en su carpintería sea cada vez mejor.  Su esposo le ha ido enseñando a lo largo de los años y hoy en día, ella es especialista en los acabados de os muebles y lijado de la madera.
texts.en:
Susi, together with her husband, has a carpentry business in which they make all types of furniture. They have been in business for more than ten years.

The idea to have a carpentry business came from her husband, who worked before as a chef in a chicken restaurant. After that, he worked as a driver. Back then, both of them were saving part of their earnings from the respective jobs, but they already had the idea of running a carpentry and they needed to start buying the basic tools for their shop.

Before, Susi also worked in the chicken restaurant, but little by little she has been learning the necessary skills to make her carpentry better and better. Her husband has taught her over the years, and today she specializes in sanding and finishing the furniture.

Translated from Spanish by Shaun Haines, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of wood

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Betty Barzaba

texts.es:
La señora Betty Barzaba A. G. es socia del Banco Comunal “Virgen de Guadalupe”, del barrio central, en el distrito de Pomata, Provincia de Chucuito, Departamento de Puno; tiene 48 años de edad, de estado civil casada, tiene 06 hijos y posee estudios de primaria incompleta (quinto grado). 
Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 12 años, ella posee una tienda de abarrotes, su primer préstamo fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, monto que invirtió en la compra mercaderías para su tienda. 
Actualmente requiere un préstamo adicional de S/. 1200.00 nuevos soles, el mismo que se comprometa a pagar en 05 cuotas mensuales, con dicho préstamo ella desea implementar y mejorar su tienda, es decir adquirir algunos andamios mas y completar con mercadería variada (bebidas, abarrotes de primera necesidad, aceites, leche, etc.), con lo cual podrá satisfacer la necesidad de sus clientes y obtendrá mejores ingresos, su anhelo es brindarles una adecuada educación a sus hijos, y es por ello que viene empeñada en ahorrar sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Betty Barzaba A. G. is a member of the “Virgen de Guadalupe” Community Bank of the Barrio Central in the Pomata district of Chucuito province, in the Puno region of Peru. She’s 48 years-old, married, has six children and has a 5th grade education. She owns a grocery store and has been working with the Manuela Ramos Movement for 12 years. She used her first loan of 300 soles to purchase merchandise for her store. Now she needs an additional loan of 1200 soles, which she is committed to repaying in 5 monthly installments. With this loan she wants to improve her store i.e. purchase some more shelving and stock a wider variety of merchandise (beverages, basic groceries, oil, milk, etc.) to satisfy her customers’ needs and make better profits. Betty is saving up so that she can give her children a good education.

Translated from Spanish by Carolyn McCaffrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To improve her store and purchase merchandise (beverages, oil, milk etc.)

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica B. is 38 years old. She is married and has given birth to three daughters and three sons. The first five children are all in the basic school while the last-born has yet to start school. She lives with the children and her husband in a rented apartment in a small farming community called Nkwateng in the Eastern Region of Ghana. The major occupation of the residents, the men in particular, is farming whereas some of the women are into trading activities. Her husband is a cocoa and palm-nut farmer.

Vero is a fishmonger. She procures fresh fish and smokes it herself. She also fries some fish for sale. She sells on a table in the market square but distributes the greater part to retailers and food vendors in and around her community.

Vero procures fresh fish from cold stores in the nearby cities. She has been in business for four years. Vero says she wants a loan to procure fresh fish in bulk. It is her dream to help her husband put up a structure for the family and to give their children a good education.

loans.use: To procure fresh fish

loans.name: Ruth Manuela

texts.es:
La señora Ruth es socia del Banco Comunal “Virgen de Guadalupe”, en la comunidad de Sajjo, en el distrito de Pomata, Provincia de Chucuito, Departamento de Puno; tiene 37 años de edad, de estado civil casada, tiene 03 hijos y posee estudios de secundaria completa. 
Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 12 años, ella se dedica al engorde de ganado mayor (toros) y la venta de golosinas, su primer préstamo fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, monto que invirtió en la compra de mercadería para su negocio (golosinas y bebidas). 
Ella requiere un préstamo adicional de S/. 1200.00 nuevos soles, el mismo que se comprometa a pagar en 05 cuotas mensuales, con dicho préstamo ella desea adquirir ganado menor (ovejas y porcinos) para someterlos a engorde y posteriormente venderlos como carne; asimismo desea adquirir mas mercadería (golosinas) además de bebidas y otros; de esta manera ella piensa invertir todas sus ganancias en la implementación de una sastrería puesto que su esposo es “sastre” y se dedica a esta actividad, con ello desea brindar una adecuada educación a sus hijos a nivel superior.
texts.en:
Ruth is a member of the “Virgen de Guadalupe” cooperative bank, located in the Sajjo community, Pomata district, in Puno. She is 37 years old, married, has 3 children, and completed her education through secondary school. She has been working with the Manuela Ramos movement for 12 years. She dedicates herself to raising livestock (bulls) and to selling sweets/snacks. With her first loan of 300.00 Peruvian soles, she invested in the purchase of merchandise for her business (snacks and beverages). She requires a loan of 1,200.00 additional soles, which she commits to repaying in 5 monthly installments, to buy additional animals (sheep and pigs) to raise, fatten, and subsequently sell as meat. Concurrently, she would like to buy additional merchandise (snacks), beverages, and other items. She is thinking about investing all her earnings into implementing a tailor’s shop, since her husband is a tailor and dedicates himself to this activity. With this, she would like to provide an adequate education for her children up to advanced levels.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase small livestock to raise and fatten.  To buy sweets/snacks, beverages and other items.

loans.name: Ruben

texts.es:
Ruben trabaja de transportista, tiene una movilidad de servicio publico Trufi inter- ciudad La Paz El Alto, es su principal fuente de ingreso con la que cubre la manutención de sus tres pequeños hijos y esposa. Viven en la casa de sus padres  ubicada en la zona de Pasankeri de la ciudad de El Alto, junto a la familia de su hermano.

El crédito lo destinara para la compra de material de construcción para la construcción de una pared que separe las dos familias que habitan en la misma casa.
 
Es el segundo crédito via Kiva, el buen comportamiento de pago permite aprobarle otro préstamo solicitado.
texts.en:
Ruben works in transportation, providing service between La Paz and El Alto. This is his primary source of income, with which he supports his three small children and wife. They live in his parents’ home, located in the Pasankeri zone of the city of El Alto, along with his brother’s family. The loan would be destined for construction materials to build a wall to separate the two families that reside in the same house. This is his second loan with Kiva.
