His previous good history of repayment allows him to be approved for another loan request.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase construction materials to build a wall to separate the households of two families that live in the same house.

loans.name: Margarita,

texts.es:
Desde hace quince años Margarita maneja su negocio de alquiler de videojuegos y venta de bebidas. Al inicio, su esposo era el encargado de este negocio, no obstante cuando él consiguió un puesto de trabajo en otro lugar, fue Margarita quien se hizo cargo del negocio.

Tiempo después, tuvo que hacerse cargo también del cuidado de sus dos hijos, muy pequeños en ese entonces, motivo por el cual abandono la atención en su negocio, pues la casa donde vivía quedaba muy lejos de donde estaba el quiosco. Una vez que su esposo se fue a trabajar al extranjero, hace casi diez años aproximadamente, ella se mudo a vivir con su suegra, gracias a la ayuda de ella retomo su negocio. Ahora solo sale a trabajar por las tardes.

Hoy en día tiene planes de mudar el local de su negocio a su actual vivienda, para lo cual necesita construir un espacio más y trasladar los equipos de videojuegos a su casa. De este modo, alquilaría la otra casa que quedaría libre para ser habitada por algunos inquilinos.

Las ganancias de su trabajo las destina para los gastos básicos del día a día. Su esposo es quien se encarga de mantener el hogar enviándole dinero del extranjero.
texts.en:
For fifteen years Margarita has managed her videogame rental and beverage sales business. At the beginning, her husband was in charge of running the business, however when he found a job in another place, it was Margarita who took over. A little while later, she had to take charge of the care of her two children, very young in those days, and for this reason she had to give up her business, because the house where she lived was very far away from the store. Once her husband went to work in another country, about ten years ago, she moved to live with her mother in law, and thanks to her help, Margarita returned to her videogame rental business. Now she goes to work in the afternoon. Today she has plans to move her store into her current home, so she needs to build a bigger space and bring the videogame machines to her house. This way, she will rent the other building, which will be free for her to rent out to some tenants. Margarita uses the earnings from her work to pay her basic day-to-day expenses. Her husband is the one who maintains the home, sending her money from the exterior.

Translated from Spanish by Shaun Haines, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Hospital debts due to her daughter's illness.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Cecelia

texts.en:
Cecelia T. is 28 years old. She is married and has given birth to four children -- two males and two females -- who are all currently in the basic school. Her husband is a palm nut farmer. Cecelia lives with her family in a rented apartment in a small farming community called Nkwateng in the Eastern Region of Ghana. The major occupation of the residents, the men in particular, is farming. Most of the women, however, are into trading activities.

Cecelia produces palm oil out of palm nuts. She procures palm fruits from nearby farms to add to what she harvests from her husband’s farm. She distributes to customers who come to buy in bulk and retail.

She wants a loan to procure palm fruits in bulk so that she can produce the oil in bulk and distribute it to the increasing number of her customers. She aspires to give her children the best of education.

loans.use: To procure palm nuts

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
La señora Ruth Manuela Achata Gómez es socia del Banco Comunal “Virgen D. Guadalupe”, en la comunidad D. Sajjo, en el distrito D. Pomata, Provincia D. Chucuito, Departamento D. Puno; tiene 37 años D. edad, D. estado civil casada, tiene 03 hijos y posee estudios D. secundaria completa. 
Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 12 años, ella se dedica al engorD. D. ganado mayor (toros) y la venta D. golosinas, su primer préstamo fue D. S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, monto que invirtió en la compra D. mercadería para su negocio (golosinas y bebidas). 
Ella requiere un préstamo adicional D. S/. 1200.00 nuevos soles, el mismo que se comprometa a pagar en 05 cuotas mensuales, con dicho préstamo ella desea adquirir ganado menor (ovejas y porcinos) para someterlos a engorD. y posteriormente venderlos como carne; asimismo desea adquirir mas mercadería (golosinas) además D. bebidas y otros; D. esta manera ella piensa invertir todas sus ganancias en la implementación D. una sastrería puesto que su esposo es “sastre” y se dedica a esta actividad, con ello desea brindar una adecuada educación a sus hijos a nivel superior.
texts.en:
La señora Ruth Manuela Achata Gómez es socia del Banco Comunal “Virgen D. Guadalupe”, en la comunidad D. Sajjo, en el distrito D. Pomata, Provincia D. Chucuito, Departamento D. Puno; tiene 37 años D. edad, D. estado civil casada, tiene 03 hijos y posee estudios D. secundaria completa. Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 12 años, ella se dedica al engorD. D. ganado mayor (toros) y la venta D. golosinas, su primer préstamo fue D. S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, monto que invirtió en la compra D. mercadería para su negocio (golosinas y bebidas). Ella requiere un préstamo adicional D. S/. 1200.00 nuevos soles, el mismo que se comprometa a pagar en 05 cuotas mensuales, con dicho préstamo ella desea adquirir ganado menor (ovejas y porcinos) para someterlos a engorD. y posteriormente venderlos como carne; asimismo desea adquirir mas mercadería (golosinas) además D. bebidas y otros; D. esta manera ella piensa invertir todas sus ganancias en la implementación D. una sastrería puesto que su esposo es “sastre” y se dedica a esta actividad, con ello desea brindar una adecuada educación a sus hijos a nivel superior.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Para adquirir más mercaderías como galletas,bebidas,frutas.

loans.name: Maria Antonia,

texts.es:
Con la idea de hacerse de un ingreso extra para algunos gastos en el hogar, Maria Antonia se animo a ayudara una amiga muy cercana a vender cosméticos por catálogo. Poco a poco fue adquiriendo experiencia en el negocio, así que se convirtió después de dos años en una socia del negocio de su amiga prácticamente.

El cuidado de su casa y de sus menores hijos es lo que le ocupa la mayor parte del tiempo a Maria Antonia; sin embargo, en un futuro ella quisiera ser titular del negocio de productos de belleza y poder vender en mayores cantidades. Por ahora es su esposo, quien trabaja como electricista, y las hijas mayores son quienes se encargan de velar por el mantenimiento de la casa.
texts.en:
With the intention of earning some extra income for household expenses, Maria Antonia decided to help a close friend sell cosmetics from a catalog. Little by little she gained experience in the business. After two years she became business partners with her friend. The majority of her time is spent taking care of her house and her youngest children. Nevertheless, in the future she would like to run her own beauty products business and be able to sell larger quantities. For now her husband, who works as an electrician, and her oldest daughters are the ones who are responsible for providing for the upkeep on the house.

Translated from Spanish by Matthew Raimondi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To help pay for the studies of her youngest daughter, who studies languages at the university.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca A. is 35 years old. She is a divorced mother of one daughter and two sons. One of her children is in junior high school while the rest are in the basic school. She lives alone in a rented apartment in a small farming community called Nkwateng in the Eastern Region of Ghana. Her children are living with their father in Accra, the capital city.

The major occupation of the residents of Nkwateng, the men in particular, is farming. Rebecca, however, sells beverages in her community. She prepares porridge, tea, wheat porridge, rice porridge and oats, and fries eggs and popcorn. She sells from the afternoons until evening. She sells on a table by the roadside.

Rebecca procures her materials from Kumasi at cost-effective prices. She has been in business for four years. Rebecca says she wants a loan to buy ingredients in bulk. It is her dream to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To procure ingredients

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es:
La señora Maria Elena es socia del Banco Comunal “Unión 28 de Julio”, del distrito de Yunguyo, Provincia de Yunguyo, Departamento de Puno; tiene 42 años de edad, de estado civil casada, tiene 03 hijos y posee estudios de segunda de primaria. 
Ella Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 12 años, ella se dedica a la preparación de comidas su primer préstamo fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, monto que invirtió en la compra de insumos (papa, chuño, habas, carne, etc.) para preparar sus comidas.  
Actualmente desea prestarse la cantidad de S/. 700.00 Nuevos soles, el mismo que se comprometa a pagar en 03 cuotas mensuales, ello le servirá para poder comprar maíz, arroz y fideos, aceite, chuño, etc. en cantidad, lo que le permitirá continuar con su negocio de comidas, su anhelo es contar con un restaurante grande en el futuro para poder abastecerse a todos sus clientes, asimismo desea educar a sus hijos y brindarles apoyarles hasta que sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Señora Maria Elena is a member of the July 28th Union Communal Bank, in the District and Province of Yunguyo, Puno Department, Peru. She is 42 years of age, in a civil marriage with three children, and has attended primary and secondary schools. She has been working with Manuela Ramos / CrediMUJER for twelve years. Her work involves the preparation of meals, and her first loan of 300 New Sols was invested in the purchase of the ingredients (potatoes, dried tubers, lima beans, meat, etc.) which she uses to prepare her meals. At present she wishes a loan in the amount of 700 New Sols which she intends to repay in three monthly installments. This loan will be used to purchase corn, rice, noodles, oil, dried tubers, etc. in bulk. This would allow her to continue selling her meals. She hopes some day to have a large restaurant so as to be able to provide for all of her customers. Likewise, she would like to educate her children and give them the support they need to become professional people.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Para la compra de maíz,arroz,fideos,aceites,chuño,etc en cantidad

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther A. is a mother of five children: two sons and three daughters. She is fifty years old. One of her children is currently in teacher training college while the rest are in senior and junior high schools. Esther lives with her children and husband in a family house in a small farming community called Nkwateng in the Eastern Region of Ghana. The major occupation of the dwellers, the men in particular, is farming. Her husband is a cocoa/palm nut farmer.

Esther produces palm oil. She buys palm nuts from the local farmers and adds those to what she harvests from her husband’s farm. She distributes to retailers in her community. Esther has been in business for over fourteen years and wants a loan to buy palm nuts in bulk. It is her dream to help her children to climb the academic ladder to higher heights.

loans.use: To procure palm nuts

loans.name: Mbaye

texts.fr: Madame F. MBAYE est vendeuse de céréales au marché de Bambey au Senegal, une petite ville à 130 km de Dakar.  Son petit boutique est situe au milieu du marché ou tous les gens de Bambey achètent leur nourriture, et elle a beaucoup d’amies qui travaillent a cote d’elle.   Cette dame vivante demande ce crédit pour reconstituer son stock de céréales locales.  Avec cette revenue elle aide son mari dans les dépenses de la famille.
texts.en:
Ms. F. MBAYE is a retailer of grain at the marketplace of Bambey (in Senegal), a small city 130 km from Dakar. Her small shop is located in the middle of the marketplace, where everyone in Bambey buys their food. She has many friends who work at her side. This vivacious lady is asking for a loan to replenish her stock of local grains. With these earnings, she helps her husband with family expenses.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy grain

loans.name: Frida Ceferina

texts.es:
La señorita Frida Ceferina C. A. es socia del Banco Comunal “Corazones unidos”, en el distrito de Desaguadero, Provincia de Chucuito, Departamento de Puno; tiene 24 años de edad, de estado civil soltera, no tiene hijos y posee estudios de secundaria completa 
Ella Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 02 años, ella inició posee un negocio de venta de ropa al por menor (casacas, chompas, pantalones, etc.), su primer préstamo fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, con lo que pudo adquirir mercadería para su negocio.  
Sin embargo su negocio no le brindo muchas ganancias por lo que decidió cambiar de rubro y dedicarse a la venta de frutas y verduras, donde si pudo obtener buenas ganancias, actualmente desea mejorar este negocio por ello viene solicitando un préstamo adicional de S/. 1800.00 Nuevos soles, el mismo que se comprometa a pagar en 04 cuotas, con dicho préstamo desea adquirir mas mercaderías, es decir frutas según la temporada y verduras al por mayor  para poder venderlos en las ferias de Desaguadero y otras zonas. El futuro ella piensa colocar un bazar propio donde pueda tener productos de diferentes marcas comerciales (ropa al por mayor) que en cantidad da buenas ganancias.
texts.en:
Frida Ceferina C. A. is a member of Corazones Unidos Communal Banc, in the district of Desaguadero, province Chucuito, department Puno,in Peru; she is 24 years old, and has completed secondary studies. She is single, and has no children. She has been working with Movimiento Manuela Ramos for 02 years, and started to have her own clothing retail business (jackets, sweaters, pants, etc.). Her first loan was for S/. 300.00, which enabled her to buy merchandise for her business. However, her business did not do very well, and she decided to try a different type of business. Now she sells fruits and vegetables, and is doing very well. She would like to improve her business, so she is requesting a loan of S/. 1800.00, which she will repay in 04 installments. With the loan, she hopes to purchase merchandise -- seasonal fruits and whole sale vegetables to sell at the Desaguadero street market and markets in other districts. She hopes to one day have her own store where she can sell all different brands of clothing in whole sale, since selling good-sized amounts is profitable.

Translated from Spanish by Hannah Lily, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing seasonal fruits

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Anna E. is a mother of six children: two sons and four daughters. She is forty years old. Two of her children have completed senior high school. Currently, some are in the junior high and primary schools. She lives with her children and husband in a family house in a small farming community called Nkwateng in the Eastern Region of Ghana. The major occupation of the dwellers, the men in particular, is farming.

Her husband is a cocoa/palm nut farmer while Anna is into palm oil production. She buys palm nuts from the local farmers and adds these to what she harvests from her husband’s farm. She distributes to retailers in her community. Anna has been in business for over fifteen years and is well experienced. She wants a loan to buy palm nuts in bulk. It is her dream to help her children to climb the academic ladder to higher heights.

loans.use: To procure palm nuts

loans.name: Georgina

texts.en:
Georgina A. is fifty-one years old. She is married and has given birth to two children: both females. She says her first daughter is married while the other is currently in junior high school. Her husband is a palm nut and cocoa farmer. Georgina lives with her husband and second daughter in a rented apartment in a small farming community called Nkwateng in the Eastern Region of Ghana. The major occupation of the dwellers, the men in particular, is farming. Most of the women, however, are into trading activities and palm oil production.

Georgina produces palm oil out of palm nuts. She procures palm fruits from nearby farms and adds these to what she harvests from her husband’s farm. She distributes to customers who come to buy in bulk and for retail. Georgina wants a loan to procure palm fruits in bulk so that she can produce the oil in bulk and distribute to the increasing number of her customers. Georgina aspires to give her children the best education.

loans.use: To procure palm nuts

loans.name: Cinthia Isabel,

texts.es:
A pesar de no tener más responsabilidad que la de su propio crecimiento como persona, sobre todo en lo profesional, Cinthia no desaprovecha las oportunidades que se le presentan cuando de poner un negocio propio se trata.

Hasta hace medio año estuvo vendiendo útiles escolares ofreciéndolos de casa en casa, a amigos o familiares. En ese entonces, aún seguía cursando sus estudios de educación inicial. Anteriormente, había trabajado como profesora adjunta en un colegio donde estuvo durante dos años y medio. No obstante, hace poco ha conseguido un puesto como profesora en un colegio cerca a su casa. 

Cuando este mas estable y disponga de tiempo para organizarse, le gustaría volver a tener un negocio propio en el cual invierta su dinero y su tiempo libre. Tal vez alquile un local en el cetro de Chosica para abrir un puesto de comida.
texts.en:
Despite not having any further responsibilities besides her own personal growth, above all professionally, Cinthia takes advantage of the opportunities that present themselves when they concern running her own business Up until 6 months ago she was selling school supplies door to door to friends and acquaintances. During this time she continued her studies to be a grade school teacher. Previously she worked as an adjunct teacher in a school for two and a half years. Nevertheless, recently she was able to get a position as a teacher at a school near her house. Once she is more stable and has the time to get organized, she would like to once again have her own business in which she can invest her money and free time. Perhaps she will rent a storefront in the downtown Chosica so that she can open a food stall.

Translated from Spanish by Matthew Raimondi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase materials to make decoritive handicrafts.

loans.name: Ndiolle

texts.fr: Madame Ndiolle D. est une restauratrice à Bambey, une petite ville à 130 km de Dakar.  Elle prépare les repas sénégalais traditionnels et elle les servit au gens du marché.  Elle vend aussi des produits cosmétiques, par exemple, les effets de toilettes et Thiouraye, un produit que les femmes utilisent pour que leurs chambres sentent bonnes.  Elle est mère d’une fille, et son mari est un menuisier qui travaille à coté d’elle, dehors le restaurant.  Elle sollicite ce crédit pour renforcer ses activités de commerce.  Elle va acheter plus de produits cosmétiques pour mieux servir ses clients.
texts.en:
Ms. Ndiolle D. is a restaurant owner in Bambey, a small city 130 km from Dakar. She makes traditional Senegalese meals and serves them to people at the marketplace. She also sells cosmetics, for example, toiletries and Thiouraye, a product that women use for making their bedrooms smell nice. Ndiolle is a mother with one daughter, and her husband is a furniture-maker who works adjacent to her outside the restaurant. She's requesting this loan to bolster her commerce. She's going to buy more cosmetics, so as to serve her customers better.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cosmetic products that she sells in the restaurant

loans.name: Rufina

texts.es:
La señora Rufina C. C. es socia del Banco Comunal “Corazones unidos”, del barrio Central, en el distrito de Desaguadero, Provincia de Chucuito, Departamento de Puno; tiene 40 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, tiene 01 hijo y posee estudios de secundaria completa 
Ella Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 02 años, posee un negocio de venta de productos de higiene y limpieza (Cremas dentales, cremas para zapatos, pilas, etc.) y accesorios (escobillas, cepillos, etc.), su primer préstamo fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, con lo que pudo adquirir mercadería para su negocio.  
Ella desea seguir mejorando su negocio por ello viene solicitando un préstamo adicional de S/. 1100.00 Nuevos soles, el mismo que se comprometa a pagar en 04 cuotas mensuales, con dicho préstamo desea adquirir más mercaderías para su negocio (accesorios de higiene y limpieza), productos que comercializará en las ferias de Desaguadero. Ella desea comprarse una casa en el futuro, así como un automóvil para ponerlo en servicio y finalmente brindarle una profesión a su hijo.
texts.en:
Rufina C. C. is a member of the Corazones Unidos ('United Hearts') community bank in the Central neighborhood of Desaguadero district, which is in the Chucuito province of the department of Puno. She is 40-years old, has a live-in partner, one child, and finished schooling through secondary school. She has worked with Movimiento Manuela Ramos for two years and owns a business selling personal hygiene and cleaning products (toothpaste, shoe polish, wash basins, etc.) and accessories (toilet brushes, scrubbing brushes, etc.). Her first loan was 300 PEN, which she used to buy merchandise for her business. Rufina wishes to continue improving her business, therefore she is requesting an additional loan of 1,100 PEN which she promises to repay in four monthly payments. With this loan she hopes to buy more merchandise (cleaning and personal hygiene accessories) which she will sell in the Desaguadero street markets. Rufina hopes to buy a house in the future, as well as a car to hire out for service. Finally, she hopes to provide her son with the opportunity to become a professional.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of personal hygiene and cleaning merchandise for sale

loans.name: Yessica Katia,

texts.es:
Ocho años es el tiempo que Yesista lleva trabajando en una librería dentro de la Universidad La Cantuta, en Chosica. Hasta hace un tiempo también se encargaba de vender cosméticos por catálogo como titular, sin embargo una socia la estafo y decidió abandonar el negocio. Hoy en día ha vuelto a vender cosméticos pero solo eventualmente y a través de otra persona. 

A sus treinta y tres años, Jessica, sueña con poder estudiar la carrera de Administración alguna vez para poder manejar una empresa propia. Por ahora se contenta al ver a su hijo estudiar en un colegio poli técnico donde toma clases de gestión empresarial. Además de su hijo de quince años, tiene a uno de siete. Ambos son su principal motivo de trabajo. 

Junto con su esposo, quien trabaja como mantenimiento en la misma universidad que ella, se ocupa de los gastos del hogar y de sus hijos.
texts.en:
For 8 years Yessica has been working at a bookstore at the University La Cantuta in Chosica. For a while she also ran a business selling cosmetics from a catalog. However, a business partner swindled her and she decided to abandon the business. Recently she has decided to begin selling cosmetics again but only occasionally and through another person. At 33 years old, Yessica dreams of being able to take courses in management so that she can run her own business. For now she is content to see her son study at a polytechnic school where he takes classes in business management. Besides her fifteen year old son, she also has a seven year old. They are her principal motivation to work. Together with her husband, who works maintenance at the same university as her, they work to pay for the household expenses and expenses related to their children.

Translated from Spanish by Matthew Raimondi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To pay for the school expenses of her two children

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
La señora Juana es socia del Banco Comunal “Corazones unidos”, del barrio Unión, en el distrito de Desaguadero, Provincia de Chucuito, Departamento de Puno; tiene 44 años de edad, de estado civil casada, tiene 05 hijos y posee estudios de secundaria completa 
Ella Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace un año y medio, ella se dedica a la venta de abarrotes al por mayor y menor, así como productos de higiene y limpieza, su primer préstamo fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, monto que sirvió como capital adicional para adquirir mercadería variada para su negocio.  
Actualmente la Sra. Juana requiere un préstamo de S/. 1200.00 Nuevos soles, el mismo que se comprometa a pagar en 04 cuotas mensuales, con dicho préstamo podrá adquirir mercaderías surtida para su negocio (azúcar, arroz, aceite, leche, bebidas, etc.), con ello podrá en el futuro comprarse un carro, puesto que ese es su anhelo.
texts.en:
Juana is a member of the Corazones Unidos ('United Hearts') community bank in the Unión neighborhood of Desaguadero district, which is in the Chucuito province of the department of Puno. She is 44-years old, has a live-in partner and five children, and completed secondary school education. She has worked with Movimiento Manuela Ramos for a year and a half and works selling groceries, in bulk and retail, as well as personal hygiene and cleaning products. Her first loan of 300 PEN served as working capital to purchase a variety of merchandise for her business. Now Juana needs a loan of 1,200 PEN, which she promises to repay in four monthly payments. With this loan she can acquire a good selection of merchandise for her store (sugar, rice, oil, milk, drinks, etc.). Her business will allow her to buy a car in the future, since that is her wish.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise such as sugar, rice, oil, milk, and drinks to stock her business.

loans.name: Augustina

texts.en:
Augustina D. is a widowed mother of five children: three girls and two boys. The first-born is in senior high school while the rest are in the junior high and primary schools. She is 39 years old.

Augustina lost her husband barely a month ago and is still in the period of mourning, hence her dark dress. She lives with the children in a rented apartment in a small farming community called Nkwateng in the Eastern Region of Ghana. The major occupation of the residents, the men in particular, is farming.

Augustina runs a provisions shop to make some earnings to provide for the children. She sells provisions like milo (a chocolate malt milk beverage), milk, bread, tea bags, oats, etc. Augustina’s shop is by the roadside. She also trades in other goods such as cosmetics, fabrics, slippers, etc., from the nearby towns. She procures her goods from Kumasi and Accra at cost-effective prices. Augustina has been in business for 24 years.

She says she wants a loan to buy the materials in bulk and expand her business. It is her dream to help her children to have access to a good education.

loans.use: To procure provisions

loans.name: Petrona

texts.es:
La señora Petrona C. D. R. es socia del Banco Comunal “Unión 28 D. Julio”, en el barrio progreso, distrito D. Yunguyo, Provincia D. Yunguyo, Departamento D. Puno; tiene 59 años D. edad, D. estado civil casada, tiene 05 hijos y posee estudios D. primaria completa. 
Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 01 año, ella se dedica a la artesanía en miniatura (fabrica D. autos D. metal en miniatura) para la venta en ferias costumbristas, su primer préstamo fue D. S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, monto que invirtió en la compra D. materiales (lata, aluminio y pintura) para su trabajo artesanal. 
Ella requiere un nuevo préstamo D. S/. 1500.00 Nuevos soles, el mismo que se comprometa a pagar en 03 cuotas mensuales, con el dinero piensa adquirir mas materiales al por mayor (lata, aluminio, pintura, estaño, crema soldadora, etc.) a fin D. continuar elaborando sus productos artesanales y tener mercadería disponible, ella tiene el anhelo D. adquirir en el futuro una casa en la ciudad D. Puno o Juliaca, por ello viene ahorrando sus ganancias D. su negocio. Asimismo agradece a Manuela Ramos por el apoyo brindado, ya que los préstamos que le dan le sirven para poder realizar las actividades  que a ella mas le gusta.
texts.en:
Petrona C. D. R. is a member of the Unión 28 D. Julio ('Union of July 28') community bank in the Progreso neighborhood of Yunguyo district, which is in the Yunguyo province of the department of Puno. She is 59-years old, has a live-in partner and five children, and completed primary school education. She has worked with Movimiento Manuela Ramos for a year. Petrona makes miniature handicraft (factory that makes model cars from metal) which is then sold at traditional folk art fairs. Her first loan of 500 PEN was invested in the purchase of materials (tin, aluminum, and paint) for her craft work. Petrona needs a new loan of 1,500 PEN, which she promises to repay in three monthly payments. With this money she would like to acquire materials at wholesale prices (tin, aluminum, paint, pewter, soldering paste, etc.), in order to continue her craft work and have merchandise available. Petrona wishes to buy a house in Puno or Juliaca in the future, therefore she is saving the profits from her business. In addition, she is grateful to Manuela Ramos for its support, as the loans they give her enable her to do the activities that she likes.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of materials such as tin, aluminum, paint, pewter, etc.

loans.name: Felicia

texts.en:
Felicia Boamah is 50 years old. She is married and has given birth to seven children: three females and four males. She says two of her children have completed university and two have completed senior high school, while the others are in basic school and learning a trade.

Her husband is a palm nut farmer. She lives with her husband and children in a family apartment in a small farming community called Nkwateng in the Eastern Region of Ghana. The major occupation of the inhabitants, the men in particular, is farming. Most of the women, however, are into trading activities and palm oil production.

Felicia produces palm oil out of palm nuts. She procures palm fruits from nearby farms to add to what she harvests from her husband’s farm. She distributes to customers who come to buy in bulk and retail. She wants a loan to procure palm fruits in bulk so that she can produce the oil in bulk and distribute it to the increasing number of her customers. Felicia aspires to give her children the best education.

loans.use: To procure palm nuts

loans.name: Julia,

texts.es:
Ofreciendo productos D. acero quirúrgico a hospitales y colegios Julia trabajo por veinte años. Estos productos ella los conseguía a bajo precio gracias a un contacto cercano en las fabricas D. acero. No obstante, el año pasado terminó por abandonar este negocio pues dejó D. ser rentable para ella, ya que el precio D. los productos empezaron a encarecerse. 

A raíz D. esto, se animó a emprender un negocio distinto. El año pasado se asoció a una compañera para poder vender productos D. belleza por catálogo.

Cuando empezó a trabajar D. joven las ganancias D. su trabajo siempre las destinó para la construcción D. su casa. Su esposo, cuando estuvo en vida, la ayudó con los demás gastos D. a la casa, lamentablemente el falleció hace tres meses. Ahora ella se encarga D. la educación D. su hijo menor, mientras que los mayores la apoyan con el mantenimiento D. la casa.
texts.en:
Julia sold surgical steel products to hospitals and schools for twenty years. She was able to obtain these products at lower prices thanks to a close contact at the steel factories. Nevertheless, last year she decided to abandon the business after it ceased to be profitable as the prices of her products went up. Right after this she decided to undertake a new business. This past year she partnered with a female friend to sell beauty products from a catalog. When she was young and began working, her earnings always went towards the construction of her house. Her husband, when he was still alive, helped with the other household expenses. Unfortunately, he died three months ago. Now she is in charge of the education of her youngest son, while the older children help with the upkeep of the house.

Translated from Spanish by Matthew Raimondi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To pay for university studies of her youngest son.

loans.name: Yacine

texts.fr: Madame Yacime N. est une femme mariée qui fait de petits commerces au marché de Bambey, une petite ville à 130 km de Dakar.  Elle vend du poisson sec et du poisson fumé.   Ce crédit le permit de renforcer la marchandise sur sa petite cantine dont les revenues lui permettent de soutenir son mari sur les dépenses familiales.   Son boutique est situe a l’intérieur du marché ou on a mit des toitures pour se couvrir du soleil.  Il y a beaucoup d’autres vendeuses a cote d’elle, mais son sourire attire les clients.
texts.en:
Ms. Yacime N. is a married women who is a small-scale merchant at the marketplace of Bambey, a small city 130 km from Dakar. She sells dried and smoked fish. This loan will enable her to enhance the merchandise in her cantine, which provides the income enabling her to support her husband in covering family expenses. Her shop is located within the marketplace, where roofing has been put up as cover against the sun. There are many other retailers adjacent to her, but her smile attracts the customers.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fish

loans.name: Adwoa

texts.en:
Adwoa M. is 32 years old. She is married and has four children, two females and two males. She says her children are currently in junior high and primary school. Her husband is a palm nut and cocoa farmer. Adwoa lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a small farming community called Nkwateng in the Eastern Region of Ghana. The major occupation of the inhabitants, the men in particular, is farming. Most of the women, however, are into trading activities and palm oil production.  
Adwoa produces and sells palm oil out of palm nuts. She procures palm fruits from nearby farms and adds to what she harvests from her husband’s farm. She distributes the oil to customers who come to buy in bulk and retail. Adwoa wants a loan to procure palm fruits in bulk so that she can produce the oil in bulk and distribute to her increasing number of customers. She aspires to give her children the best education.

loans.use: To procure palm nuts in bulk

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Para la compra de telas y venderlos al por mayor.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary A. is 42 years old. She is married and has two children, a boy and a girl. Both of her children are currently in the basic school. Her husband is a palm nut and cocoa farmer. Mary lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a small farming community called Nkwateng in the Eastern Region of Ghana. The major occupation of the inhabitants, the men in particular, is farming. Most of the women, however, are into trading activities and palm oil production.

She produces and sells palm oil out of palm nuts. Mary procures palm fruits from nearby farms and adds to what she harvests from her husband’s farm. She distributes to customers who come to buy in bulk and retail. Mary wants a loan to procure palm fruits in bulk so that she can produce the oil in bulk and distribute to her increasing number of customers. She aspires to help her husband give their children the best education.

loans.use: To procure palm nuts in bulk

loans.name: Sadick

texts.fr: Monsieur Sadick  D. est un vieux qui habite au quartier Ngandeck à BAMBEY , une ville à 130 km de Dakar.  Il vent du mil, des aliments pour le bétail, du café et du sucre au marché de Bambey  ou il y a beaucoup d’ambiance.  Pendant la journée il y a trop de soleil, donc il a construit une toiture pour protéger lui et ses amis qui vendent près de lui.  Son crédit lui permet de renforcer sa petite boutique.   Avec ces revenues il peut soutenir sa famille.
texts.en:
Mr. Sadick D. is an elderly man who lives in the Ngandeck district in BAMBEY, a city located 130 km from Dakar. He sells millet, livestock feed, coffee, and sugar at the Bambey marketplace, where there is a lot of ambiance. During the day, there is too much sun, so he has built a roof to protect him and his friends, who sell near him. His loan will allow him to bolster his small shop. With his income, he can support his family.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy millet, feed, coffee, and sugar

loans.name: Porfirio,

texts.es:
Empezó vendiendo solamente productos para la higiene personal, como shampoo jabón cremas etc. Al inicio no contaba con el capital para poder tener un puesto estable, por lo que se dedicaba al comercio ambulante. Poco a poco, Porfirio se las fue ingeniando para crecer en su negocio, es así que no desaprovechó las temporadas especiales de venta como las campañas navideñas, escolares, etc.

A sus cincuenta años, se decidió finalmente por tener un local dentro de un centro comercial pequeño en el centro de Chosica. Alquiló un puesto para poder vender durante todo el año útiles escolares. Hoy, luego de cinco años y gracias a su gran esfuerzo no solo cuenta con un local, sino con tres al mismo tiempo donde también ha añadido un pequeño espacio para la venta de productos tecnológicos además de lo usual.  

Las ganancias de su trabajo siempre lo ha vuelto a invertir es por eso que hoy no se sorprende por todo lo que ha obtenido. En el futuro el se ve con e mismo negocio pero tal vez con otro puesto mas de su librería.
texts.en:
In the beginning Porfirio only sold personal hygiene products, such as soaps, creams, etc. At first he did not make enough money to have a permanent storefront so he sold his goods by walking around. Little by little Porfirio came up with ways to grow his business. He took advantage of seasonal products, selling items for Christmas, school, etc. At 50 years old, he finally decided to open a storefront inside of a small commercial center in downtown Chosica. He rented a stall so that he could sell school supplies year round. Today, after five years and thanks to a lot of hard work, Porfirio has not only one storefront, but runs three at the same time and has added a small space to sell technology products in addition to his normal items. He has always reinvested his earnings in his business and for this reason it is not surprising that he has achieved such great success. In the future he will continue to run his business and perhaps will open another bookstore location.

Translated from Spanish by Matthew Raimondi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise: school supplies

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce D. is 38 years old. She is married and has six children, three males and three females. According to her, some of her children are currently in senior high and junior high schools. The rest, however, are still in basic school. Her husband is a carpenter by profession. Joyce lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a small farming community called Nkwateng in the Eastern Region of Ghana. The major occupation of the inhabitants, the men in particular, is farming. Most of the women, however, are into trading activities and palm oil production.  
Joyce, like most of the women in her community, is into palm oil production. She says she procures palm fruits from the local farmers and nearby farms. She distributes to customers who come to buy in bulk and retail. Joyce wants a loan to procure palm fruits in bulk so that she can produce the oil in bulk and distribute to her increasing number of customers. She aspires to help her husband give their children the best education.

loans.use: To procure palm nuts in bulk

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en:
Comfort O. is 58 years old. She is married and has six children, four daughters and two sons. Five of the children are out of school and living independently. The last-born is in basic school. She lives with some of the children and her husband in a family house in a small farming community called Nkwateng in the Eastern Region of Ghana.

The major occupation of the dwellers, the men in particular, is farming. Some of the women are into trading activities. Her husband is a cocoa and palm nut farmer. Comfort is a fishmonger. She procures fresh fish and smokes it herself. Sometimes she also buys smoked fish to sell. She sells on a table at the market square and distributes the greater part to retailers and food vendors in and around her community. Comfort procures fresh fish from cold stores in the nearby cities. She has been in business for 30 years and has a lot of experience. She says she wants a loan to procure fresh fish in bulk. It is her dream to help her husband put up a structure for the family and give their children a good education.

loans.use: To procure fresh fish in bulk

loans.name: Herminia

texts.es:
La señora Herminia es socia del Banco Comunal “Virgen de Guadalupe”, en el barrio Central, distrito de Pomata, Provincia de Chucuito, Departamento de Puno; tiene 49 años de edad, de estado civil casada, tiene 03 hijos y posee estudios de superior incompleta (educación). 
Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 12 años, ella se dedica a la artesanía y la compra y venta de bebidas (gaseosas), su primer préstamo fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, monto que invirtió en la compra de materiales para poder elaborar productos artesanales (lana, hilo, agujas etc.). 
Actualmente ella requiere un préstamo adicional de S/. 1000.00 nuevos soles, el mismo que se comprometa a pagar en 05 cuotas mensuales, con dicho préstamo ella desea adquirir bebidas al por mayor (gaseosas de diferentes marcas y presentaciones) para pode distribuirlo en las tiendas de Pomata; su anhelo es contar con una tienda de artesanías en la ciudad de Puno o en Cusco, a fin de poder ofrecer sus tejidos a los turistas y poder obtener mas ganancias, por ello viene trabajando con gran esmero.
texts.en:
Señora Herminia is a member of the Virgin of Guadelupe Communal Bank, in the Barrio Central, district of Pomata, province of Chucito, Puno Department, Peru. She is 49 years old and is in a civil marriage with three children. She has attended secondary school but has not graduated. She has been a client of Manuela Ramos / CrediMUJER for twelve years while devoting herself to artisanship and the sale of soft drinks. Her first loan was for 300 New Sols which she invested in the purchase of materials such as wool, thread and needles for making her handcrafts. Presently, she is requesting an additional loan of 1,000 New Sols which she intends to repay in 5 monthly installments. With this she intends to acquire beverages, mostly soft drinks of different brands and styles, in order to distribute them to stores in Pomata. She would very much like to have her own artisan's shop in Puno City or in Cuzco so as to be able to offer her handcrafts to tourists and thus obtain more profits. She is working towards this with great diligence.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Para adquirir bebidas de diferentes marcas y presentaciones.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia A. is married and the mother of three children, one girl and two boys who are all in basic school. She is 32 years old. Lydia lives with the children and her husband in a rented apartment in a small farming community called Nkwateng in the Eastern Region of Ghana.

The major occupation of the dwellers, the men in particular, is farming. Her husband is a farmer while she trades and farms. Lydia is a food vendor. She cooks rice/stew and yam slices and sells at the market. She also sells ready-made textiles. She hawks to sell the textiles in her community. Lydia procures her goods from Accra and from distributors who come to her community. She has been in business for seven years and wants a loan to buy foodstuffs, ingredients and variety of textiles. It is her dream to help her children have access to the best education.

loans.use: To buy foodstuffs and textiles

loans.name: Danny Marilu,

texts.es:
Junto con su esposo y con veintiocho años de edad, Marilú atiende en un pequeño restaurante ubicado dentro de un centro comercial de su localidad. El local no es propio, pero por lo pronto es lo mejor que tiene para este negocio que lleva recién dos años en funcionamiento.

Anteriormente ella se dedicaba a la venta de comida en su propia casa, pero fue su hermana quien le recomendó del local en el aquel centro comercial, al cual Marilú accedió para trabajar con su esposo.

Él se dedica a la cocina y ella a la tensión de los clientes. Además de este negocio también, Marilú es propietaria de una mototaxi, que lo alquilan. Con las ganancias del restaurante y de la moto, ambos mantienen el hogar y velan por la crianza  de su único hijo de casi dos años.

Más adelante le gustaría agrandar el local de su negocio o buscar otro, pues el que tienen es pequeño para la cantidad de clientes que reciben diariamente.
texts.en:
Together with her husband, 28 year old Marilú takes care of a little restaurant located inside a market in her neighborhood. She doesn't own the location, but it's the best spot available for her restaurant, which recently celebrated its second year in business. Before, Marilú worked selling food out of her own house, but it was her sister who recommended the spot in the market, and Marilú agreed to go work there with her husband. Her husband takes care of the cooking and Marilú attends the customers. Besides this business, Marilú also owns a mototaxi, which she rents out. With the earnings from the restaurant and the mototaxi, she and her husband maintain the household and watch over the upbringing of their only son, who is almost two years old. In the future she would like to increase the size of her restaurant, or look for another bigger location, because the one they have now is a little small for the number of customers they serve every day.

Translated from Spanish by Shaun Haines, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of bulk ingredients at wholesale prices

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Daria

texts.es:
La señora Daría C. D. G. es socia del Banco Comunal “Unión 28 D. Julio”, del cercado, en el distrito D. Yunguyo, Provincia D. Yunguyo, Departamento D. Puno; tiene 48 años D. edad, D. estado civil casada, tiene 05 hijos y posee estudios D. primaria incompleta (tercer grado). 
Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 08 años, ella se dedica a la artesanía en metal, su primer préstamo fue D. S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, monto que invirtió en la compra D. materiales para producir sus productos (carros en miniatura) para las ferias tradicionales D. la región.  
Ella requiere un préstamo D. S/. 2800.00 Nuevos soles, el mismo que se comprometa a pagar en 03 cuotas mensuales, el dinero lo invertirá e la compra D. materiales en cantidad (lata, metales, estaño, pasta, etc.) para continuar elaborando sus productos, ya que se acerca la feria D. las “Alasitas” donD. tiene mayor demanda. Su anhelo es comprarse una casa en la ciudad D. Tacna, así como adquirir una movilidad para poder trasladarse juntamente con sus productos a las distintas ferias y fiestas costumbristas.
texts.en:
Daría C. D. G. is a member of the “Unión 28 D. Julio” Communal Bank in the district of Yunguyo, in the province of Yunguyo, in the Puno area. She is 48-years-old, married and has 5 children. She completed her elementary school studies up to the third graD.. She has worked with Movimiento Manuela Ramos for 8 years. She works with metal handicrafts. Her first loan was for 300 nuevos soles, a sum that she invested in the purchase of materials to make her products (miniature cars) for the traditional fairs of the area. She is requesting a loan of 2800 nuevos soles, the same amount that she has agreed to repay in 3 monthly installments. She will invest this money in the purchase of a large amount of materials (tin, metals, pewter, polish, etc.) in order to continue working on her products, since the "Alasitas" fair is coming up and her products will be in high demand. Her wish is to buy a house for herself in the city of Tacna as well as a car to be able to carry her products to the various fairs and traditional fiestas.

Translated from Spanish by Tara Binetti, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For a large amount of materials, such as tin, metals, pewter, polish, etc.

loans.name: Antonia Doneyda

texts.es: La Señora Antonia Doneyda E. Chávez tiene la edad de 42 años, su estado civil es casada. La actividad económica de Doña Antonia es la venta de mercadería en general como calzado, ropa, bolos y cosméticos. Hace más de cuatro años que se dedica a este negocio y comenzó este negocio en compañía de su hermana por lo que fue así que decidió seguir adelante. Los propósitos de Doña Antonia son de lograra estabilizar su negocio realizando la compra de productos variados. El financiamiento es para capital de trabajo por lo que así comprara ropa, calzado y shorts para el verano. Sus deseos son de establecer su propio negocio ya que actualmente el que posee es alquilado. La cantidad que necesita es de C$12.000 córdobas.
texts.en:
Antonia Doneyda E. Chávez is 42 years old and married. Antonia’s economic activity involves the sale of general merchandise, such as shoes, clothing, ties, and cosmetics. She has now been dedicated to this business, which she started with her sister in order to get ahead, for nearly four years. Antonia’s goals include stabilizing her business by purchasing a variety of products. The financing will serve as working capital with which to buy clothes, shoes, and shorts for the summer. Her wish is to establish her own business, as she currently rents. The amount she needs is 12,000 córdobas ($600 USD).

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Bismarck

texts.en:
Bismark G. is 37 years old and married with six children. His one boy and four girls attend primary school, junior high, and senior high school. His wife trades to help support the family. Bismarck lives with his family in Nkwateng, a small farming community in the Eastern Region of Ghana. The main occupation in this region is farming, particularly for the men. 

Bismarck owns a corn mill and also produces palm oil. Hired hands operate the mill and report daily sales. Bismarck purchases palm fruit from farmers in the community and nearby towns to produce palm oil, which he distributes to customers who buy in bulk and retail. He would like to use this loan to buy palm fruit in bulk so he can produce more oil to distribute to his increasing number of customers. Bismarck aspires to sponsor his children through to the university level.

loans.use: To procure palm nuts

loans.name: Dorotea

texts.es:
La señora Dorotea A. P., pertenece al banco comunal “El Comercio”, del distrito de Desaguadero, Provincia de Chucuito, Departamento de Puno; de 39 años de edad, de estado civil casada, con 5 hijos, con estudios de primaria completa. 
Trabaja con el movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 6 años, su negocio es la compra y venta de lubricantes para vehículos, para lo cual solicito un préstamo de 300 soles. 
Ella requiere tener un mayor capital, para lo cual necesita un préstamo de S/. 3000.00 nuevos soles, con lo cual adquirirá mayor mercadería, es decir aceites en baldes de 5 galones y envases de cuarto parta cambios rápidos de aceite, los ingresos los destinará a la mejora de su vivienda y al sustento familiar, ella pagara sus cuotas, según lo acordado con su grupo.
texts.en:
Dorotea A. P. belongs to the “El Comercio” Communal Bank in the Desaguadero district of the province of Chucuito, in the Puno area. She is 39-years-old, married with 5 children and has completed her elementary school studies. She has worked with Movimiento Manuela Ramos for 6 years, and her business is in buying and selling lubricants for vehicles, for which she requested a loan of 300 soles. She requires more capital, for which she needs a loan of 3000 nuevos soles, which she will use to acquire more merchandise, such as oil in 5-gallon buckets and quarter containers for quick oil changes. She will put her income toward improving her home and supporting her family. She will pay her installments according to what she has agreed upon with her group.

Translated from Spanish by Tara Binetti, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To acquire merchandise such as oil, in gallon and quarter containers for quick oil changes.

loans.name: Juliana

texts.es:
La señora Juliana J. A. es socia del Banco Comunal “Corazones unidos”, en el distrito de Desaguadero, Provincia de Chucuito, Departamento de Puno; tiene 43 años de edad, de estado civil casada, tiene 05 hijos y posee no posee estudios. 
Ella Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 07 años, su negocio es la venta de golosinas y bebidas (galletas, gaseosas, golosinas, etc.), su primer préstamo fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, con lo que pudo adquirir mercadería para su negocio (principalmente gaseosas y galletas).  
Actualmente requiere un nuevo préstamo de S/. 500.00 Nuevos soles, el mismo que se comprometa a pagar en 04 cuotas mensuales, con dicho préstamo desea adquirir más mercaderías para su negocio (golosinas, bebidas y galletas, principalmente) ello lo podrá vender al menor y mayor solo en las ferias de desaguadero (Martes y Viernes); ella tiene el deseo de contar con una tienda grande de abarrotes y los productos que viene ofreciendo actualmente; asumimos desea adquirir una casa y brindarles una profesión a sus  hijos.
texts.en:
Mrs. Juliana J. A. is a member of the "Corazones Unidos" Community Bank, in the Desaguadero district, Chucuito Province, Department of Puno; she is 43 years old, married, has 5 children and has no studies. She has worked with the Manuela Ramos Movement for 7 years, her business is the sale of candy and soft drinks (cookies, soft drinks, candy, etc.); her first loan was for S/.300.00 Nuevos Soles, with which she was able to acquire merchandise for her business (mainly soft drinks and cookies). Currently she needs a new loan of S/.500.00 New Soles, which she plans to repay in four monthly installments, and which she will use to buy more merchandise for her business (mainly candy, drinks and cookies), which she will be able to sell wholesale and retail only at the open markets on Tuesdays and Fridays. She wants to have a large grocery store to sell the products she now sells, and we expect she would like to buy a house and help her children get a profession.

Translated from Spanish by Monica Hayden, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Para la compra de más mercaderías:golosinas,bebidas,etc

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
La señora Elizabeth, pertenece al banco comunal “El Comercio”, del distrito de Desaguadero, Provincia de Chucuito, Departamento de Puno; de 33 años de edad, de estado civil casada, con dos hijos, posee estudios de secundaria incompleta (tercero de secundaria). 
Trabaja con el movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 08 años, se retiro 04 años, posee su negocio de comidas preparadas y la comercialización de ladrillos el mismo que los conformó con un préstamo inicial de S/. 300 nuevos soles como capital inicial de trabajo en el distrito de Desaguadero. 
Actualmente requiere un préstamo de S/. 1800 nuevos soles, para poder incrementar su mercadería, es decir adquirirá ladrillos en cantidad y los comercializara al por mayor en millares; en la misma localidad de desaguadero. Asimismo refiere que tiene la predisposición de cumplir con sus pagos, según lo acordado con su grupo.
texts.en:
Mrs. Elizabeth belongs to the Community bank "Comercio," from the Desaguadero district, Chucuito Province, Department of Puno. She is 33 hears old, married, has 2 children and has an incomplete high school education (through 3rd year of high school). She has worked with the Manuela Ramos movement for 8 years, left for 4 years, has a business of ready-made meals and the sale of bricks which she obtained with an initial loan of S/.300.00 New Soles as initial working capital in the Desaguadero district. She currently needs a loan for S/.1,800 New Soles to increase her inventory, in other words buy more bricks wholesale to sell wholesale by the thousands in the same locality of Desaguadero. She has every intention of make her payments on time, as stipulated by the group's agreement.

Translated from Spanish by Monica Hayden, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Para adquirir ladrillos en cantidad y comercilalizarlos.

loans.name: Silvia Sonia

texts.es:
La señora Silvia Sonia L. L. es socia del Banco Comunal “Unión 28 de Julio”, en el barrio Pacifico, distrito de Yunguyo, Provincia de Yunguyo, Departamento de Puno; tiene 31 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, tiene 01 hijo y posee estudios de superior completa (técnica en industria alimentaria). 
Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 02 años, ella posee un negocio de venta de verduras, gas y abarrotes al por menor, su primer préstamo fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, monto que invirtió en la compra de mercaderías (verduras) para su negocio. 
Ella requiere un préstamo adicional de S/. 1700.00 Nuevos soles, el mismo que se comprometa a pagar en 03 cuotas mensuales, dicho préstamo le servirá como capital para poder adquirir mercaderías para su negocio (tomates, azúcar, frutas, etc.) y tener un negocio surtido, su anhelo es tener su propia casa donde piensa poner una fabrica de maná para el sustento de su hijo y de su familia.
texts.en:
Mrs. Silvia Sonia L. L. is a member of the Community Bank "Union 28 de Julio," in the Pacifico neighborhood, Yunguyo district, Yunguyo Province, Department of Puno; she is 31 years old, married by common law, has one child and a complete high school education (food industry technician). She has worked with the Manuela Ramos Movement for 2 years, has a business selling vegetables, bas and groceries; her first loan was for S/.300.00 New Soles, which she invested in the purchase of merchandise (vegetables) for her business. She needs an additional loan of S/.1,700 New Soles, which she plans to repay in 3 monthly installments; this loan will be used as capital to buy merchandise (tomatoes, sugar, fruit, etc.) and have a well stocked store. She wishes to own her own home where she can produce homemade candy (mana) to support her family and child.

Translated from Spanish by Monica Hayden, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Para compra de mercaderías :tomates,azúcar,frutas,etc

loans.name: Irma

texts.es:
La señora Irma, pertenece al banco comunal “El Comercio”, del distrito de Desaguadero, Provincia de Chucuito, Departamento de Puno; de 30 años de edad, con 2 hijos, posee estudios de secundaria incompleta (tercero de secundaria). 
Trabaja con el movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 03 años e inició su negocio de comercialización de variedad de productos con un préstamo inicial de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, que invirtió para poder incrementar su capital de trabajo en su negocio en el distrito de Desaguadero. 
En el momento ella requiere un préstamo de S/. 3000.00 nuevos soles, para poder incrementar un mayor capital de trabajo, es decir comprar mas mercadería (regalos, vajillas, utensilios de cocina, juegos recreativos, etc.) para su negocio y obtener mejores ingresos para seguir ampliando su negocio; asimismo tiene el compromiso firme de cumplir con sus pagos, según lo acordado con su grupo.
texts.en:
Mrs. Irma belongs to the community bank "El Comercio", from the Desaguadero district, Chucuito Province, Department of Puno. She is 30 years old, has 2 children, and has an incomplete high school education (3rd year). She has worked with the Manuela Ramos movement for 3 years, and started her business selling a variety of products with an initial loan of S/.300.00 New Soles, which she invested to increase her working capital for her business in the Desaguadero district. Right now she needs a loan of S/.3,000 New Soles to increase her inventory and buy gift items, kitchen utensils, games, etc., for her store so that she can continue to expand her business and increase profits. She has vowed to stay up-to-date with her payments, according to the group's agreement.

Translated from Spanish by Monica Hayden, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Para mercadería:regalos,vajillas,utensilios de cocina,juegos recreativos,etc.

loans.name: Lidia

texts.es:
En el Mercado Mayoreo de la ciudad de Managua la señora Lidia P. se dedica con mucho esfuerzo a su negocio de ferretería el cual atiende con mucho entusiasmo brindando diferentes tipos de productos ferreteros.

La razón por la cual ella espera en Ceprodel es para ser beneficiada con un crédito para la compra de los productos ferreteros ya que se le han estado agotando y requiere volver a llenar su inventario. Por esto espera muy confiadamente en que su crédito será otorgado satisfactoriamente.
texts.en:
In the Mayoreo Market in the city of Managua, Lidia P. devotes a lot of effort to her hardware shop which she attends to with much enthusiasm, offering different types of hardware products. She is hoping that Ceprodel will grant her a loan to buy hardware products since she's sold all the ones she has and would like to refill her inventory. For this reason, she trusts that her loan will be satisfactorily granted.

Translated from Spanish by Tara Binetti, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy hardware products

loans.name: Audelia Patricia

texts.es:
Audelia Flores vende ropa usada en la comunidad en que ella vive, ella se levanta todos los dias temprano para arreglar a sus hijos para enviarlos a la escuela, es madre soltera, ella desea comprar mas fardos de ropa para poder vender en otras comunidades ya que este es un negocio muy bueno porque la gente compra buena ropa y a un precio justo para el bolsillo de muchos de nuestros vecinos, esto tiene que ser asi ya que en las comunidades que ella visita la gente es muy pobre y no tiene muchos recursos para poder comprar ropa nueva y cara.
ella espera invertir todo el dinero en mercaderia y esto le va a bajar sus costos de compra ya que por mas fardos que compre mas baratos se los venden.
su meta a corto plazo es poder rentar un lugar para poner una pequeña tienda que le sirva tambien de bodega para almacenar la ropa.
texts.en:
Audelia Flores sells used clothing in the community in which she lives. She rises early every day to get her children ready for school, as she is a single mother. She wants to buy more bundles of clothing to sell in other communities. It is a very good business because people like to buy good clothing at fair prices. It has to be this way because, in the communities she frequents, the people are very poor and don’t have the resources to buy new, expensive clothing. She hopes to invest all the money into merchandise, which will lower her costs because she gets better prices if she buys in bulk. Her short-term goal is to be able to rent a location where she can install a small store, which would also serve as storage for her goods.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase bundles of used American clothes.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Rosmery

texts.es:
La señora Rosmery L. C. es socia del Banco Comunal “Virgen de Asunción”, del distrito de Yunguyo, en la Provincia de Yunguyo, Departamento de Puno; tiene 26 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, tiene 02 hijos y posee estudios incompletos superiores (técnico en enfermería) 
Ella Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 03 años, ella posee un negocio de elaboración de maná; su primer préstamo fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, monto que sirvió como capital adicional en la compra de insumos para su negocio (maíz y arroz).  
Ella desea prestarse actualmente un monto adicional de S/. 1500.00 Nuevos soles, el mismo que se comprometa a pagar en 04 cuotas mensuales, con dicho préstamo podrá adquirir insumos para elaborar sus productos (maíz, azúcar, arroz, etc.), sus producto lo comercializa en las ferias y mercados locales de la frontera con Bolivia; su anhelo es construir su casa y ayudar a sus hijos a que sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Rosmery L. C. is a member of the “Virgen de Asunción” Communal Bank, in the Yunguyo district of the Yunguyo province, in the Puno area. She is 26-years-old, lives with her partner, and has 2 children. She has completed part of her higher studies (degree in nursing). She has worked with Movimiento Manuela Ramos for 3 years. She has a business of selling manna. Her first loan was for 300 nuevos soles, a sum that served as additional capital for the purchase of ingredients for her business (corn and rice). She currently wants to receive an additional sum of 1500 nuevos soles and has committed to repaying the amount in 4 monthly payments. With this loan, she will be able to acquire ingredients in order to make her products (corn, sugar, rice, etc.). She will sell her products at fairs and local markets on the Bolivian border. Her dream is to buy a house and help her children become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Tara Binetti, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For ingredients to make her products (corn, sugar, rice)

loans.name: Maria Antonia

texts.es:
La señora Maria Antonia L. A. es socia del Banco Comunal “Unión 28 de Julio”, del Barrio Pacifico, en el distrito de Yunguyo, Provincia de Yunguyo, Departamento de Puno; tiene 22 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, tiene 02 hijos y posee estudios de secundaria completa. 
Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 04 años, ella se dedica a la artesanía en metal, su primer préstamo fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, monto que invirtió en la compra de materiales (lata) para producir sus productos (carros en miniatura) para las ferias tradicionales en miniatura de la región.  
Ella requiere un préstamo de S/. 2000.00 Nuevos soles, el mismo que se comprometa a pagar en 03 cuotas mensuales, el dinero lo invertirá e la compra de materiales (pintura, lata, vidrio, cortinas, estaño, pasta, etc.) para elaborar sus productos artesanales (casitas y autos en miniatura) y comercializarlos en las ferias tradicionales de todo el Perú. Su anhelo es construir su casa y educar a sus hijos hasta que sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Maria Antonia L. A. is a member of the “Unión 28 de Julio” Communal Bank in the Pacific neighborhood of the Yunguyo district, in the province of Yunguyo, in the Puno area. She is 22-years-old, lives with her partner, has 2 children and has completed her secondary education. She has worked with Movimiento Manuela Ramos for 4 years, selling metal handicrafts. Her first loan was for 300 nuevos soles, a sum that she invested in the purchase of materials (tin) in order to make her products (miniature cars) for the traditional fairs of the region. She is requesting a loan of 2000 nuevos soles and has agreed to repay it in 3 monthly payments. She will invest the money in the purchase of materials (paint, tin, glass, curtains, pewter, polish, etc.) in order to make her crafts (little houses and miniature cars) and sell them at the traditional fairs throughout Peru. Her dream is to buy a house and see her children get an education and become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Tara Binetti, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy materials such as paint, tin, glass, curtains, pewter, polish, etc.

loans.name: Karin Dallan

texts.es:
En el municipio de Somotillo de la ciudad de Chinandega la señora Karin G. se esfuerza grandemente en su trabajo para llevar el sustento a su hogar y continuar con el mantenimiento de su vivienda ya que la ha comenzado a reconstruir para brindarle mejores condiciones de vida a su familia.

Ha acudido a Ceprodel para ser beneficiada con un crédito para la compra de pintura ya que requiere de esta para así continuar con el siguiente paso como es darle color a sus paredes y terminar de reconstruir las partes que así lo requieren. Por esta razón ella espera en Ceprodel para que le brinden el crédito y así salir adelante en su negocio.
texts.en:
In the municipality of Somotillo in the city of Chinandega, Karin G. works hard at her job in order to support her family and continue to maintain her home since she begun to repair it to create better living conditions for her family. She has come to Ceprodel to receive a loan so she can buy paint since she needs to continue with the next step, coloring her walls, and to finish remodeling the parts that need it. For this reason, she hopes Ceprodel can grant her the loan and therefore enable her to proceed with her business.

Translated from Spanish by Tara Binetti, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy paint and construction materials

loans.name: Casiana,

texts.es:
Seis años Casiana estuvo trabajando en el comercio de diversos tipos de calzado en el centro de Chosica como ambulante. Luego de ello se asocio a una compañera suya para emprender otro negocio. 

Por un corto tiempo se dedico entonces a la venta de láminas escolares y papelería. Este negocio iba marchando bien hasta que lamentablemente su compañera cayo enferma. Debido a que el negocio no iba a poder ser retomado, dividieron la inversión puesta en él y cada una fue por su camino. 

Casiana pensó que seria buena idea abrir una tienda en la casa donde vivía. A raíz de ello, su negocio son ha dejado de crecer. Hoy la tienda tiene cinco años y cada vez esta mas surtida. No solo vende abarrotes, también verduras y dulces. Hace un año y medio invirtió en la instalación de un pequeño locutorio en su tienda.

Aunque no le va nada mal en su negocio, Casiana tiene pensado cambiar su negocio por algo mas tranquilo, que no demande mucho esfuerzo físico, puesto que es ella quien se encarga de hacer las compras de toda su mercadería, incluyendo la de las verduras.

Las ganancias que obtiene de su negocio, ella la ahorra para poder construir su casa propia en el terreno que ya posee junto con su esposo. Sus cuatro hijos son mayores e independientes, por lo que ahora la prioridad es tener un hogar propio donde vivir con su esposo, quien trabaja como chofer.
texts.en:
For six years Casiana worked selling all variety of shoes in the center of Chosica as a traveling saleswoman. Later, she joined up with a friend of hers to start another business. For a little time, then, she worked selling school and office supplies. This business was going well until, unfortunately, her partner fell quite ill. Because they weren't going to be able to continue with their business, they divided the investment they had put into it and each went her separate way. Casiana thought that it would be a good idea to open a store in the house where she lived. As a result, her business has continued to grow. Today she has been in business for five years, and her business is every day better stocked. She not only sells groceries, but also vegetables and sweets. A year and a half ago she invested in the installation of a little phone-center in her store. Although her business is going well, Casiana has thought about changing gears for something a little quieter that isn't so physically demanding, since she is the one who is responsible for buying all her merchandise, including the vegetables. She saves the earnings from her business so she can construct her own house on a lot she already owns together with her husband. Her four children are grown and independent, and now her priority is to have her own house where she and her husband, who works as a driver, can live.

Translated from Spanish by Shaun Haines, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Rosa Aurora

texts.es:
La señora Rosa Aurora, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres en Acción”, vive en el Jr. San Martín Nº 237, Distrito de Picota, Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 49 años de edad y es madre de 4 hijos, 2 que todavía dependen de ellos. 

Se inicio con S/. 200.00, por iniciativa propia y decidió emprender su negocio, con un kiosco de refrigerios en un Centro Educativo del mismo lugar. 

En la actualidad se dedica a la venta de abarrotes, ubicada en su propia casa, donde atiende en las tardes. Y por las mañanas se dedica a vender sus refrigerios en el CC.EE, a los alumnos del mismo lugar.

Con el préstamo de S/2,000.00 que pagara en un  plazo de 06  meses, lo invertirá, comprando más productos para surtir su negocio como arroz y azúcar en sacos, papel higiénico en paquete, leche y conservas de pescado en cajas, insumos para el aseo personal y limpieza del hogar, productos variados para mantener contenta a su clientela.

Ella, toma las decisiones en las ganancias de su negocio. En lo personal, nos cuenta que es más sociable, más segura y responsable con el pago de sus cuotas. 
 
Rosa Aurora, manifiesta su agradecimiento a Manuela Ramos por permitirle crecer como empresaria y Mujer.
texts.en:
Mrs. Rosa Aurora, belongs to the Communal Bank “Women in Action.” She lives in Jr. San Martín Nº 237, Picota District, San Martín Division. She lives with her lover, is 49 years old and a mother of four children, two still depend on her. She began with S/.200.00 and on her own initiative she decided to open a business with snack stand in an Educational Center in her neighborhood. Currently, she’s selling groceries, from her own home, where she works in the afternoons. In the mornings, she sells snacks at the school to students in the neighborhood. With the loan of S/.200.00 she will pay for a general store stand for 6 months. She will invest the money buying more supplies for her business such as rice, sacks of sugar, sanitary napkin products, milk and boxes of preserved fish, materials for personal hygiene and household cleaning, and various products to keep her clientele happy. She makes decisions based on her earnings from her business. On a personal note, she is very friendly, assured and responsible with the payment of her bills. Rosa Aurora, thanks Manuela Ramos for encouraging her to develop as a business woman and wife.

Translated from Spanish by Jo Longnecker, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of rice, sugar, sanitary napkins, milk, preserved foods and other essential items

loans.name: Maria Angélica

texts.es:
En el municipio de Nagarote la señora María S. es una dama muy esforzada que se dedica a laborar arduamente para mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda que hoy en día requieren de pronta inversión para salira adelante.

Es importante destacar que hoy en día la señora María se ha preocupado por su vivienda porque al estar en mal estado corre mucho peligro y por ello ha acudido a Ceprodel para ser beneficiada con un crédito para la compra de materiales de construcción como lo son compra de zinc , piedra cemento , ladrillo y  hierro para así llevar a cabo esta obra que ha iniciado.
texts.en:
Mrs. María S. is a hardworking member of the Nagarote municipality who works diligently to improve her living conditions. Today she needs to invest money to get ahead. It is important to note that currently María is concerned about her home because it is in dangerous disrepair and for this reason she has come to Ceprodel to seek a loan to buy construction materials such as zinc, cement, brick and iron in order to finish the work she has began.

Translated from Spanish by Pamela Carreón, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy construction materials

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
La señora Isabel, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres en Acción”, vive en el Jr. San Martín Nº 657, Distrito de Picota, Departamento de San Martín. Es Soltera, tiene 41 años y es madre 3 hijos, que ya no dependen de ella

Se inicio, con S/. 300.00, por iniciativa propia, quien empezó vendiendo anticuchos en la esquina de su casa. Tiene 8 años trabajando con el Banco.

En la actualidad continua con el mismo negocio de venta de anticuchos por la noches y durante el día , se dedica a la venta de comidas preparadas, ubicada en su propia casa, donde atiende a sus pensionistas como familiares, docentes, y trabajadores de ESSalud.

Con el préstamo de S/1,500.00 que cancelara a plazo de 6 meses, desea invertirlo, implementando su negocio, comprando mesas, sillas, platos, vasos,  vajillas y ollas y así dar una mejor atención y comodidad a sus clientes.

En lo personal, se siente más independiente y responsable con el pago de sus cuotas y sabe tomar sus propias decisiones.

Isabel, manifiesta su agradecimiento a Manuela Ramos por permitirle crecer como empresaria y Mujer.
texts.en:
Isabel T. V. belongs to the "Women in Action" Communal Bank and lives in the Pillory district of the Department of San Martin. She is a single 41-year-old mother of three independent children. She took the initiative to start her business with $95 of her own when she began selling skewered meat (anticuchos) at the corner by her house. She has been working with the bank for eight years. Currently she continues with the same business of selling skewered meat at night and during the day, she sells prepared food. The business is located in her home, where she attends to retirees as if they were family, as well as to teachers and workers from “ESSalud.” The loan of $475 will be repaid in 6 months. She will invest the funds in her business, buying tables, chairs, dishes, glasses, and pots and thus be able to provide more comfort and better attention to her customers. On a personal level, Isabel feels more independent and responsible for the payment of her loan, and she knows how to make her own decisions. Isabel is grateful to Manuela Ramos for allowing her to grow as a businesswoman.

Translated from Spanish by Lisette Artiga, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy tables, chairs, dishes, and kitchen utensils.

loans.name: Rejina

texts.es:
la sra. Rejina I. se dedica a la fabricacion y venta de pasteles, ella tiene 2 años y medio de dedicarse a esta actividad, ella hace pasteles para cumpleaños, bodas, fiestas de empresas, etc. sus pasteles son bien vendidos ya que a muchos de sus clientes les gusta el sabor, ya que son muy sabrosos y esponjosos, la decoracion de los pasteles tambien es muy buena ya que puede hacer de diferentes formas como ser barney, barbie, dibujos animados, etc. ella es de la zona Villa Santa y ahi son muy pocas las personas que se dedican a este tipo de actividad. ella es casada y su esposo se dedica a la caficultura los dos salen adelante con los gastos del hogar, tienen un hijo el cual depende de los dos al 100%. 
ella necesita el credito para poder comprar mas materiales para hacer sus pasteles ya que las exigencias de sus clientes son grandes y ella se queda siempre sin producto a muy tempranas horas del dia.
texts.en:
Rejina I. dedicates herself to making and selling cakes, an activity she has carried out for 2 ½ years. She makes cakes for birthdays, weddings, corporate events, etc. Her cakes sell well because many of her customers like their flavor, as they are very good and moist.
