She also decorates the cakes beautifully, and can make different themes/characters such as Barney, Barbie, and others. She comes from the Villa Santa zone, where few people dedicate themselves to this type of business. She is married, and her husband works in coffee agriculture. They both get ahead with the household costs, and have one son who depends on them 100%. She needs the credit in order to purchase more ingredients to make her cakes, as customer demand is high and she often runs out of products early in the day.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase sugar, flour, eggs, milk, food coloring and flavoring, cardboard trays.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Diomar

texts.es:
El señor Diomar Q. es originario del municipio de Nagarote de la ciudad de León donde se desempeña a su actividad ganadera desde hace varios años siendo este el ingreso que percibe para mantener a su familia compuesto por su esposa y sus tres hijos.

Actualmente el señor Diomar ha acudido a Ceprodel para obtener el dinero para la compra de terneros debido a que a través de estos créditos ha mejorado sus ingresos y mantenido su hato ganadero ya que ha observado que Ceprodel ha sido de gran ayuda porque le proporciona el crédito en tiempo y forma lo que le ha permitido comprar el ganado.
texts.en:
Diomar Q. originates from the Nagarote municipality of the city of León, where he has carried out his livestock activities for several years. This is how he obtains the income that helps him support his family, which is composed of his wife and his three children. Currently, Diomar has turned to Ceprodel to obtain the money necessary for the purchase of calves. These loans have improved his income and helped him to maintain his livestock. Ceprodel has been a great help because it gives him the credit on time, giving him the opportunity to buy livestock.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase calves.

loans.name: Dora Herlinda,

texts.es:
Desde hace un año, Dora se encarga de atender en su negocio de venta de salchipapas y frituras en la puerta de su casa. No obstante, debido a que hay temporadas en la que no hay mucha salida en este negocio, ella también ofrece el servicio de limpieza y lavado de ropa en casas particulares. Fue así como comenzó a trabajar hace cuatro años.

Antes de dedicarse al negocio de comida, ella vendía ropa. Lo compraba a un precio cómodo y lo revendía a un precio mayor a clientes.

A sus treinta y tres años, ella esta a cargo de su único hijo de once años, del cuidado de su mamá y de un hermano con retraso mental. Es con estas grandes responsabilidades que ella sueña con poder conseguir un local más grande para su negocio de comidas.
texts.en:
For a year, Dora has worked out of her home, running a business selling hotdogs and other snacks. However, because there are seasons in which there isn't a lot of business, she also offers a cleaning and laundry service in the homes of clients. It was in this way that she started working four years ago.

Before dedicating herself to her hotdog stand, she sold clothes. She bought clothing at a reasonable price and resold it at a profit to her customers.

At thirty three years old, she is responsible of her only child, eleven years old, and of the care of her mother and a brother with developmental disabilities. With these enormous responsibilities, she dreams of being able to find a bigger space to house her business selling food.


Translated from Spanish by Shaun Haines, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of ingredients

loans.name: Dany

texts.es:
La señora Dany, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres Triunfadoras”, vive en el Jr. Loreto/Moquegua, Distrito de Bellavista, Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 30 años y es madre de 3 hijos, los 3 que todavía depende de ella. 

Se inicio con S/. 300.00 y fue motivada por su pareja, quien decidió emprender su negocio vendiendo refrigerios en su propia casa.

En la actualidad se dedica a la venta de abarrotes;  y cuenta con un local especialmente  acondicionado en su propia casa.
Con el prestamo de S/2,500.00 que pagara en un  plazo de 06  meses, lo invertirá, comprando más productos para surtir su negocio como arroz y azúcar en sacos, papel higiénico en paquete, leche y conservas de pescado en cajas, insumos para el aseo personal y limpieza del hogar, y también útiles escolares como lapiceros, lápices, plumones, correctores, borradores, cartulinas y productos variados para mantener contenta a su clientela.

Ella, toma las decisiones en las ganancias de su negocio. En lo personal, nos cuenta que es más sociable, más segura y responsable con el pago de sus cuotas. 
 
Dany, manifiesta su agradecimiento a Manuela Ramos por permitirle crecer como empresaria y Mujer.
texts.en:
Dany G. R. belongs to the "Triumphant Women" Communal Bank. She lives in the Loreto/Moquegua neighborhood in the District of Bellavista, Department of San Martin. She is 30 years old and lives with her 3 dependent children and their father. Dany started with $95, and encouraged by her children’s father, began her business selling snacks from her house. Currently she sells groceries in a special area of her home. The loan of $800 will be paid in 6 months, and she will invest it in buying more products to stock her store. These include rice and sugar in bags, packaged toilet paper, milk, preserved fish in boxes, personal hygiene products, and cleaning supplies for the home. She will also sell school equipment like mechanical pencils, pencils, pens, correction fluid, erasers, poster board and varied products to maintain satisfied customers. She makes the decisions regarding the business profits. On a personal level, she says she is more sociable, more confident, and will be responsible for the payment of her loan. Dany is grateful to Manuela Ramos allowing her to grow as a businesswoman.

Translated from Spanish by Lisette Artiga, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar, toilet paper, preserves, milk and other products wholesale.

loans.name: Teodora

texts.es:
La señora Teodora Avero D. G. es socia del Banco Comunal “Virgen D. Guadalupe”, en el distrito D. Pomata, Provincia D. Chucuito, Departamento D. Puno; tiene 42 años D. edad, D. estado civil casada, tiene 03 hijos y posee estudios D. primaria incompleta (quinto grado). 
Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 14 años, a la venta D. cereales (quinua, cañigua, habas, etc), su primer préstamo fue D. S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, monto que invirtió en la compra D. mercaderías para su negocio (quinua al por mayor). 
Actualmente ella requiere otro préstamo, por tanto viene solicitando la suma D. S/. 1000.00 Nuevos soles, el mismo que se comprometa a pagar en 05 cuotas mensuales, con el dinero piensa adquirir mas mercaderías todo al por mayor (quinua y cañigua principalmente), ella tiene el anhelo D. adquirir en el futuro una movilidad liviana (Mototaxi) para su esposo, a fin D. generar mas ingresos para su familia, puesto que su esposo no tiene un trabajo estable.
texts.en:
Mrs. Teodora Avero D. G. is a member of the "Virgin of Guadalupe" Communal Bank in the district of Pomata, Province of Chucuito, Department of Puno. She is 42 years old, married, and has 3 children. Her education is limited, having completed only to the fifth graD.. For the last 14 years she has worked with the Manuela Ramos Movement. She sells cereals such as quinua, cañigua, beans, etc. Her first loan of $95 was invested to purchase merchandise for her business (wholesale quinua). At present she requires another loan, therefore she is requesting the sum of $375. She is committing to repaying the loan in 5 months. She will use the funds to buy wholesale products, primarily quinua and cañigua. In the future, she wants to acquire a Mototaxi for her husband to help generate income for the family because he does not have stable work.

Translated from Spanish by Lisette Artiga, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy wholesale quinua y cañigua.

loans.name: Mirna Yolanda

texts.es: la sra Mirna J. se dedica a la venta de ropa nueva, actividad que ella realiza de manera domiciliar y ambulante en diferentes comunidades cercanas a la de donde ella vive. ella tiene cuatro años y medio de dedicarse a esta actividad, desde que ella inicio su negocio propio ha mejorado su calidad de vida, ella vive en union libre y tiene 3 hijos hermosos los cuales son su adoracion y ella trabaja solo para sacar adelante a sus hijos, su compañero de hogar es contratista de madera  y aserrador de la misma ya que en donde ellos viven es una zona rica en madera de pino. ella necesita el credito para comprar mas mercaderia y asi poder tener mejores ventas y mas  ganancias ya que la situacion es nuestro pais es muy critica y necesita mas dinero para poder alimentar a sus hijos y darles todo para que tengan una buena vida.
texts.en:
Mirna J. has a business selling new clothes, which she does both from her home and as an ambulatory saleswoman in different communities near her own. She has done this work for four and a half years, and since she started her own business, she has improved her quality of life. She lives with her partner and has three beautiful children who are the apples of her eye, and she works only in order to ensure her children can move forward. Her live-in partner is a wood-contractor and sawyer (timber merchant), as they live in an area rich in pine wood. She needs a loan in order to buy more merchandise and thus increase her sales and profits, as the economic situation in our country at the moment is critical and she needs more money in order to be able to feed her children and give them everything the need for a good life.

Translated from Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase dresses, bras, underwear, blouses, sandals etc.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.es:
La señora Ruth pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres en Acción”, vive en el Jr. Simón Bolívar Nº Cdra. 07, Distrito de Picota, Departamento de San Martín. Es Viuda, tiene 55 años y es madre de 5 hijos, 1 que todavía depende de ella. 

Se inicio, con S/. 200.00 por iniciativa propia, decidió emprender su negocio vendiendo verduras picadas. 

En la actualidad se dedica a la venta de abarrotes;  y cuenta con dos locales, uno que se encuentra ubicado en el Distrito de Pumahuasi y el otro en su propia casa.

Con el prestamo de S/ 1,500.00 que pagara en un  plazo de 06  meses, lo invertirá, comprando más productos para surtir su negocio como arroz y azúcar en sacos, papel higiénico en paquete, leche y conservas de pescado en cajas, insumos para el aseo personal y limpieza del hogar, golosinas de toda variedad  para mantener contenta y satisfecha a su clientela a su clientela.

Ella, toma las decisiones en las ganancias de su negocio. En lo personal, nos cuenta que es más sociable, más segura y responsable con el pago de sus cuotas. 
 
Ruth, manifiesta su agradecimiento a Manuela Ramos por permitirle crecer como empresaria y Mujer.
texts.en:
Ruth M. R. belongs to the "Women in Action" Communal Bank and she lives in the Simón Bolívar neighborhood of the Pillory District, Department of San Martin. She is a 55-year-old widow and the mother of 5 children, one of whom still depends on her. She started her business with $65 of her own funds, undertaking the sale of chopped vegetables. She currently sells groceries and has two sites, one located in the Pumahuasi District and the other at her house. The loan of $475 will be paid in 6 months, and she will invest it to buy more products to stock her business. These include rice and sugar in bags, packaged toilet paper, milk and preserved fish in boxes, personal hygiene products, and cleaning supplies for the home. She will also sell a variety of sweets and delicacies to maintain happy and satisfied customers. She makes the decisions regarding the business profits. On a personal level, she says she is more sociable, more confident, and will be responsible for the payment of her loan. Ruth is grateful to Manuela Ramos allowing her to grow as a businesswoman.

Translated from Spanish by Lisette Artiga, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy wholesale rice, sugar, milk, preserves, sweets, and cleaning products.

loans.name: Luz Ana,

texts.es:
Con solo veinticuatro años Luz Ana esta a cargo de la crianza de su única hija de seis años y del mantenimiento de su hogar. Actualmente se encuentra separada del papá de su hija, pero recibe un apoyo económico de parte de él para los estudios de la pequeña.

Luz tiene un negocio de comida junto con un familiar cercano. Por las tardes se dedica a vender salchipapas en la puerta de su casa. Este negocio ya lleva un año, sin embargo desde hace cuatro años ella ofrece servicio de limpieza en una casa, donde trabaja desde las siete de la mañana hasta las tres de la tarde.

A pesar de las bajas que su negocio ha tenido últimamente, ella se muestra optimista y llena de expectativas para el futuro de su trabajo. Quisiera mejorar la infraestructura del espacio donde atiende a sus clientes para brindarles un mejor servicio.
texts.en:
While she is only twenty-four years old, Luz Ana is in charge of the raising of her only daughter (who is six years old) and the maintenance of her home. At the present she is separated from the father of her daughter, but she recieves economic support from him for the studies of their little one. Luz has a food business with another relative. In the afternoons, she works selling salchipapas (a fried snack) from the door of her house. This business is a year old. Furthermore, since four years ago, she has offered a house cleaning service, where she works from seven in the morning to three in the afternoon. In spite of the decrease that her business has had ultimately she is optimistic and full of expectations for the future of her work. She wants to improve the infrastructure of the space where she attends to her clients in order to offer better service.

Translated from Spanish by Lois Parshley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Ingredients for her business and for the school registration of her daughter.

loans.name: Lucrecia

texts.es:
En la ciudad de León la señora Lucrecia se dedica arduamente a su negocio de venta de electrodomésticos los cuales son comercializados en el Mercado Central de la ciudad y en ocasiones ofreciéndolos ambulantemente en diferentes lugares de la ciudad de León.

Actualmente ella se ha requerido invertir en su negocio y para esto ha hecho uso de los crédito brindados por Ceprodel para la compra de los electrodomésticos. Una vez más ella espera ser beneficiada con un crédito para la compra de esta mercadería y de esta forma continuar en su desarrollo en el negocio que tanto requiere de inversión.
texts.en:
In the city of León, Lucrecia dedicates herself arduously to her business selling home electrical appliances that are sold in the Central Market of the city. On occasion, they are offered door-to-door throughout various parts of the city of León. Currently, she is required to invest in her business and for this she has made use of the credits provided by Ceprodel for the purchase of the appliances. Once again, she hopes to be benefited by a loan for the purchase of this merchandise. In this way, she can continue to develop the business, which requires a great deal of investment.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase home electronics appliances.

loans.name: Lidia

texts.es:
La señora Lidia es socia del Banco Comunal “El Comercio”, del Barrio Nueva Esperanza, en el distrito de Desaguadero, Provincia de Chucuito, Departamento de Puno; tiene 39 años de edad, ella es madre soltera y tiene 01 hijo a su cargo, ella no pudo culminar sus estudios de superiores de Contabilidad en la Universidad José Carlos Mariategui de Moquegua, pero si culminó sus estudios técnicos  (Laboratorio) en el tecnológico de Desaguadero. 
Ella Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 03 años, su negocio es el la venta útiles de escritorio y abarrotes al por menor y; su primer préstamo fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, con lo que pudo adquirir mercadería para su negocio.  
Actualmente ella requiere un nuevo préstamo de S/. 3000.00 Nuevos soles, el mismo que se comprometa a pagar en 03 cuotas, con el préstamo ella desea colocar un negocio de venta de útiles escolares (Cuadernos, papel, lapiceros, lápices, plumones, borradores, etc.) puesto que es la época ideal para este negocio ya que le brinda buenas ganancias; su anhelo es contar con una bodega propia con diferentes productos y brindarles una adecuada educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Ms. Lidia is a member of the Communal Bank of “Commerce” from the “New Hope Neighborhood” in the Desaguadero district, Chucuito Province, of Puno. She’s 39 years old and is a single mother. She has one son in her care. She could not complete her university level studies in accounting at the Jose Carlos Mariategui de Moquegua University, but she did complete her technical studies at the Desaguadero Technology (Academy). For three years she’s been working with the Manuela Ramos movement. Her business is selling retail school supplies and groceries. Her first loan was s/.300.00 nuevos soles, with which she purchased merchandise for her business. She currently seeks a new loan for S/.3000.00 nuevos soles; she promises to pay back this amount in three installments. With the loan she wants to establish a business selling school supplies (notebooks, paper, mechanical pencils, pencils, pens, erasures, etc.) as it is the ideal time for this business and it already offers her good profits. Her wish is to have storage space of her own with different products and to provide her children an adequate education.

Translated from Spanish by Jo Longnecker, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Start a school supply business (notebook, paper, mechanical pencils, pencils, pencil, erasures, etc.)

loans.name: Maria Rosibel

texts.es:
la Sra. C. se dedica a la venta de productos de consumo popular, tiene una pequeña pulperia que esta ubicada en la comunidad de los Trozos, ella desde que puso su propio negocio ha crecido mucho y le ha ayudado con los gastos del hogar es muy notable que su negocio es muy bueno, la ventaja de ella es que esta ubicado en una zona en donde son muy pocas las pulperias entonces ella no tiene mucha competencia y ahi es donde esta el secreto de este negocio.  la zona en donde ella vive es una zona de muy pocos recursos economicos la mayoria de la poblacion es gente muy pobre, por lo tanto ella tiene que vender su producto a precios muy bajos para poder tener varias ventas.
su esposo se dedica a hacer viajes o transportar cargas con un carro paila que tiene y eso le deja una buena cantidad de dinero para sostener a la familia.
texts.en:
Sra. C. sells popular consumable goods. She has a small grocery store that is located in the neighbourhood of Trozos. Since she established her own business, it has grown also and has helped with the household expenses. It is very clear that her business is very good: her store is located in an area where there are very few grocery stores and as a result she doesn't have much competition and this is the her business' secret. The area where she lives is an area with very few economic resources and the majority of the population are very poor people, which means that she has to sell her products at very low prices in order to make sufficient sales. Her husband also makes journeys or transports cargo with in a pick-up truck he owns and this provides a good amount of money with which sustain her family.

Translated from Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase churros, eggs, soup, margarine, butter, beans,rice, sugar, coffee, biscuits, salt etc.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Efigenia

texts.es:
La señora Ifigenia C. T. es socia del Banco Comunal “Virgen de Asunción”, del Barrio Bolognesi, en el distrito de Yunguyo, Provincia de Yunguyo, Departamento de Puno; tiene 42 años de edad, de estado civil casada, tiene 04 hijos y posee estudios primaria competa 
Ella Trabaja recientemente con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, ella se dedica a la preparación de comidas de forma ambulatoria; ella desea obtener un préstamo de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, monto que piensa invertir en la compra de insumos para preparar sus comidas (arroz, fideos, gas, aceite, papas, etc.), su anhelo en el futuro es tener su casa propia donde colocará su propio restaurante; finalmente ella desea contribuir con la educación de de sus hijos hasta que sean profesionales. 
Ella agradece a Manuela Ramos por la oportunidad que la dan para poder superar su negocio y obtener más ingresos.
texts.en:
Mrs. Efigenia C. T. is a member of the Communal Bank “Virgin of the Assumption,” Bolognesi neighborood, Yunguvo district, Yunguyo Province, Puno. She’s 42 years old, married, and has four children. She completed her primary school studies. She’s recently been working with the Manuela Ramos Movement. She works in portable meal preparation. She wants to obtain a loan of S/ 500.00 nuevos soles, an amount she plans to invest in the purchase of food staples (rice, beans, gas, oil, potatoes, etc.). In the future, she longs to have a house of her own where she could put her own restaurant. Above all, she hopes to contribute to her children’s education so that they become professionals. She appreciates the opportunity that Manuela Ramos has given her to improve her business and earn more income.

Translated from Spanish by Jo Longnecker, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the purchase of food staples: rice, beans, gas, oil, potatoes, etc.

loans.name: María Nicolaza

texts.es:
En la ciudad de León la señora María Nicolaza G. se dedica a su actividad de pulpería la cual es atendida por ella misma todos los días desde muy tempranas horas de la mañana.

Hoy en día con mucho esfuerzo la señora Nicolaza busca la manera de como salir adelante y lo hace por medio del apoyo de Ceprodel ya que ha acudido a este para ser beneficiada en el otorgamiento de un crédito para la compra de los productos para ofertarlos. Por este motivo es que ella espera muy confiadamente y una vez que se le otorgue dicho crédito lo primero que hará será comprar los productos para surtir su pulpería.
texts.en:
In the city of León, María Nicolaza G. dedicates herself to her general store business, which she tends to herself every day from very early in the morning. Today, with much effort, Nicolaza looks for a way to get ahead and she does it by means of support through Ceprodel. She has turned to them to be granted a loan for the purchase of more merchandise to offer for sale. For this reason, she waits confidently and, once she receives said loan, the first thing she will do is buy products with which to supply her store.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase products.

loans.name: Pablo

texts.es:
En la ciudad de León, el señor Pablo L. desde hace 15 años se ha dedicado a su negocio de barbería el cual ha logrado llevar a cabo con mucho entusiasmo en su localidad donde es visitado por sus clientes.

Cabe señalar que se ha destacado por ser un buen peluquero debido a su vasta experiencia en el ramo. Hoy en día ha acudido a Ceprodel para ser beneficiado con un crédito para la compra de materiales de trabajo como peines, gelatinas, tijeras, entre otros. Por esto espera ser beneficiado y así continuar mejorando su negocio que tanto requiere de inversión.
texts.en:
In the city of León, Pablo L. has dedicated the last 15 years to his barber shop business which has been successful gaining a lot of enthusiasm in the community where it is visited by his customers. This shows that he has emphasized being a good barber due to his vast experience in the industry. Today he has come to Kiva partner Ceprodel to benefit from a loan in order to purchase materials for work such as combs, gel, scissors, among others. He hopes to benefit with these and to continue improving his business that continually needs investment.

Translated from Spanish by Josh Wilcox, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The purchase of work materials

loans.name: Juan Rafael,

texts.es:
Juan lleva toda una vida trabajando en el comercio de la fabricación de ollas de aluminio. Empezó como técnico en una fábrica, y llegó a tener una fábrica propia luego de unos años. No obstante, llegó un momento en que el aluminio empezó a escasear y encarecerse en el Perú, y la falta de salida lo obligó a cerrar su fábrica. Un amigo le ofreció que se una a él en su fábrica de ollas de aluminio que todavía iba bien, por que, en vez que vender en el Perú, exportaba al extranjero.
Ya jubilado de esta profesión, Juan está tratando de renovar, para poder manejar o alquilar, un mototaxi que compró con el dinero de la venta de su carro. Esta idea se le ocurrió por uno de sus 3 hijos, que lamentablemente falleció hace 3 meses, a sus 49 años, por aneurisma.
Sus otros 2 hijos viven en el extranjero, y brindan apoyo económico a Juan y su esposa  cuando lo necesitan. Uno de ellos, que fue a E.E.U.U. gracias a una beca que consiguió por California, y ahora trabaja en una compañía de seguros, es el que lo apoya más, y el que más insiste en que Juan y su esposa se vayan a vivir con él en California. Juan está considerando esta mudanza para más adelante.
A sus 74 años recién empezó a recibir préstamos de EDAPROSPO, desde hace 1 año, y quiere ver que tal puede manejarse con su nuevo negocio.
texts.en:
Juan has spent all his life working in the business of aluminum pots production. He began as a technician in a factory, and came to own a factory of his own after some years. Nevertheless, a moment arrived in which aluminum became scarce and prices began to rise in Peru, and he was forced to close his factory. A friend offered him a position in his factory of aluminum that was still going well, because in time that time to sell in Peru his friend exported a foreigner. Already retired from this profession, Juan is trying to become revitalized, to be able to operate or rent a mototaxi that he bought with the sale of his car. This idea occurred to one of his children, that sadly passed away three months ago at the age of forty-nine, because of an aneurysm. Juan's other two children live abroad, and they offer economic support to Juan and his wife when they need it. One of his children, who went to the U.S. thanks to a scholarship obtained from the state of California, now works for an insurance company and is the one who supports Juan more, and insists that Juan and his wife come live with him in California. Juan is considering this move in the future. At his 74 years, he recently began to receive loans from EDAPROSPO, an affiliate of Kiva. Since one year ago when he began working with EDAPROSPO, he wants to see that he can manage his new business.

Translated from Spanish by Lois Parshley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest more in his mototaxi. He needs to install a windshield.

loans.name: Ada Luz

texts.es:
La Sra. Ada F. tiene dos años y medio de haber uniciado a vender ropa nueva, ella vende su producto de manera ambulante, todos los dias sale bien temprano de su casa a vender su producto en diferentes oficinas ya sean publicas y privadas, en donde ella vende mucho su producto es en las tabacaleras ya que en danli hay bastantes fabricas de puros o habanos, ella es madre soltera y tiene un hijo y esto la ha obligado a buscar como conseguir dinero para poder alimentar a su hijo, lo mas importante es que ella ha sabido ganarse a sus clientes, ella aspira que su negocio sea mucho mas grande.
ella necesita el credito para poder comprar mas mercaderia y poder salir adelante con su hijo.
texts.en:
Ada F. has been in business for two and half years. She sells new clothes door to door. She sets out early every day to sell her products in government and company offices. She sells a lot in cigar factories, of which there are many in Danli.

Because she is a single mother with one son, she has had to work to maintain him. She is proud of the clientele she has built up, and hopes to make her business much bigger.

She needs the loan to buy more merchandise so as to enable her and her son to prosper.

Translated from Spanish by John Rynne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy shirts, T-shirts, sandals, trousers, shoes, underwear, socks.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Lidia

texts.es:
La señora Lidia G. J. es socia del Banco Comunal “Unión 28 de Julio”, en el barrio Santa Barbara, distrito de Yunguyo, Provincia de Yunguyo, Departamento de Puno; tiene 31 años de edad, de estado civil casada, tiene 02 hijos y posee estudios de primaria completa. 
Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace año y medio, ella posee un negocio de venta de ropas en las ferias locales de Yunguyo, su primer préstamo fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, monto que invirtió en la compra de mercaderías (casacas y cubrecamas) para su negocio. 
Ella requiere un préstamo adicional de S/. 1200.00 Nuevos soles, el mismo que se comprometa a pagar en 03 cuotas mensuales, dicho préstamo le servirá para poder adquirir mercadería y complementar su negocio (chompas, polleras, cubrecamas, etc.) todo al por mayor (por docenas), ella piensa adquirir un auto en el futuro para poder trasladar su mercadería, asimismo desea que sus hijos sean profesionales con el apoyo que les brinda.
texts.en:
Lidia G. J. is a member of Unión 28 de Julio Communal Banc, in the neighborhood Santa Barbara, district Yunguyo, province Yunguyo, departament Puno; she is 31 years old, married, and the mother of 2 children. She completed primary school. Lidia has been working with Movimiento Manuela Ramos for a year and half. She has her own business selling cloths at the local markets throughout the Yunguyo area. Her first loan was for S/. 300.00, which she used to purchase merchandise (jackets and bead-spreads) for her business. She would like another loan, this time for S/. 1200.00, which she will repay in 3 monthly installments. The loan will help her buy merchandise to stock her business and add products (sweaters, skirts, bead-spreads, etc.) to sell whole sale (in groups of twelve). Lidia hopes to one day have car, for transporting her merchandise. She also dreams that her children, with her help, will have professional careers.

Translated from Spanish by Hannah Lily, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing merchandise (sweaters, skirts, bead-spreads, etc.) to sell

loans.name: Juana Antonia

texts.es:
En el municipio de Ciudad Sandino de la ciudad de Managua, la señora Juana G. posee su propio negocio de pulpería el cual atiende a diario con el propósito de beneficiar a su familia brindándole las condiciones de vida necesarias.

Es de importancia destacar que ella ha sido una persona muy trabajadora y hoy en día el problema que atraviesa es que se le agotan sus productos y para ello acude a Ceprodel para ser beneficiada con un crédito para la compra de los productos y así continuar en su negocio.
texts.en:
Mrs. Juana G. has her own mini market. It is located in the Ciudad Sandino municipality in the city of Managua. She works there every day to help her family and provide them with life’s necessities.

It is important to point out that she has been a very hard worker. The problem that she now comes across is that she runs out of her products. This is why she comes to Ceprodel. She would like a loan to buy products and continue her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy products

loans.name: Lida,

texts.es:
Lida siempre ha trabajado en el comercio D. confección y compostura D. ropa. Anteriormente ofrecía sus servicios a empresas D. ropa en varios centros comerciales, como el centro comercial Gamarra D. Lima que actualmente está tratando D. crecer con sus micro empresarios para lograr un mayor mercado en el extranjero.
Como es separada, durante todo el tiempo que sus 4 hijos eran menores D. edad nunca pudo ahorrar para invertir en empezar un negocio propio, por que todas sus ganancias las utilizaba para cubrir los gastos D. la crianza D. sus hijos. Sin embargo cuando ellos crecieron y se hicieron independientes económicamente Lida pudo cumplir su sueño D. tener su negocio propio.
Uno D. sus primeras inversiones fue comprar maquinas industriales D. confección y compostura D. ropa, ya tiene 4. DesD. hace 4 años tiene un puesto alquilado en un centro comercial donD. venD. la ropa que ella misma produce, y durante la temporada alta contrata a una persona para que la ayuD. en la producción. 
Ahora sus ganancias las utiliza para cubrir sus gastos personales y pala apoyar a su mamá que vive en Juliaca. Recién empezó a sacar préstamos por EDAPROSPO, solo hace ½ año, pero ya tiene planificado usarlos para en un futuro poder comprar un local propio para estabilizar su negocio.
texts.en:
Lida has always worked in the business of making and repairing clothes. Previously she offered her services to clothing business in various shopping centers, like the File Halter shopping center that is currently trying to grow its small businesses in order to achieve a greater market abroad. As she is separated, during the whole time that her four children were underage she could never save enough to invest to begin her own business, because all of her profits were used to cover the expenses of raising her children. Nevertheless, when they grew and became independent economically, Lida could begin her dream of having her own business. One of her first investments was to buy industrial sewing machines to make and repair clothes. She already has four. Since four years ago, she has a rented a space in a shopping center where she sells the clothes she produces. During the busy season, she contracts a person to help with production. Now she uses her profits to cover her personal expenses and to help support her mother who lives in Juliaca. She began to take out loans with EDAPROSPO, an affiliate of Kiva, six months ago. But she already has plans to use her loans in the future in order to buy a local space to stabilize her business.

Translated from Spanish by Lois Parshley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in a showcase to better display her products.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Gregoria

texts.es:
La señora Gregoria F. M. es socia del Banco Comunal “Unión 28 de Julio”, en el cercado del distrito de Yunguyo, Provincia de Yunguyo, Departamento de Puno; tiene 49 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene 06 hijos y posee estudios primaria incompleta (quinto grado). 
Ella Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 12 años, se dedica a la compra y venta de cereales (quinua, cebada, cañigua, etc.) en los mercados de Arequipa y Puno, su primer préstamo fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, monto que invirtió en la compra de Quinua para llevar a la ciudad de Arequipa.  
Ella requiere un préstamo de S/. 2000.00 Nuevos soles, el mismo que se comprometa a pagar en 03 cuotas mensuales, el dinero lo invertirá e la compra de mercaderías para su negocio (chuño, habas, quinua, etc.) para poder venderlo en las ferias y mercados de la ciudad de Arequipa, donde viaja permanentemente su anhelo es comprarse una casa en la ciudad de Tacna o Arequipa, asimismo desea que sus hijos sean profesionales y es por ello que viene trabajando con mucho esfuerzo.
texts.en:
Gregoria F. M. is a member of Unión 28 de Julio Communal Bank in the nearby district Yunguyo, province Yunguyo, departament de Puno, Peru; she is forty-nine years old, and the single mother of six. She completed the fifth grade in primary school. She has worked with Movimiento Manuela Ramos for twelve years. Gregoria buys and sells grains (quinua, barley, cañigua, etc.) at markets in Arequipa and Puno. Her first loan was for S/. 300.00, which she used to buy Quinua to sell in the city Arequipa. Gregoria is requesting a loan of S/. 2000.00, which she will repay in three monthly installments. She will use the loan to buy merchandise (potato flour, beans, quinua, etc.) to sell at fairs and street markets in Arequipa, where she goes constantly; she yearns to buy a house in the city of Tacna or Arequipa. She also dreams that her children will become professionals, which is why she works with such dedication.

Translated from Spanish by Hannah Lily, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing merchandise: potato flour, beans, quinua, etc.

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es:
la Sra. Maria M. tiene una pulperia desde hace 4 años, la cual opera bajo el nombre de pulperia MARY CARMEN, su negocio esta ubicado en su casa de habitacion, ella es casada y madre de dos hijos de los cuales su hija es la que depende totalmente de ellos dos, el otro esta casado y vive en otro lugar con su esposa.
el esposo de Maria se dedica al comercio tiene una agropecuaria y tambien es productor de cafe.
la sra. Maria nos conto que esta bien alegre ya que su negocio es una bendicion de Dios, ya que con los ingresos que ella ha tenido a podido invertir el dinero en su casa y en su negocio, ahorita ella quiere invertir en su negocio para tener mas variedad de productos y asi poder cumplir con las exigencias de todos sus clientes. por tal razon esta solicitando el credito y espera que en un futuro su negocio sea un mini market.
texts.en:
Maria M. has had a grocery store for four years, called "Pulperia Mary Carmen". It is located in a room in her house.

She is married and has two children. Her daughter is still dependent while her son is married and lives elsewhere with his wife. Maria's husband raises livestock and also grows coffee. Maria is very pleased since her business is a blessing from God; it has enabled her to invest in her house and business.

Now she wants to expand her product range to be able to cater to all her customers' demands. This is the reason for requesting the loan; in the future, she would like to expand her business to become a mini-market.

Translated from Spanish by John Rynne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Butter, sugar, rice, beans, toilet paper, soft drinks, cookies, bread, soap, cream, deodorants.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Nelida

texts.es:
La señora Nelida I. D. S.  es socia del Banco Comunal “Virgen D. Guadalupe”, del barrio central, en el distrito D. Pomata, Provincia D. Chucuito, Departamento D. Puno; tiene 64 años D. edad, D. estado civil divorciada, tiene 05 hijos y posee estudios D. primaria completa. 
Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 12 años, ella posee un negocio D. cafetería y Snack en el local municipal del distrito, su primer préstamo fue D. S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, monto que invirtió en la compra materiales e insumos para su negocio. 
Actualmente requiere un nuevo préstamo, por tanto viene solicitando la suma D. S/. 800.00 nuevos soles, el mismo que se comprometa a pagar en 05 cuotas mensuales, con dicho préstamo ella desea implementar mejor su negocio D. cafetería y adquirir mas materiales necesarios (tasas, platos, sillas, etc.) asimismo adquirir insumos necesarios (fruta, bebidas, etc.), a fin D. que en el futuro pueda contar con un negocio completo y con gran demanda. 
Ella esta bastante agradecida a Manuela ramos por el apoyo que viene brindando en bien del desarrollo D. las mujeres.
texts.en:
Nelida I. D. S. is a member of Virgen D. Guadalupe Communal Bank, in the central neighborhood of the district Pomata, province Chucuito, departament Puno, Peru; she is sixty four years old, divorced, the mother of five, and has completed primary school. She has been working with Movimiento Manuela Ramos, a feminist organization, for twelve years. She runs her own café and snack bar in her district area. Her first loan was for S/. 300.00, which she used to buy materials and snacks to sell at her café. Now she is requesting a new loan, this time for S/. 800.00, which she will repay in five monthly installments. She will use the loan to better establish her café, and to purchase more necessary materials (cups and plates, chairs, etc.), and important snacks (fruit, drinks, etc.). This will help her to one day have a very strong business and a huge clientele. She is very grateful to Manuela Ramos for their support and helping women to develop.

Translated from Spanish by Hannah Lily, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To better establish her cafe, and purchase necessary materials: cups and plates, chairs, etc.

loans.name: Domitila

texts.es:
La señora Domitila H. S. es socia del Banco Comunal “Corazones unidos”, del barrio Misuyo, en el distrito de Desaguadero, Provincia de Chucuito, Departamento de Puno; tiene 31 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, tiene 03 hijos y posee estudios de secundaria completa 
Ella Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 05 años, se dedica a la venta de abarrotes, su primer préstamo fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, con lo que pudo invertir en mercadería adicional (05 quintales azúcar) para venderlo en la feria de Tacna.  
Ella, actualmente requiere un préstamo de S/. 1000.00 Nuevos soles, el mismo que se comprometa a pagar en 04 cuotas mensuales, con ello, podrá adquirir más mercaderías (azúcar, arroz, aceite, etc.) para surtir su negocio. Su anhelo es convertir su negocio en una bodega de distribución al por mayor; asimismo desea comprarse un auto (camioneta) para poder trasladar mercadería a distintas ferias de la región y a Tacna.
texts.en:
Domitila H. S. is a member of Corazones Unidos Communal Bank, in the neighborhood Misuyo, district Esaguadero, province Chucuito, department Puno, Peru; she is thirty-one years old, has a partner, three children, and completed secondary school. She has been working with Movimiento Manuela Ramos, a feminist organization, for five years. She sells groceries. Her first loan was for S/. 300.00, which she used to purchase additional merchandise (five quintales* of sugar) to sell at the market in Tacna. Now she is requesting a loan for S/. 1000.00, which she will repay in four monthly installments. The loan will allow her to purchase more merchandise (sugar, rice, oil, etc.) to stock her business. She dreams of her business one day becoming a whole sale grocery store. She would also like to have a car (a station wagon) to transport merchandise to the markets that are far from her, and to Tacna. *One quintal is equal to 100kg.

Translated from Spanish by Hannah Lily, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing sugar, rice, and oil, and to stock her business.

loans.name: Sandra Azucena

texts.es:
la Sra. Sandra M. tiene mucha experiencia en este tipo de actividad comercial pues lleva 6 años dedicandose a este negocio, el cual le ha permitido salir adelante sin descuidar su hogar y darles el cuidado necesario a sus hijos y apoyar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar, ella nos comento que tiene dos hijas estudiando, la mayor tiene 16 años y esta cursando la secundaria y la menor esta en 3er grado de primaria, ellas estan en centros educativos publicos de la localidad.
su esposo trabaja como locutor de una radioemisora de la ciudad, el programa que el conduce tiene muy buena audiencia ya que va dirigido a los caficultores de la zona ya que aqui es una zona productora de cafe (el mejor) ya que las elevadas y frescas montañas son aptas para el cultivo del cafe, los sueños de Sandra aparte de vender los productos es poner una floristeria y manualidades ya que ella es muy buena para dicha actividad, esto lo quiere poner con las ganancias que tenga de este credito.
texts.en:
Sandra M. is an experienced shopkeeper as she has been in business for 6 years. This has enabled her to make a living while also looking after her household, caring for her children and contributing to the family finances.

Two of her daughters are studying: the eldest is 16 and is in secondary school, while the youngest is in third grade of primary school. Both of them study at public schools nearby. Her husband works as a host at a local radio station; his program is for coffee growers and is very popular. The area is renowned for its superb coffee because of the cool mountain climate.

Apart from selling personal care products, Sandra would like to have a flower and handicraft shop since she is very skilled in these areas. The profit she makes using the loan will be used for this purpose.

Translated from Spanish by John Rynne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy cream, deodorant, lotion, perfume, shampoo and conditioner.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Avelina

texts.es:
La señora Avelina H. D. C. es socia del Banco Comunal “Urbano Central”, del Sector Tauccamaya, en el distrito D. Copani, Provincia D. Yunguyo, Departamento D. Puno; ella tiene 65 años D. edad, es casada y tiene 06 hijos. 
Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desD. hace 05 años, ella se dedica a la compra y venta D. golosinas y carne, así como tambien a la venta D. cereales (habas, quinua, etc.), su primer préstamo fue D. S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, monto que invirtió en la compra D. mercadería (carne) para su venta en las ferias y mercados D. Tacna.  
Actualmente viene solicitando un préstamo adicional D. S/. 1500.00 Nuevos soles, el mismo que se comprometa a pagar en 04 cuotas, con dicho préstamo podrá adquirir mas mercadería como cereales (habas, quinua, cebada, etc.) carnes (carne D. oveja), puesto que su negocio es el acopio D. estos productos y su posterior venta en otros mercados (como Tacna, Arequipa y Puno), ella refiere que le va bien en su negocio, por ello en el futuro desea construir su propia casa en la ciudad D. Yunguyo para asegurar su bienestar y el D. su familia.
texts.en:
Avelina H. D. C. is a member of the Community Bank “Urbano Central”, Sector Tauccamaya, district of Copani, Province of Yunguyo, Department of Puno. She is 65 years old, she is married and has 6 children. She’s been working for the ‘Manuela Ramos’ Movement for 5 years. She buys and sells candy and meat. She also sells cereal (beans, quinoa, etc.). She received a first loan of 300 new soles, money that she used to purchase products (meat) to sell in fairs and markets in Tacna. Currently, she is requesting for an additional loan of 1500 new soles, which will be repaid in 4 months. She will use this loan to purchase more products such are cereal (beans, quinoa, barley, etc.) and meat (sheet meat). As her business is to store these products to later on sell them to other markets (such as Tacna, Arequipa and Puno), she believes her business will be very successful. For that reason, she hopes she will be able to build her own house in the future, in the city of Yunguyo to ensure her wellbeing and she family’s.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Lopez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase cereal (beans, quinoa, barley, etc.) and meat

loans.name: Maria Maricela

texts.es:
La Sra. Maria M. se dedica al servicio de cortar pelo, aplicar tintes, secados de pelo, manicure, pedicure, maquillaje, peinados. ella tiene un salon de belleza, actividad la realiza hace mas de 5 años, ella es madre y tiene dos hijos, con los ingresos que le genera este negocio le permite manter a sus hijos que son lo mas importante en su vida, segun ella nos comento que sus hijos son lo mas preciado que tiene en la vida y que ella quiere darles todo para que ellos sean personas de bien.
su meta a corto plazo es poner otro salon de belleza en danli, esto le va a generar unoso gastos y contratar personal pero con eso va a lograr tener mejores ganancias y asi va a poder salir adelante.
texts.en:
Maria M. has a beauty salon: she cuts, dyes and dries hair, as well as offering manicures, pedicures, make-up and styling. She has had her salon for over five years.

She has two children. The business enables her to maintain her children, who are the most important thing in her life, and she wants to bring them up well.

Her short-term goal is to open another beauty salon in Danli, which will involve expenditure and hiring staff, but it should provide her with greater profits and enable her to get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by John Rynne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy shampoo, dye, treatments, depilation wax, rinses, peroxide, scissors, oil and talcum.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
La señora María H. C. es socia del Banco Comunal “Urbano Central”, distrito de Copani, Provincia de Yunguyo, Departamento de Puno; tiene 41 años de edad, es casada, tiene 07 hijos y posee estudios primaria completa. 
Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 04 años con seis meses, se dedica a la compra y venta de ganado menor, su primer préstamo fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, monto que invirtió en la compra de insumos para realizar el engorde de su ganado (alimento balanceado y forraje).  
Actualmente requiere un préstamo de S/. 500.00 Nuevos soles, el mismo que se comprometa a pagar en 04 cuotas, el dinero le servirá como capital adicional para poder comprarse una vaca, para engorde y su posterior venta en la feria ganadera de Yunguyo, ella tiene la aspiración de brindar una educación adecuada a sus hijos hasta que sean profesionales.
texts.en:
María H. C. is a member of the Community Bank “Urbano Central”, district of Copani, Province of Yunguyo, Department of Puno. She is 41 years old, she is married and has 7 children. She also finished primary school. She’s been working for the ‘Manuela Ramos’ Movement for 4 and a half years. She buys and sells small cattle. She received a first loan of 300 new soles, money that she used to purchase products for cattle fattening (balanced food and forage). Currently, she is requesting for an additional loan of 500 new soles, which will be repaid in 4 months. She will use this loan as additional capital to buy a cow, its fattening and to sell it later on to a farmer’s fair in Yunguyo. Her dream is to provide her children with a good education until they are professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Lopez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a cow and complete its fattening process

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
La señora Fransisca G. B. es socia del Banco Comunal “Urbano Central”, del sector Ahirigua – Tacaphisi, en el distrito de Copani, Provincia de Yunguyo, Departamento de Puno; ella tiene 34 años de edad, es de estado civil casada, asimismo esta al cuidado de 05 hijos. 
Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 05 años, se dedica al engorde de ganado menor (porcinos), su primer préstamo fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, monto que invirtió en la compra de animales menores porcinos para engordarlos.  
Sin embargo ella desea continuar con este negocio, por ello viene solicitando un nuevo préstamo de S/. 600.00 Nuevos soles, el mismo que se comprometa a pagar en 04 cuotas, el dinero le servirá como capital adicional a lo que ella tiene, con el dinero podrá adquirir un toro para poder engordarlo por que es la temporada ideal; ella menciona que las ganancias en este negocio son a largo plazo, pero es algo fijo; su anhelo es educar a sus hijos y verlos en futuro profesionales para que la apoyen en el sustento familiar.
texts.en:
Francisca G. B. is a member of the Community Bank “Urbano Central”, sector Ahirigua – Tacaphisi, district of Copani, Province of Yunguyo, Department of Puno. She is 31 years old, she is married and has 5 children. She’s been working for the ‘Manuela Ramos’ Movement for 5 years. She works on the fattening process of small cattle (pigs). She received a first loan of 300 new soles, money that she used to purchase small animals for fattening. She wants to continue with this business and for that reason she is requesting for an additional loan of 600 new soles, which will be repaid in 4 months. She will use this loan as additional capital to buy a bull, as this is the ideal season for fattening; She mentions that earning in this business are always seen in the long term, but they are secure. Her dream is to provide her children with a good education and to see them become professionals so they can help her support the family.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Lopez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a bull for fattening

loans.name: Faustina Clelia,

texts.es:
A sus 44 años Faustina ya lleva más de 20 años con su tiendita de abarrotes, gaseosas y licores. Cuando empezó fue para brindar apoyo económico al hogar, que solo estaba sustentado por los ingresos de su esposo, que trabaja en la posta de salud de Matucana.
Ahora que ya 2 de sus 3 hijos son mayores de edad y más independientes económicamente, Faustina puede reinvertir las ganancias de su negocio en el mismo, ya que su esposo logra cubrir con sus ingresos los gastos del hogar y parte de los estudios de sus hijos.
Hace 3 años Faustina empezó a sacar préstamos por EDAPROSPO, y a sus 44 años planea seguir invirtiendo en su tienda para estabilizarla  y poder mantenerse por los ingresos de ella.
texts.en:
At her 44 years Faustina already has more 20 years owning her shop of groceries, sodas, and liquors. When it began she was being offered economic support from the income of her husband, who works in a health store of Matucana. Now that 2 of her 3 children are of legal age and more independent economically, Fuastina can reinvest the profits of her business into her business, since her husband can cover the expense of the home and the part of the studies of their children with his income. Three years ago Faustina began to take out loans with EDAPROSPO, an affiliate of Kiva, and at 44 years old plans to continue investing in her store to stabilize it, and to be able to be self sufficient.

Translated from Spanish by Lois Parshley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in merchandise for her grocery store, particularly in liquor to sell for parties.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Zoila

texts.es:
La señora Zoila M. R. pertenece al Banco Comunal “Nuestra Señora de la Paz”, vive en el Av. El Ejercito Nº 353, Distrito de Tarapoto, departamento de San Martín. Es Soltera, tiene 67 años y es madre de 03 hijos, todos ya independientes. 

Con el primer préstamo de S/. 300.00, por iniciativa propia se inició vendiendo verduras. Tiene 02 años trabajando con el Banco.

En la actualidad continúa con el mismo negocio, que se encuentra ubicado en el Mercado Nº 01 y con el préstamo de S/1,000.00, que cancelara a plazo de 06 meses, lo invirtirá comprando más verduras como zanahorias, yucas, tomates, culantros, repollos al por mayor para venderlos al menudeo.

Ella, toma las decisiones en las ganancias de su negocio, cuenta que ahora se siente feliz de haber logrado que con su trabajo sus hijos sean profesionales.

 Zoila, manifiesta su agradecimiento a Manuela Ramos por permitirle crecer como empresaria y Mujer.
texts.en:
Zoila M. R. is a member of the Community Bank “Nuestra Señora de la Paz”. She lives Av. El Ejercito Nº 353, District of Tarapoto, Department of San Martín. She is 67 years old. She is single and has 3 non-dependent children. She received a first loan of 300 new soles, money that she to start her own business selling vegetables. She’s been working with the bank for 2 years. She’s currently working on the same business located at the Market #1. She is requesting for an additional loan of 1000 new soles, which will be repaid in 6 months. She will use this loan to buy vegetables such as carrots, yaccas, tomatoes, culatros and cabbage as a wholesaler to sale as retailer. She makes her own decisions about the earnings of her business. She tells us that she is very happy because this business allowed her to help her children become professionals. Zoila thanks Manuela Ramos for their support which allowed her to grow as an entrepreneur and a woman.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Lopez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase vegetables such as carrots, yaccas, tomatoes, culatros and cabbage

loans.name: Maria Felix

texts.es:
La Sra. Maria S. se dedica a la compra de variedad de panes en varias panaderias para revenderlo en diferentes comunidades, ella tiene 20 años de hacer esta actividad, anteriormente no se dedicaba al este negocio al 100% porque ella tenia la ayuda de su esposo, pero el fallecio y le ha quedado sola salir adelante con su negocio en el cual le va muy bien pero necesita comprar mas pan ya que las ventas son muy buenas y se queda sin producto rapido y ella quiere extenderse mas por otas comunidades, ella es madre de 5 hijos, 2 de ellos son jovenes y los otros 3 son de edad menor, asi ella tuvo que dedicarse a tiempo completo al negocio y como su esposo en ocasiones la llevaba a vender el producto ella se aprendio las rutas y asi sale adelante, ella ahora posee dos carros repartidores, ella lleva uno y sus hijos jovenes le ayudan con el otro.
sus hijos grandes en estos momentos no estan estudiando ya que estan dedicados al negocio al 100% pero ella quiere que estudien para que se graduen de la unversidad.
ella sale a vender su producto en diferentes comunidades y minicipios del depto de El Paraiso.
texts.en:
Maria S. buys a variety of bread in various bakeries and resells it in the villages. She has been in this business for 20 years. She used to be involved part-time because her husband also helped. However, since his death she has had to get by alone.

The business is doing well but she needs to buy more bread as sales are very good and she sells out rapidly. She wants to extend the business to other villages.

Maria has 5 children (2 are teenagers and the other 3 are younger). As a result, she had to devote herself to the business full-time. Since her husband occasionally took her out with him, she learned the sales routes. Now she has two delivery vans; she drives one herself and one of her teenage sons drives the other.

Her older children are not studying at the moment since they work full-time in the business. However, she wants them to study and obtain a university degree.She sells her products in various villages and towns in the El Paraiso department.

Translated from Spanish by John Rynne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy white bread, pan de semita, cinnamon bread, and other breads

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Marleny  Nelly,

texts.es:
Marleny empezó con el negocio de venta de productos alimentarios surtidos con una tienda en Lima centro. Lamentablemente hace 12 años  su única hermana falleció, entonces Marleny se mudó a Matucana para cuidar a su familia.
Como ya tenía experiencia en este comercio, se juntó a uno de sus hermanos para empezar con una tienda de abarrotes en Matucana. Empezaron con pocos productos, y con el tiempo fueron creciendo. Sus ganancias las utiliza para cubrir los gastos de la crianza de sus tres hijos de 15, 12 y 5 años, y las que le sobran las junta a las de sus otros hermanos para cuidar a su mamá.
Marleny es conviviente, y con su pareja también tiene un negocio de tejidos desde hace 6 años. Tienen unas maquinas industriales, y los productos que ella teje él los vende en el centro comercial Gamarra, uno de los mayores centros comerciales de micro empresarios en Lima.
Ya lleva 3 años con los préstamos de EDAPROSPO, y a sus 36 años le gustaría en el futuro tener un negocio más grande. Está conversando con sus hermanos para abrir un restaurante o un hotel como negocio familiar.
texts.en:
Marleny began a business selling food products in central Lima. Sadly, twelve years ago her only sister passed away and Marleny moved to Matucana to care for her family. As she already has experience with commerce, she joined one of her brothers to begin a grocery store in Matucana. They began with a few products and grew with time. Their profits are used to cover the expense of the raising of her three children of 15, 12, and 5 years, and further profits are used to care for their mother. Marleny has a long-term partner who also is in the business of fabrics for six years. They have industrial sewing machines, and the products they make are sold in the shopping center Gamarra, one of the shopping centers in Lima. She has worked with EDAPROSPO, an affiliate of Kiva for 3 years, and at her 36 years she would like to have a larger business in the future. She is talking with her brothers about opening a hotel or restaurant as a family business.

Translated from Spanish by Lois Parshley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Investing in fabrics for her business.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Susana

texts.es:
La señora Susana P. S. pertenece al Banco Comunal “Amistad y Paz”, vive en el Jr. Progreso, Distrito de Juanjui, departamento de San Martín. Es soltera, tiene 52 años y es madre de 06 hijos, dos mayores de edad, que ya no dependen de ella.

Con el primer préstamo de S/. 300.00 por iniciativa propia,  empezó su negocio vendiendo anticuchos. Tiene 06 años trabajando con el Banco.

En la actualidad se dedica a la costura, es modista y su especialidad es la ropa de niños, cuenta con una maquina que es su herramienta principal de trabajo. 
Con el préstamo de S/1,000.00 a plazo de 06  meses, desea invertir comprando telas en metros, hilos, elásticos, adornos en cantidad de variados colores y tener una mayor producción. 

Ahora Susana, se siente mas tranquila tanto económicamente como emocionalmente, mejor ahora, que en sus inicios, mas segura al ofrecer sus productos y al mismo tiempo mas constante y responsable con el pago de sus cuotas.

Susana, manifiesta su agradecimiento a Manuela Ramos por permitirle crecer como empresaria y Mujer.
texts.en:
Susana P. S. is a member of the Community Bank “Friendship and Peace”, District of Juanjui, Department of San Martín. She is 52 years old. She has 6 non-dependent children. She received a first loan of 300 new soles, money that she to start her own business selling kebabs or barbecue meat. She’s been working with the bank for 6 years. She’s currently working as a dressmaker. Her specialty is children’s clothes. She has one sowing machine which is a main working tool. She is requesting for an additional loan of 1000 new soles, which will be repaid in 6 months. She will use this loan to buy fabric in bulk, thread, elastics and ornaments in several colors to be able to make a larger production. Susana feels safe economically and emotionally, better now than when she first started. She is more confident about the products she offers and at the same time she is more responsible about her monthly payments. Susana thanks Manuela Ramos for their support which allowed her to grow as an entrepreneur and a woman.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Lopez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fabric, thread, elastics and ornaments

loans.name: Julia Cirila

texts.es:
Julia se crió en el cultivo de frutas, en particular de palta. A esto se dedicaban sus padres, y a esto se dedica ella ahora. Tiene una chacra donde cultiva principalmente palta, que significa que su negocio está estrechamente relacionado a la temporada de la palta. Cuando salen los frutos ella los lleva a Chosica para vender de ambulante.
También solía preparar comida para turistas que iban por esta zona, pero ya casi no hay más.
A sus 47 años ya casi no tiene gastos más que de ella misma y del hogar, como sus 4 hijos son ya mayores de edad, y solamente el más joven, de 20 años, sigue  estudiando. Junta sus ganancias a las de su esposo, que trabaja en construcción independientemente. 
Julia ya lleva 3 años con lo préstamos de EDAPROSPO, y sus planes para el futuro son de seguir creciendo en su negocio, más que nada por que los paltos plantados de nuevo se demoran unos 5 años antes de producir sus frutos.
texts.en:
Julia was raised growing fruit, particularly avocados. This is what her parents did, and, now, it is what she does. She has a small farm where her primary crop is avocados, which means that her business is intricately related to the avocado season. At harvest time she takes her fruit to Chosica to sell in the streets. She used to sell food to the tourists that visited her area, but now there are very few of them. At 47 years old her principal expenses are for herself and her home, since her four children are already grown and only the youngest, age 20, is still a student. Her income is joined by that of her husband, who is self-employed in construction. Julia has been receiving loans from EDAPROSPO for three years, and her plan for the future is to continue to develop her business, above all because newly planted avocados take five years before they begin to produce fruit.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase another small farm to be able to grow more avocados

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Sofia Esperanza

texts.es:
La Sra. Sofia P. tiene 40 años de dedicarse a la venta de ropa nueva, es notable su crecimiento y la administracion que le ha dado al mismo, ya que ella nos conto que con las ganacias que ha obtenido logro construir su casa y tambien logro comprarle una casa a una hija de ella la cual esta feliz con su matrimonio.
ademas tambien ha podido darles educacion  a sus hijos de los cuales dos de ellos ya son profesionales y le ayudan mensualmente en cosas para la casa.
de la familia ya solo depende uno y a este ella le cubre todos sus gastos completamente, el esta cursando la secundaria y luego piensa estudiar en la universidad para trabajar y ayudarle a su madre.
ella necesita el credito para poder invertir mas en productos y asi tener mayor variedad de productos, esto para tener mejores ganancias y asi poder salir adelante con su hogar.
para ella esta es la unica fuente de ingresos ya que es una señora de edad y solo esta actividad puede realizar.
texts.en:
Sofia P. has dedicated herself to the sale of new clothing for the past 40 years. The growth and administration that she has given her business is quite notable, as she has told us that with the profits she has obtained she was able to build her house and was also able to purchase a house for one of her daughters who is happily married. She has also been able to give an education to her children, two of which are now professionals and help her monthly with the household. Only one of her children is still dependent on Sofia and she completely covers all her expenses; her daughter is in secondary school and after hopes to continue onto university to work and help her mother. Sofia needs a loan to invest in more products and in that way have a better variety; this will allow her to earn better profits and be able to get ahead with her household. For Sofia this is the only source of income given that she is advanced in years and she can only carry out this activity.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase pants, blouses, shirts, umbrellas, skirts, and bags.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Jonaliza

texts.en:
Jonaliza A. operates a vegetable-vending business in the village of Barangay Nabbotuan, Solana, Cagayan. She roams around the village to sell different kinds of vegetables. She also displays some of her unsold products in front of her house every afternoon. Jonaliza is able to generate a net income of PHP350 weekly. She is very thankful that she is able to help her husband with their financial and basic needs. She is hoping to develop her vending business into a more organized and stable source of income by perseverance.

Jonaliza is requesting a loan amounting to PHP5, 000 to be used in her vending business. She is a person who is willing to extend her help to others and, if given the luck, Jonaliza is hoping for her business to improve and her income to increase while sustaining her customers’ daily needs.

Jonaliza is just 27 years old. She is married to Marcial A., who assists her in the business. They are blessed with two children. The eldest is Kyla Mae, 7, a grade one student. The second is Marc Daniel, who is 2 years old. She is hoping to improve her small business in their community.

“To plan is to do good, to achieve is to work more and fulfillment is an ultimate goal,” is a simple passage that Jonaliza uses for motivation in doing good things in favor to others.

loans.use: Business capital

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca A. is 43 years old. She lives in a rural part of Nabbotuan Solana Cagayan and is married to Alex A., 45, who works as a farmer in their village. They are blessed with a happy and God-fearing family of four children, whose ages range from 16 to 22.

Rebecca is requesting a loan for her ready-to-wear garment-selling business to purchase additional supplies of items such as blankets, pillows, t-shirts, curtains, and some other types of clothes for children and adults to satisfy her customers' needs. Her main purpose is to increase her daily income so she’ll assist her husband and improve their lives and sustain the education of their children.

She also adds that in every business dealing, she must “trust in the Lord with all her heart and never ever rely on what you think is right. Never let yourself think that you are wiser than you are, simply obey the Lord and refuse to do wrong,” said Rebecca.

loans.use: To purchase additional garments

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es:
La señora Sonia S. C., pertenece al Banco Comunal “Tesoro Escondido”, vive en el Jr. Leticia Nº 1090, Distrito de Juanjui, Departamento de San Martín. Es Soltera, tiene 37 años y es madre de 02 hijos, que todavía dependen de ella. 

Se inicio con S/. 500.00, por iniciativa propia decidió a sacar el préstamo. Y abrir su propio negocio. Tiene 05 años trabajando con el Banco.

En la actualidad continua con la  venta de Abarrotes, con el préstamo de S/3,000.00  para ser pagado en 6 meses comprará nuevos  productos para surtir su negocio como: útiles escolares como cuadernos, lapiceros, lápices, cartulinas, en cientos  que tendrán demanda en esta época de inicio de clases. 

Ella, toma las decisiones en las ganancias de su negocio, ahora se siente más Mujer, comunicativa y orgullosa, más responsable con el pago de sus cuotas y toma sus propias decisiones.

Sonia, manifiesta su agradecimiento a Manuela Ramos por permitirle crecer como empresaria y Mujer.
texts.en:
Sonia S. C. is a member of the Tesoro Escondido (Hidden Treasure) Village Bank and lives in the Department of San Martín. She is 37 and has two children who are still dependent. On her own initiative she decided to take out her first loan, for 500 soles, to open her own business. She has been working with the Village Bank for 5 years. She still sells groceries, and with her loan of 3,000 soles, which she will pay back in 6 months, she'll stock her business with school supplies by the hundreds, including notebooks, pens, pencils, and cardstock, that will be in high demand as the school year begins. It's Sonia who decides how to use her business's income and now she feels more empowered as a woman, communicates better and has more pride in herself. She is more responsible with her payments and makes her own decisions. Sonia is very appreciative of Manuela Ramos for allowing her to grow as a businessperson and a woman.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase new products in bulk, including notebooks, pens, pencils, and cardstock.

loans.name: Abegail

texts.en:
Abegail E. is only 20 years old and still single. She proves that there is no mind too young to establish and manage a business, as she manages her own business in the city proper of Cauayan City. Business minded by heart, she solely takes charge of all the responsibilities of her business while her sister, who owns the same kind of store, serves as her adviser. Right now she lives in the urban area of San Fermin, Cauayan City, with her parents.

Her monthly income in the business is about PHP5,000. She used her savings to support the needs of her parents and as revolving capital for her business. Abegail wanted to improve her business for its sustainability, so she wanted to borrow the amount of PHP25,000 for business-expansion purposes. She believes that enough capital accompanied by patience and hard work is the best way to become successful in business.

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Lucinda

texts.en:
Lucinda has been managing a hog-raising business in her village for almost four years. She generates at least PHP 5,000 every 3 - 4 months after selling the hogs.  Due to lack of financial capital to maintain her hog feed, Lucinda wants to borrow PHP5,000 only for sustenance so that she can continue to send her daughter to college and let her finish her chosen course.
 
Lucinda is already 52 years old. Her husband Irineo is a laborer in their village. They are blessed with three children: Abrey Joyce, 29 years old and married; Loida, 24 years old; and Cherry, 20 years old, who is in her second year of high school. Cherry is striving to finish her studies for the sake of her parents who sacrifice a lot to send her to school.  Lucinda is hoping to somehow live a progressive life through maintaining their hog-raising and farming businesses, which are their primary source of income for the needs of the family.

loans.use: To buy hog feed

loans.name: Cecelia

texts.en:
Cecelia A. is already 30 years old. She is happily married to Greggo A., a private employee. They are blessed with four children: Grecel, nine years old; Genesis, eight years old; Glerby, four years old; and the youngest, her 9-month-old baby boy named Griego. They lived in Barangay Minante 2, a large community, and a rural area located along the national highway. 

After managing her village store for almost five years, Cecelia wants to improve her business in order to satisfy her customers’ demands. She plans to borrow from some lenders an amount of PHP10,000 to develop her business and save money for the educational needs of her children. Cecelia tries her best to help her husband support the needs of their family, so she strives as a mother and entrepreneur. She strongly believes that living life to the fullest could satisfy everyone’s goal, which is doing what is best for her and her family in the future.

loans.use: Business development

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda D. is already 33 years old and married to Fernando D., an agent of the Beverages Company. They are blessed with five children: Angelo, 12 years old; Rosemarie, 11 years old; Alvin Jay, 8 years old; Sunsheie Mae, 5 years old; and the youngest, Alexis, 2 years old. Her first three children are all elementary students. They live in Barangay Research Minante 1, an urban area located a kilometer away from the city proper of Cauayan.  

She is a vegetable vendor at the public market in Cauayan City and she is requesting PHP7,000 from the lenders to serve as her additional capital. She wants to improve her business so that she is able to send all her children to school to lead them to a better future.

loans.use: Business Capital

loans.name: Marife

texts.en:
Mariefe N. is already 28 years old and still single. Her parents currently reside in Diadi, Nueva Vizcaya. She stays with her sister in a house at Baranggay Minante 2, a rural area. In the village, Mariefe manages a sari-sari store, a common name for a small community store.  

Her store has been operating for almost two years, and her desire to maintain and develop it leads her to borrow PHP5,000. She will use the loan to purchase additional merchandise for her store. “Do your best and God will do the rest” is her guiding principle in life. With that, Mariefe patiently works hard to develop her business and through God’s grace, she believes, it will improve in the coming years with the assistance of lenders who continuously support small entrepreneurs like her.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock

loans.name: Jaqueline Enma

texts.es:
Jaqueline se crió en el cultivo de alfalfa, como la chacra que ahora ella trabaja, que pertenecía a sus papas. Su esposo la ayuda en la siembra, pero, como el también trabaja de constructor, no siempre lo hace.
De igual manera Jaqueline conduce su negocio bastante bien, hasta logra vender el alfalfa al por mayor en Lima. Las ganancias las usa para cubrir los gastos del hogar y de la crianza de sus dos hijas de 12 y 5 años.
A sus 36 años recién empezó a recibir préstamos de EDAPROSPO, hace una semana fue su primer préstamo. Con esto capital extra espera un día poder abrir una tienda de abarrotes, que es un negocio más estable durante el año, a diferencia del cultivo que va por temporadas.
texts.en:
Jaqueline was raised growing alfalfa on her parents' small farm. Today, her husband helps her tend these same fields, but since he is also a construction worker, he is not always available. Regardless, Jaqueline manages her business well, and even sells her alfalfa wholesale in Lima. She uses her earnings to cover both her household expenses and the cost of raising her two children, ages 12 and 5. She is 36 years old and last week received her first loan from EDAPROSPO. With this additional capital investment she hopes to one day be able to open a small grocery store, a business that offers year-round stability, as opposed to farming which depends on the seasons.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in alfalfa seeds

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Alba Alejandrina

texts.es:
La Sra, Alba Z. tiene una pulperia desde hace varios años, la cual opera bajo el nombre de Pulperia ELSA, su negocio esta ubicado en su casa de habitacion, esto le permite no descuidar su hogar ni sus hijos ya que ella es madre de 4. su esposo se dedica a la compra y venta de lacteos en diferentes comunidades y caserios, tambien el ayuda cuando hay produccion de cafe y este es un dinero extra que le entra ya que no todo el año hay produccion de cafe.
Doña Alba nos conto muy alegre que su negocio ha sido una gran bendicion ya que con los ingresos que le ha dado ella a logrado remodelar su casa, ella hace poco hizo una remodelaciona a su casa en todo el techo y esto la dejo un poco descapitalizada y por tal razon quiere un credito para poder salir adelante.
texts.en:
Alba Z. has owned a small grocery store for many years, which she operates under the name Pulperia ELSA. Her business is located in the house in which she lives, and this allows her to care for her home and children given that she is a mother of four. Her husband buys and sells dairy products in different communities and villages; he also helps when there is coffee production, and this is extra money that comes in given that coffee is not produced year round. Alba told us happily that her business has been a great blessing given that with the income that it has given her she was able to remodel her house; not long ago she remodeled her entire roof which left her lacking some capital and for this reason she is requesting a loan to be able to get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase lard, oil, margarine, beans, rice, coffee, bread, sugar, soap, soft drinks, juices, churros, eggs, and spices.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Silvia

texts.es:
La señora Silvia P. F., pertenece al Banco Comunal “Tesoro Escondido”, vive en el Jr. Prolongación Loreto Cdra. 02, Distrito de Juanjui, Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente,  tiene 37 años y es madre de 03 hijos, 02 que todavía dependen de ella.
