Se inició, con un capital de S/. 200.00, por iniciativa propia, se inicio vendiendo abarrotes  en pequeñas cantidades. Actualmente, se dedica a la venta de abarrotes como (gaseosas, papel higiénico, aceites, gaseosas, etc).

Actualmente continúa con el mismo negocio y con el  préstamo de S/3,000.00 a plazo de 06 meses,  comprará  productos para el aseo personal como jabones, champú, cremas, así mismo bebidas gasificadas en sus diversas marcas y sabores  para surtir su venta y mantener a sus clientes satisfechos. 

Es una mujer con mucho optimismo y segura de si misma. 

Silvia, manifiesta su agradecimiento a Manuela Ramos por permitirle crecer como empresaria y Mujer.
texts.en:
Silvia P. F. is a member of the Tesoro Escondido (Hidden Treasure) Village Bank. She lives in the Juanjui district in the Department of San Martín. She is 37, and has a common law husband and three children, two of whom are still dependent. She started out with 200 soles, and on her own initiative began selling groceries in small quantities. Today she is still selling groceries, including soft drinks, toilet paper, oils, etc. She continues to run the same business, and with her loan of 3,000 soles, which she will pay back in 6 months, she will buy personal products like soaps, shampoos, and creams, and various brands and flavors of soft drinks to stock up her store and keep her customers happy. Silvia is a very optimistic and self-assured woman. She is very appreciative of Manuela Ramos for allowing her to grow as a businessperson and a woman.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy personal products: soaps, shampoos, creams, etc.

loans.name: Esperanza

texts.es:
Esperanza lleva 10 años trabajando junto a su esposo la chacra que heredaron de los padres de él. Los productos de la chacra, principalmente palta pero a veces también manzanas y alfalfa, los llevan a Chosica y los venden de ambulantes.
Esperanza recibe préstamos de EDAPROSPO desde hace 3 años, y eso le ha permitido poder utilizar lo que le sobra de las ganancias que utiliza para cubrir los gastos del hogar y de la crianza de su dos hijas de 11 y 4 años como ahorros para ir construyendo su casa.
A sus 34 años Esperanza planea seguir trabajando su chacra, por que esta es la tradición en su pueblo y hasta ahora le va bien para el cuidado de su familia.
texts.en:
Esperanza and her husband have been working the small farm they inherited from his parents for 10 years. They take their produce, mainly avocado but sometimes apples and alfalfa as well, to Chosica and sell it on the street. Esperanza has been receiving loans from EDAPROSPO for 3 years, which has enabled her to save whatever's left over from her income after covering domestic expenses and the care of her two daughters, 11 and 4 years old, in order to build a house. Esperanza, 34 years old, plans to keep working her farm, since that's the tradition in her village and so far it's maintained her family well.

Translated from Spanish by Andrea Rosenberg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in insecticides to protect her avocado crop

loans.name: Zary

texts.es:
La señora Zary V. R., pertenece al Banco Comunal “Amistad y Paz”, vive en el Jr. La Merced Nº 268, Distrito de Juanjui, Departamento de San Martín. Es conviviente, tiene 26 años y es madre de 2 hijos, uno que todavía depende de ella. 

Con el primer préstamo de S/. 300.00, empezó vendiendo sus marcianos, gaseosas y hielos. Tiene 03 años trabajando con el Banco. En la actualidad se dedica a la Venta de Abarrotes, en su negocio que  se encuentra ubicado en su misma casa.

Con el préstamo de S/1,500.00 que cancelará a plazo de 06  meses, desea invertirlo, ampliando e implementando su negocio, y comprar arroz y azúcar en sacos, como también útiles escolares, cuadernos en cientos, lapiceros, borradores, papel de escritorio, para atender la actual demanda de sus clientes.   

Ella, toma las decisiones en las ganancias de su negocio, se siente tranquila y deseosa de seguir con sus proyectos. 

Zary, manifiesta su agradecimiento a Manuela Ramos por permitirle crecer como empresaria y Mujer.
texts.en:
Zary V. R. is a member of the Amistad y Paz (Friendship and Peace) Village Bank. She lives in the Juanjui District in the Department of San Martín. She is 26, has a common law husband, and is the mother of two children, one of whom is still dependent. With her first loan, for 300 soles, she began selling marcianos (popsicles), soft drinks and ice. She has been working with the Village Bank for three years. Currently she earns her living selling groceries from her own house. She would like to invest her loan of 1,500 soles, which she will pay back in 6 months, in building and expanding her business. She will buy rice and sacks of sugar, as well as school supplies, including notebooks in bulk, pens, erasers, and office paper to meet her customers' demands. Zary makes her own decisions regarding her business income. She feels at peace and is eager to move ahead with her projects. She is grateful to Manuela Ramos for letting her grow as both a businessperson and a woman.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar, and school supplies, including notebooks, pens, and erasers for her business.

loans.name: Komi Galé

texts.fr: Komi galé est un monsieur qui est marié à une dame qui est revendeuse, ils ont 03 enfants, il fait la soudure à l’arc, il est le seul soudeur dans son quartier ce qui lui permet d’avoir beaucoup de clients, ses matériaux de travail étant vétuste, il demande un prêt afin de s’acheter de nouveaux matériaux de travail et livrer les commandes à temps. Avec le revenu de son activité il subvient aux charges de sa famille.
texts.en:
Komi Galé is a gentleman who is married to a lady who is a retailer. They have three children. He is an arc welder, the only one in his district. This allows him to have many customers. Since his tools of the trade are antiquated, he’s asking for a loan in order to buy new equipment for his work and to fulfill his orders on time. With the income from his work, he provides for his family.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy equipment and supplies for work

loans.name: Silvia

texts.es:
La señora Silvia P. G. pertenece al Banco Comunal “Tesoro Escondido”,  vive en el Jr. Triunfo Nº 1112, Distrito de Juanjui, Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada,  tiene 58 años y es madre de 05 hijos.
Ella se inicio sola, con un capital de S/. 500.00, por iniciativa propia, su primer negocio fue vendiendo menú. Tiene 07 años trabajando con el Banco. 

Actualmente, cambio de negocio, y hace tres meses, se dedica a la venta de frutas, ubicada en su propia casa. Con el préstamo de S/3,000.00 que cancelara a plazo de 06  meses,  invirtirá comprando frutas como mangos, manzanas, uvas en cajas, parte d su dinero lo invertirá en la siembra de cacao, cultivo al que también se dedica. 

Hoy, se siente mas independiente y segura, ya que es ella quien tomas sus propias decisiones en su negocio y en los ingresos que genera. 

Silvia, manifiesta su agradecimiento a Manuela Ramos por permitirle crecer como empresaria y Mujer.
texts.en:
Silvia P. G. is a member of the Tesoro Escondido (Hidden Treasure) Village Bank. She lives in the Juanjui District in the Department of San Martín. She is 58, married, and has 5 children. She started out by herself with a loan of 500 soles, and on her own initiative opened her first business, selling set-menu meals. She has been working with the Village Bank for 7 years. For the past three months she has had a new business, and now makes her living selling fruits from her house. She plans to use her loan of 3,000 soles, which she will repay in 6 months, to buy fruits, including mangos, apples, and crates of grapes. She'll invest part of her money in growing cacao, which she also does for a living. Nowadays Sylvia feels more independent and secure because she makes her own decisions regarding her business and its earnings. She would like to express her appreciation to Manuela Ramos for allowing her to grow as a businessperson and a woman.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy mangos, apples, and grapes, and to grow cacao.

loans.name: Komlavi

texts.fr: Monsieur komlan kouwoada habite adidogomé, un quartier de la ville de lomé, il est marié avec 04 personnes à charges, sa femme est une revendeuse. L’activité qui lui permet de subvenir aux charges de sa famille est la vente de ventilos, verres, montres et des fleurs, il fait ce commerce depuis 1994 dans sa propre boutique qu’il a appelé Ets K&K. il sollicite afin d’augmenter son stock un crédit pour l’achat de ventilos, fleurs, verres et montres
texts.en:
Mr. Komlan Kouwoada lives in Adidogomé, a district of the city of Lomé. He is married and has four people to support. His wife is a retailer. The work enabling him to provide for his family involves selling electric fans, drinking glasses, wristwatches, and flowers. He has been in this business since 1994 in his own shop, which he calls “Ets K&K”. He’s requesting a loan to augment his inventory by buying fans, flowers, glasses, and watches.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy electric fans, drinking glasses, wristwatches

loans.name: Siloe Group

texts.es:
El Grupo Siloe tiene como coordinadora a la Sra Guillermina P. Cerrrato de 39 años de edad quien se dedicaba a la elaboracion de zapatos, debido a que su esposo es quien le ayudaba a la elaboracion de los zapatos y quien actualmente se dedica al rubro del transporte no pudo seguir fabricando los zapatos y ella se dedica a la compra de zapatos en fabricas y se los venden a precio de mayorista y asi puede tener una mejor ganancia al vender el producto y de esa manera ella esta colaborando con los gastos del hogar.
La Sra. Dunia Y. de 32 años de edad quien se dedica a la produccion y venta de tortillas, ella se levanta bien temprano 4:00am para empezar a hacer la masa para las tortillas y asi poder tenerlas listas a las 7:00am para salir a venderlas ya que las tortillas se venden en la mañana porque son acompañantes del desayuno y del almuerzo en su mayoria todos los hondureños comen muchas tortillas ya que es un alimento por asi decirlo indispensable en los tres tiempos de comida.
La Sra. Lidia M. de 58 años de edad se dedica a la venta de jabon, papel higienico y sandalias, estos productos los vende en diferentes empresas estatales y privadas su producto lo vende al credito y tiene mucha demanda ya que lo vende a un muy precio, tambien viaja a la zona sur para vender este producto pero ahi lo vende al contado.
todas ellas necesitan el credito para salir adelante con sus negocios.
texts.en:
The Siloe Group is coordinated by Guillermina P. Cerrrato who is 39 years old. Previously Guillermina dedicated herself to shoe making, however, because her husband who previously helped her make these shoes is currently working in the area of transportation, she was not able to continue fabricating shoes. She now purchases shoes in factories and sells them at a wholesale price; this way she can earn more when she sells the product and in that way help with household expenses. Dunia Y. is 32 years old and dedicates herself to the production and sale of tortillas. Dunia wakes up very early at 4:00 am to begin making the dough for the tortillas to be able to have them ready by 7:00 am when she heads out and sells them given that tortillas are sold in the morning because they are consumed with breakfast and lunch. For the most part all Hondurans eat a lot of tortillas as it is said to be an indispensable part of the 3 meals of the day. Lidia M. is 58 years old and dedicates herself to the sale of soap, toilet paper, and sandals. She sells these products to different state and private companies on credit, and has a lot demand given that she sells at a good price. She also travels to the south region to sells her product but sells it there for cash. All the women need this loan to able to succeed in their businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: compra de zapatos, leña, harina de maiz, agua, cal, papel higienico, sandalias

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Shirley

texts.es:
La señora Shirley M. G., pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Decididas”, vive en el Jr. Leguia cdra. 07, Distrito de Tarapoto, Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 57 años y es madre 02 hijos, 01 que depende de ella.

Con el primer préstamo de S/. 300.00, motivada por una amiga , se inició trabajando en su casa, en Tapicería  con la ayuda de  una maquina de coser. Tiene 01 año trabajando con el Banco.

En la actualidad se  dedica al mismo negocio, con pedidos y con el préstamo de  S/1,500.00 que cancelará a plazo de 06 meses, piensa ampliar e implementar su negocio, con telas en rollos, hilos para  tapizados para muebles del hogar y vehículos motorizados.

Ella; toma las decisiones en los gastos y ganancias de su negocio. En lo personal,  se siente una Mujer independiente, decidida y más segura, responsable con el pago de sus cuotas y sabe tomar sus propias decisiones. 

Shirley, manifiesta su agradecimiento a Manuela Ramos por permitirle crecer como empresaria y Mujer.
texts.en:
Shirley M. G. is a member of Banco Comunal “Las Decididas.” She lives in the Tarapoto District in the department of San Martín. She is married, 57 years old, and has two children, one of whom still lives at home. Inspired by a friend and with an initial loan of 300 soles, she started working from her house, doing upholstery with the aid of a sewing machine. She's been working with the bank for one year. She is currently engaged in the same business. By receiving more orders and a loan of 1500 soles, which she will pay off in six months, she hopes to expand her business and purchase bolts of cloth and thread for upholstering household furniture and motor vehicles. She makes the decisions about her business's expenses and earnings. She is an independent woman, decisive and secure, responsible in making her payments, and she knows how to make her own decisions. Shirley expresses her gratitude to Manuela Ramos for enabling her to grow as a business owner and as a woman.

Translated from Spanish by Andrea Rosenberg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase bolts of cloth and upholstery thread for her business

loans.name: Améyo

texts.fr: Cette dame réside dans le quartier d’adidogomé, elle exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce d’ignA. et de diverses céréales dans sa boutique qu’elle appelle « Ets Dieu de grace ». Les propriétaires de restaurant viennent acheter chez cette dame de l’igname pour préparer du fufu qui est très apprécié dans la cuisine togolaise. Son stock de marchandises étant épuisé, elle sollicite un crédit chez wages pour l’achat d’ignA. et de céréales, elle est mariée et a un enfant.
texts.en:
This is a lady who resides in the Adidogomé district. Her income-generating work involves commerce in yams and in various grains out of her shop, which she calls « Ets Dieu de grace ». Restaurant owners come to this lady to buy yams for making fufu, which is highly appreciated in Togolese cuisine. Her stock of merchandise being exhausted, she’s requesting a loan from WAGES to buy yams and grain. She is married and has a child.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy yams and grain

loans.name: Segunda Josefa

texts.es:
La señora Segunda Josefa R. D. R., pertenece al Banco Comunal “Tesoro Escondido”, vive en el Jr. Triunfo Nº 1136, Distrito D. Juanjui, Departamento D. San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 62 años y es madre D. 03 hijos, todos  independientes. 

Con el primer préstamo D. S/. 500.00, por iniciativa propia  inicio su negocio vendiendo golosinas. Tiene 02 años trabajando con el Banco.

En la actualidad continua con el mismo negocio, con el préstamo D. S/3,000.00 a plazo D. 06 meses, compraría más productos para surtir su negocio como galletas, chocolates, caramelos, en cajas, bebidas gasificadas como gaseosas y agua mineral además comprará una vitrina mas granD. para exhibir sus productos.

 Ella, es quien toma sus propias decisiones,  se una  considera una mujer luchadora y con mucha perseverancia para alcanzar sus objetivos.
texts.en:
Segunda Josefa R. D. R. is a member of Banco Comunal “Tesoro Escondido.” She lives in Juanjui District in the department of San Martín. She is married, 62 years old, and mother of 3 children, all of whom live on their own. With an initial loan of 500 soles, she started a business selling sweets on her own initiative. She's been working with the communal bank for two years. She is currently engaged in the same business. With this loan of 3000 soles, to be paid off in 6 months, she will buy more products to stock her business, like boxes of cookies, chocolates, and candy, and carbonated drinks like sodas and mineral water. She will also buy a larger display case for her products. She is someone who makes her own decisions. She considers herself to be a fighter with the perseverance to achieve her goals.

Translated from Spanish by Andrea Rosenberg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase products to stock her store, as well as a larger display case

loans.name: Dios Proveera Group

texts.es:
El Grupo Dios Proveera consta de dos mujeres y un hombre, Gloria Z. tiene 41 años de edad, ella vive en union libre con Valentin Castellanos con el cual tiene 3 hijos los cuales estan en la secundaria y uno en la escuela, ella se dedica a la produccion y venta de tortillas, ella es muy comprometida con su trabajo el cual le genera ingresos para mantener su familia, el negocio de vender tortillas es bueno porque este alimento es muy vendido todos los dias.
Aida D. vive en union libre con Carlos T. quien se dedica a la venta de paletas y ella se dedica a la produccionn y venta de tortillas, tienen 3 hijos pequeños y junto con los ingresos de su compañero de hogar logran sacar adelante su hogar.
Jeiby T. es un joven de 24 años de edad el cual tiene su propio taxi, el se dedica al negocio de transportar personas, este negocio le genera buenos ingresos, el tiene dos hijos, en estos momentos el necesita comprar repuestos para reparar su unidad ya que es su unica fuente de ingresos.
todos ellos necesitan el credito para salir adelante y asi poder  mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
The Group Dios Proveera [God Will Provide] is composed of two women and one man. Gloria Z. is 41 years old, and lives with her common law partner Valentin Castellanos with whom she has 3 children; two of her children are in secondary school and one is in elementary school. She dedicates herself to the production and sale of tortillas; she is very committed to her work which generates income to support her family. The tortilla selling business is good because this food sells very well every day. Aida D. lives with her common law partner Carlos T. who sells popsicles and she dedicates herself to the production and sale of tortillas. They have 3 small children and with her live in partner’s income they are able to help their household thrive. Jeiby T. is a 24 year old young man who has his own taxi. He dedicates himself to his business of transporting people; this business generates a good income for him. He has two children. At this moment he needs to purchase parts to repair his taxi given that it is his only source of income. All the members of the Group Dios Proveera need a loan to get ahead and in that way better their quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase corn flour, lime, wood, water, and car parts.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Rahaman

texts.fr: Monsieur  R. rahman est  un homme marié qui a 03 enfants et qui habite avec sa famille le quartier d’adidogomé. Il exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce de pièces détachées, il fait ce commerce depuis 2004 et s’approvisionne au port autonome de lomé et quelques fois au ghana. il fait face actuellement à une demande très élevée et pour pouvoir y satisfaire, il demande à wages un crédit pour se réapprovisionner en pièces détachées.
texts.en:
Mr. R. Rahman is a married man who has three children. He lives with this family in the Adidogomé district. His income-generating work involves commerce in spare parts, a business he has been in since 2004. He acquires his supplies at the autonomous port of Lomé and sometimes in Ghana. Presently, he is facing a very high demand. And to satisfy it, he’s asking WAGES for a loan, so as to resupply himself with spare parts.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy spare parts

loans.name: Vilma

texts.es:
La señora Vilma C. Z., pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Moralinas”, vive en el Jr. Los Andes Nº 636, Distrito de Morales, Departamento de San Martín. Es casada, tiene 51 años, y es madre de 05 hijos, 01 que todavía depende de ella.

Con el primer préstamo de S/. 300.00, que fue por iniciativa propia, se inició con un pequeño negocio en venta de abarrotes. Tiene 02 años trabajando con el Banco.

En la actualidad continúa con el mismo de negocio, como aceites, fideos, leches grandes y pequeñas, enlatados como atunes, sardinas; galletas dulces y saladas; chicles, chupetines y caramelos, y con el préstamo de S/1,200.00 a plazo de 06 meses, lo piensa invertir comprando más productos para surtir su negocio.

Ella es quien maneja los gastos y ganancias de su negocio. En lo personal, siente mas tranquila, más segura, responsable con el pago de sus cuotas y toma sus propias decisiones.

Vilma, manifiesta su agradecimiento a Manuela Ramos por permitirle crecer como empresaria y Mujer.
texts.en:
Vilma C. Z. is a member of the Banco Comunal “Las Moralinas.” She lives in the Morales District in the department of San Martín. She is married, 51 years old, and has five children, one of whom still lives at home. With her first loan of 300 soles, requested on her own initiative, she started a small business selling groceries. She has been working with the communal bank for two years. Currently, she is still running the same business, selling oils, pastas, milk, canned goods like tuna and sardines, cookies and crackers, and candies. With this loan of 1200 soles, to be paid off in 6 months, she plans to invest in more inventory to stock her business. She manages her business's expenses and earnings. She feels calmer and more secure, is responsible in making her payments, and makes her own decisions. Vilma expresses her gratitude to Manuela Ramos for enabling her to grow as a business owner and as a woman.

Translated from Spanish by Andrea Rosenberg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase stock for her store

loans.name: Guadalupe Group

texts.es: El banco comunal "Guadalupe" esta representado por la señora Pacesa y es un grupo nuevo que esta formado por 12 personas que se dedican a actividades comerciales como a la venta D. dulces, comida, pan, ropa, servicio D. trasporte en moto taxis y al servicio D. limpieza. Los socios (as) están concientes D. la competencia pero su deseo D. superación y su necesidad D. mantener a su familia es más granD.. El financiamiento esta destinado a la compra D. insumos, materiales y al mejoramiento D. las herramientas D. trabajo. Los socios (as) cuentan con experiencia en grupos solidarios y saben como cumplir con sus obligaciones en especial si les sirve para mejorar la calidad D. vida D. sus familias.
texts.en:
The Guadalupe Communal Bank has 12 members and is represented by Señora Pacesa. It is a new group and many of its members dedicate themselves to businesses like selling sweets, meals, and clothing. Other members run motorcycle taxis or offer cleaning services. The group's members are good at what they do but more than anything, they are driven by a desire to succeed and the need to support their families. This loan will be used to buy ingredients, supplies, and to improve the tools that the members work with. The members have experience with communal banking and are mutually supportive. They also know how to manage their obligations responsibly and do so because it helps them improve their families' quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Sara Sultan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
Victoria es socia del Bancomunal El Sembrador.
Victoria es conviviente, tiene tres hijos, todos mayores y están casados. 
Victoria es de profesión enfermera trabajo en diferentes  hospitales pero por motivos de resecion la despidieron y tuvo que optar por  trabajar independientemente.  Desde hace siete años empezó a dar desayuno  se levanta a las cinco de la mañana para prepara el desayuno.  
Desde que esta en Finca el negocio de victoria ha mejorado, ha podido comprar cosas como andamios, mesas para su negocio, para dar una mejor atención al publico.  
Victoria necesita un préstamo de 1600 soles, para comprar víveres arroz, azúcar, leche, menestras,  para dar desayuno.
El sueño de Victoria es seguir triunfando en el negocio y dejar su negocio bien establecido para sus hijos.
texts.en:
Victoria is a member of Village Bank El Sembrador. She and her live-in partner have three children, now adult and married. Victoria is a nurse by profession, and worked in many diffferent hospitals. She was laid off due to recession, however, and had to find work independently. Seven years ago she began selling breakfast, and gets up at 5 in the morning to begin preparation. Since joining the bank Victoria's business has improved, allowing her to buy items like shelves and tables for her business, in order to provide better service to her customers. Victoria requires a loan of 1600 soles in order to purchase supplies - rice, sugar, milk, and legumes - to prepare breakfasts. Victoria hopes to continue succeeding in order to leave a well established business to her children.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Martyn, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing food for breakfast sales

loans.name: Rosa Amelia

texts.es:
Rosa es socia del Bancomunal El Sembrador.
Rosa es  casada,  tiene seis hijos, la ultima tiene 12 años, esta estudiando en la escuela especial para ciegos.
Rosa  estudio costura y se puso a trabajar desde los dieciocho años, empezó a coser en su casa ropa a medida,  hasta el día de hoy ella sigue  cosiendo ropa a medida, también quiere abrir una bodega en su casa. 
Desde que esta en Finca tiene mas capital para trabajar, ha aprendido a ahorrar, hacer responsable con el dinero que solicita.
Rosa necesita un crédito de 1200 soles,  para abrir una bodega en su casa y comprar arroz, azúcar, fideos, aceite.
El sueño de Rosa es poner  un taller de costura.
texts.en:
Rosa is a member of Village Bank El Sembrador. She is married with six children, the youngest of whom is 12 and studies in a special school for the blind. Rosa studied sewing and began working at eighteen. She began by sewing clothing made-to-measure in her home. She continues to do this today, but would also like to open a convenience store in her home. Since joining Kiva Partner Finca Peru she has more working capital and has learned how to save and be responsible with the money she borrows. Rosa requires a loan of 1200 soles in order to open this shop and to buy rice, sugar, noodles, and oil. Her dream is to one day open up a tailor's workshop.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Martyn, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Building a store and purchasing merchandise

loans.name: Horizonte Group

texts.es: LAS SOCIAS D.  LA BANCA COMUNAL "HORIZONTE", SON SOCIAS DEL BARRIO INTERNACIONAL Y ESTAN REPRESENTADAS POR LA SEÑORA RULIDELFI. COMO VECINAS DEL BARRIO DECIDIERON ORGANIZARCE  PARA SOLICITAR EL CREDITO YA QUE SON GENTE D. CONFIANZA. LAS SOCIAS TIENEN DIFERENTES NEGOCIOS ALGUNOS YA ESTABLECIDOS Y OTROS AMBULANTES COMO VENTA D. COSMETICOS, VENTA D. PAN, TIENDA D. ABARROTES Y VENTA D. COMIDA, EL SOCIO PARTICIPANTE ES CHOFER CON MOVILIDAD PROPIA, TODOS TIENEN UN MOVIMIENTO ECONÓMICO DIARIO. EN CUANTO A LA COMPETENCIA SE PUED. DECIR QUE ELLAS ESTAN CONSCIENTES D. LA MISMA PERO SABEN COMO SALIR ADELANTE GRACIAS A SU EXPERIENCIA Y SUS GANAS D. TRABAJAR. EL CREDITO ESTA DESTINADO A SURTIR SUS NEGOCIOS D. NUEVOS PRODUCTOS D. MEJOR CALIDAD Y A LA COMPRA D. INSUMOS, MATERIALES Y HERRAMIENTAS PARA UN MEJOR DESEMPEÑO Y A LA COMPRA D. REPUESTOS. LO QUE RESPECTA A AGROCAPITAL UN 70% PARTICIPARON EN UN PRIMER  CICLO, Y SEGÚN EL ANALISIS REALIZADO TIENEN BUENA SOLVENCIA MORAL Y CAPACIDAD D. PAGO.
texts.en:
The members of the community bank Horizon are members of the International Neighborhood and are represented by Mrs. Rulidelfi. As neighbors in the community they decided to organize to request the loan since they are trustworthy people. The members have different businesses, some already in established locations and others mobile, like selling cosmetics, selling bread, a grocery store, and selling meals. The male group member is a driver with his own transportation. All the members have daily economic activity. Regarding the competition, they can say that they are aware of it but know how to move ahead thanks to their experience and their desire to work. The credit is intended to supply their businesses with new products of better quality and for the purchase of supplies, materials, and tools for better performance and for the purchase of spare parts. With respect to Agrocapital, 70% participated in a first loan cycle and according to the analysis carried out have good moral responsibility and the capacity to repay.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Burke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating Capital

loans.name: Maria Auxiliadora

texts.es: Doña Maria Auxiliadora es soltera, de 50 años de edad, tiene 3 hijos mayores de edad, ninguno esta bajo su cargo, pero uno habita en su casa, esta solicitando su 3er credito el cual utilizará para su cocina, ya que los vientos de Febrero se la destruyeron, cabe señalar que no estaba con muchas condiciones , pero sí le servia para realizar la preparacion de sus alimentos.  Doña Maria Auxiliadora trabaja como conserje en el Centro Social S.O.S. con 17 años de servicio, se ha destacado como una excelente trabajadora y recibe el cariño de todos sus compañeros de trabajo, asi mismo se ha caracterizado por ser una excelente clienta con el pago de sus creditos en tiempo y forma, haciendose merecedora del calificativo de clienta "A".
texts.en:
Maria Auxiliadora is 50 years old and single. She has 3 children who are grown and out of her care, but one lives at home with her. She is asking for her 3rd loan, which she will use towards her kitchen that was destroyed by wind in February. Even though her kitchen was not in the best condition, she was able to prepare her food there. Maria Auxiliadora works as a concierge in the S.O.S. Social Center. With 17 years of service, she stands out as an excellent worker and is liked by all her co-workers. She is also an excellent client because she pays her loans on time. She deserves the rank of "top" client.

Translated from Spanish by Kelly Wester, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: kitchen construction

loans.name: Jorge Nicolas

texts.es: Jorge Nicolas es soltero, de 50 años de edad, con 3 hijos estudiando la primaria (1º, 4º y 6º grado) es trabajador de la Alcaldia Municipal con 5 años de servicio desempeñandose como Policia Municipal, su compalera la Sra. Teodora Alvarez no trabaja, se dedica a cuidar a sus hijos y el hogar, don Jorge ademas de su salario recibe una pension del INSS como lisiado de guerra, esta solicitando su primer credito  a AFODENIC para la construccion de una letrina, ademas desea forrar su casa, ya que la mitad es de concreto y el resto de madera y zinc, con el dinero del credito necesita hacer lo posible para cumplir con lo planificado, en caso de no poder concluir la obra, solicitara un nuevo credito para finalizar, ya que su sueño es alcanzar una vivienda digna para sus hijos y su compañera de vida.
texts.en:
Jorge Nicolas is 50 years old and single. He has 3 children in elementary school (1st, 4th, and 6th grades). For 5 years he has worked for the town as a municipal police officer. His significant other, Teodora Alvarez, does not work. She is a homemaker and takes care of the children. In addition to his salary, Jorge receives a disabled veteran's pension from INSS. He is applying for his first AFODENIC loan so he can build a latrine. He also wants to put siding or covering on his house since one half is concrete and the rest is wood and zinc. He will try to finish these plans with the loan money. If he cannot finish the job, then he will apply for a new loan because he hopes to have a decent home for his children and his partner.

Translated from Spanish by Kelly Wester, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Contruction: latrine

loans.name: Inocencia Del Carmen

texts.es: Doña Inocencia es soltera, de 51 años de edad, con 5 hijos, 4 casados y 1 hija a su cargo estudiando el 2do año de secundaria, su trabajo lo desarrolla en el Centro Social S.O.S como responsable de cocina, con 14 años de trabajo, donde inicia labores a las 6:30 a.m. hasta las 6:00 p.m., 3 de sus hijos estan fuera del pais y esporadicamente recibe ayuda de ellos.   Esta solicitando su 3er credito con urgencia, ya que desea construir 8 varas de tapia para evitar que el agua del patio vecino llegue a su casa, pues esto ha sido un constante problema para ella, porque en el invierno pasan con los pies mojados cada que llueve, la tapia completa es de 30 vras, pero iniciara con 8 que es lo mas urgente y despues si se puede continuara con el resto.  Manifiesta que se siente muy contenta con el apoyo que AFODENIC le ha brindado y la confianza que ha recibido de parte del personal, pues está dispuesta a continuar una excelente clienta y seguir manteniendo su record crediticio que es lo que todo cliente debe cuidar.
texts.en:
Inocencia is 51 years old and single. She has five children. Four of them are married, and one daughter goes to high school. Inocencia is in charge of the kitchen at the S.O.S Social Center. She has worked there for fourteen years, from 6:30 am until 6:00 pm. Three of her children live outside the country, and she receives help from them sporadically. She is urgently applying for her 3rd loan because she wants to have eight wall sections put in to keep water from the neighboring patio from getting into her house. This has been a constant problem for her because in the winter people walk around with wet feet every time it rains. The completed wall will have thirty sections, but she is going to start with the eight that are the most pressing. She will do the rest later if she is able to. She is very happy with the support that AFODENIC has given her and the confidence that its personnel have shown in her. She is ready to continue being an excellent client and maintain a good credit record, which she believes all clients should take care to do.

Translated from Spanish by Kelly Wester, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build a wall

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.es: La señora Magdalena vive con su hija, porque su esposo trabaja en los Estados Unidos y les manda dinero para cubrir los gastos familiares , pero en la escuela de su hija le acaban de requerir unos útiles escolares y ese es el motivo por el cual están solicitando este crédito, así su pequeña tendrá un mayor aprovechamiento.
texts.en:
Magdalena lives with her daughter because her husband works in the United States, sending them money to cover household expenses. Her daughter's school requires school supplies, so she is applying for this loan. The loan will give her child better opportunities.

Translated from Spanish by Kelly Wester, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: School supplies

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Sara Elia

texts.es:
La señora Sara Elia tiene la concesión de una tienda de abarrotes, saben que con empeño, constancia y esfuerzo lograran todos sus objetivos, ella cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo el señor Andrés Cárdenas que labora como locutor de una conocida estación de radio.
Juntos como una familia unida y estable solicitan este crédito para la inversión de mercancía en su negocio.
texts.en:
Sara Elia has a grocery store franchise. They know that with hard work, perseverance, and effort they will achieve their goals. She relies on her husband, Andrés Cárdenas, for support. He is a radio announcer for a well-known station. They are applying for this loan together as a united and stable family. She will use it to invest in goods for her business.

Translated from Spanish by Kelly Wester, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in the business

loans.name: Jose Angel

texts.es:
El señor José Ángel Padrón al igual que su esposa la señora Virgen del Carmen tiene su negocio propio llamado “los 3 hermanos” negocio que lleva establecido 3 años.
Luchando día con día para salir adelante, esforzandose por su negocio, motivo por el cual están solicitando este crédito, para invertir en el y que sus ingresos se sigan incrementando.
texts.en:
José Ángel Padrón along with his wife, Virgen del Carmen, has his own business called “Los 3 Hermanos.” It was established three years ago. They fight to get ahead every day, working hard for the business. They are applying for this loan so they can invest in the business and keep their income rising.

Translated from Spanish by Kelly Wester, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in the business

loans.name: Albertina

texts.es:
En el municipio de Cinco Pinos de la ciudad de Chinandega, la señora Albertina L. se dedica con gran esfuerzo a su negocio de elaboracion y venta de tortillas las cuales son comercializadas por ella misma en su localidad donde a diario se desempeña.

A pesas de las dificiles situaciones economicas que ella ha atravesado ha logrado salir adelante y para esto ha acudido a Ceprodel para ser beneficiada con un crédito que le permita la compra de la materia prima como lo es el maíz para continuar en su negocio de elaboración de tortillas.
texts.en:
In the municipality of Cinco Pinos in the city of Chinandega, Mrs. Albertina L. works extremely hard making and selling tortillas. She markets the tortillas herself in her region and she does very well every day. Despite the difficult economic situations she has faced, she has succeded in coming out on top. This is why she has gone to Kiva Partner Ceprodel in order to get a loan to buy the basic materials such as corn in order to continue making tortillas.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Martyn, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of ingredients

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Hipólita

texts.es:
La señora Hipolita G. se dedica a su actividad de crianza de ganado en el municipio de Cinco Pinos de la ciudad de Chinandega donde a diario da lugar a la crianza del ganado que con mucho esfuerzo alimenta y vela por su desarrollo para luego que crezcan extraer la leche para la venta o comercializar dicho ganado.

El motivo por el cual ella ha acudido a Ceprodel es para obtener un crédito para la compra del ganado ya que requiere de dichos animales para continuar en su actividad y así continuar llevando el sustento a su casa de habitación.
texts.en:
Mrs. Hipolitia Garcia works raising livestock in the municipality of Cinco Pinos in the city of Chinandega. Every day she cares for these animals, feeding them and watching over them so that when they are grown she will be able to sell them or their milk to earn a living. The reason she has approached Kiva partner Ceprodel is to obtain a loan to buy more cattle, as she needs these animals to continue earning money and taking care of her home.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Martyn, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of livestock

loans.name: Jairo Alberto

texts.es:
El señor Jairo B. es un caballero que se dedica a su actividad ganadera la cual lleva a cabo en el municipio de Cinco Pinos donde ha adquirido amplia experiencia en su actividad al interactuar mucho con los animales.

Se ha destacado por ser una persona muy trabajadora y por ser muy responsable en su trabajo. La situación que él hoy en día atraviesa es que requiere de la inversión en la compra de ganado y para eso acude a Ceprodel esperando que le proporcione un crédito para comprar dicho ganado y así seguir laborando en su comunidad.
texts.en:
Mr. Jairo B. is a gentleman who works raising livestock in the municipality of Cinco Pinos, where he has gainded a great deal of experience by interacting a lot with animals. He has made a name for himself by being a very hardworking and responsible person. He now requires a greater investment in his herd, so has gone to Kiva Partner Ceprodel in the hopes that they will provide him with a loan to buy more cattle and thus continue working in his community.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Martyn, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of livestock

loans.name: Leonel Mejia

texts.es:
El negocio al que muy esforzadamente se dedica el señor Leonel Mejía es a atender su pulpería el cual posee desde hace varios años en el municipio de Cinco Pinos de la ciudad de Chinandega. Es importante destacar que el señor Leonel ha logrado salir adelante y por esto ha buscado la manera de cómo mantener su núcleo familiar.

La razón por la cual el señor Leonel ha acudido  a Ceprodel es para ser beneficiado con un crédito para la compra de los productos de pulpería ya que los requiere a lo inmediato porque se le agotan y es su necesidad volver a llenar los estantes y así continuar brindando un servicio de alta calidad.
texts.en:
Mr. Leonel Mejia works extremely hard serving customers at the convenience store he has had for the past few years in the municipality of Cinco Pinos in the city of Chinandega. It is important to mention that Mr. Leonel has managed to do well and for this reason has looked for the best way to take care of his family. He has come to Kiva partner Ceprodel for a loan in order to purchase the products that his store has run out of, so that he will be able to fill his shelves and continue to provide high quality service.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Martyn, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of products for general store

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Pablo Emilio

texts.es:
En el municipio de Cinco Pinos de la ciudad de Chinandega, el señor Pablo V. se dedica a su actividad de ganadería llevada a cabo en su municipio de Cinco Pinos donde se esfuerza arduamente para lograr llevar el sustento a su hogar.

Es una persona muy trabajadora, dinámica y con gran espíritu de superación en su actividad que ha logrado una amplia experiencia en la crianza del ganado. La razón por la que él espera en Ceprodel es para ser beneficiado con un crédito para la compra de ganado ya que requiere de este para proceder a su crianza y así extraer la leche y comercializarla. Por este motivo espera que su crédito sea otorgado y así mejorar las condiciones de vida que hasta ahora posee.
texts.en:
In the Cinco Pino municipality in the city of Chinandega, Mr. Pablo V. raises livestock where he works diligently to maintain his household. He is hardworking, dynamic, and has a great spirit to better himself. At work he has gained much experience in raising animals. He is awaiting a loan from Ceprodel to buy animals, which he needs to raise in order to milk and sell. He is hopeful the loan will be granted and he will be able to improve his living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Pamela Carreón, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy livestock

loans.name: Elvira

texts.es: Elvira tiene 35 años, vive con su esposo y sus hijos en su propia casa. Desde hace un año se dedica a la venta de extintores para incendios, inició este negocio porque tiene unos contactos que le facilitan la adquisición de este tipo de artículos, junto a su esposo reparten a los establecimientos que requieren de este producto, además promueven y aconsejan a todo tipo de negocio la compra de extintores para estar preparados ante algún accidente donde se produzca fuego. Elvira considera que su negocio es bueno, ya que aporta para la seguridad e integridad de las personas, además conociendo mucho del tema, vende sus extintores con insumos de muy buena calidad. El deseo de Elvira es crecer en su negocio y  establecerse en un local comercial, porque al momento atiende en su casa. Es la primera vez que solicita un préstamo, y está muy contenta con esta nueva experiencia en un banco comunal, se compromete a ser responsable en sus pagos. El total de la cantidad requerida es para comprar más extintores, para el incremento de sus ventas y por ende, de sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Elvira is 35 years old. She lives with her husband and children in her own house. For a year she has sold fire extinguishers. She started this business becuse she has contacts that help her acquire extinguishers. With her husband, she distributes to establishements that need fire extinguishers. Futhermore, they promote and advise that all types of businesses buy extinguishers so that they may be prepared in case an accident occurs where a fire may be produced. Elvira considers her business to be good, because it invests in the security and integrity of people. Furthermore, knowing a great deal about the subject, she sells extinguishers of very high quality. Elvira's wish is to grow in her business and to establish herself in a local comercial market, because at the moment she sells from her house. This is the first time that Elvira is asking for a loan, and she is very happy with her initial experience with a comunal bank. She is committed to making her payments responsibly. The entire amount she is asking for will be used to buy more extinguishers, to increase her sales and in turn, increase her earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Matt Capetola, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy more merchandise.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.es: Gladys tiene 29 años, vive con su esposo y sus 3 hijos en la casa de sus suegros. Se dedica a la venta de zapatos desde hace un año. Emprendió este negocio gracias a la motivación de unas amigas, y en la actualidad le está yendo muy bien. Gladys reparte su mercadería de casa en casa, la deja al crédito, luego cobra paulatinamente hasta que terminen de pagar. Con las ganancias que obtiene puede seguir apoyando en la economía de su hogar, además vende en los tiempos libres que dispone, cuando sus hijos están estudiando, y sin descuidar su cuidado. El trabajo que realiza Gladys es de todos los días, excepto fines de semana, y su gran anhelo es tener su propio puesto de venta para tener en exhibición los diferentes modelos de zapatos que vende. Este es su primer préstamo con MFP, por su parte se compromete a ser una integrante puntual en sus pagos y que aporte en el desarrollo de su banco comunal. El dinero que ahora solicita es para comprar zapatos escolares de diversas tallas, para que en esta campaña pueda tener mayores ganancias, calcula que con este montó podrá adquirir aproximadamente 3 docenas.
texts.en:
Gladys is 29 years old, and lives with her husband and 3 children in her inlaws' house. She has sold shoes for a year now. She started this businesses thanks to the motivation of some friends, and now she is doing very well. Gladys distributes her merchandise house by house. Her clients pay on credit, receiving the merchandise and then gradually paying her back until the amount has been covered. With the earnings that she obtains, she can continue supporting her home economically. It also allows for her to work during free time when her children are studying, so she doesn't have to neglect them. Gladys works every day, except on weekends. Her greatest yearning is to have her own kiosk so that she may have the different shoe models she offers on display. This is her first loan with MFP, and she is committed to being punctual with her payments and to supporting the development of her communal bank. The money that she is asking for is to be used for school shoes of various sizes, so that in this direction she may maximize earnings. She calculates that with this amount she will be able to acquire approximately 3 dozen.

Translated from Spanish by Matt Capetola, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy more merchandise.

loans.name: Luis

texts.es: Luis tiene 38 años, vive solo en una casa arrendada, es separado y tiene una hija de 10 años. Se dedica a la venta de zapatos al por mayor y menor, viaja a distintas ciudades de su país para venderlos. La facilidad de Luis es que trabaja en una fábrica de zapatos y además de recibir un sueldo por su mano de obra, puede obtener su mercadería a un bajo costo y obtener ganancias de sus propias ventas. Los viajes que realiza son los fines de semana, viajar y vender es una actividad que lo distrae y relaja. Sus ganancias lo animan a seguir trabajando, pero tiene un gran anhelo que desea cumplir, que es tener su propia fábrica de zapatos y producir sus propios diseños. Es la primera vez que tiene un crédito con MFP, quiere forjar un trabajo solidario en su banco comunal y ser puntual en sus pagos. El dinero que está solicitando es para abastecerse de mayor cantidad de mercadería, Luis tiene planes de viajar a nuevas ciudades en busca de nuevos mercados.
texts.en:
Luis is 38 years old. He lives alone in a rented house. He is separated, and has a daughter of 10. He sells shoes for adults and children. He travels to specific cities of his country to sell them. Luis works in a shoe factory, and beyond his base salary, he may buy his merchandise at a low cost and then obtain earnings from his own sales. The trips that he makes are on the weekends. Travelling and selling are activities that keep him entertained and relax him. His earnings motivate him to continue working, but his greatest yearing that he wants to fulfill is to have his own shoe factory and to produce his own designs. This is the first time that he is asking for a loan with MFP. He wants to forge a working relationship in his comunal bank, and be punctual in his payments. The money that he is asking for will be to stock up on the highest quantity of merchandise. Luis has plans to travel to new cities in search of new markets.

Translated from Spanish by Matt Capetola, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy more merchandise.

loans.name: Nadia

texts.es: Nadia tiene 30 años y vive en casa de sus padres. Se dedica a la venta de ropa, lo hace en las calles de manera ambulante y de casa en casa, ofreciendo la variedad de prendas de vestir que tiene, preferentemente para niños. Todos los días de la semana se dedica a su negocio, para ella lo más efectivo es vender de casa en casa, aunque sea al crédito, además, el comercio es una de las actividades que más le agrada por lo que espera más adelante tener su propio local, donde no solo venda ropa, sino también productos de belleza, regalos, adornos, y otros. Es la primera vez que Nadia tiene un préstamo con MFP, y está muy animada para hacer un trabajo solidario con su banco comunal. El dinero que solicita lo usará para comprar más prendas de vestir, esta vez dirigida a la campaña escolar.
texts.en:
Nadia is 30 years old and lives in her parents' house. She sells clothing on a house by house and on a mobile basis, offering the variety of garments that she has. She generally sells children's clothing. She works every day of the week, and for her it is most effective to sell from house to house, atlhough she sells on credit. Business is one of the most pleasing things for her, because she hopes in the future to have her own business location where she doesn't only sell clothing, but also will have beauty products, gifts, decorations, etc. This is the first time that Nadia is asking for a loan with MFP, and she is very motivated to have a positive relationship with her comunal bank. She will use the money she obtains to buy more clothing garments, directed towards back to school season.

Translated from Spanish by Matt Capetola, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy more merchandise.

loans.name: Yelka

texts.es: Yelka tiene 22 años, vive junto a sus padres en la casa que ellos adquirieron con mucho esfuerzo. Se dedica a la venta de productos de primera necesidad (bodega) desde hace un año. Su deseo de obtener ingresos propios la motivaron a desarrollar su propio negocio que actualmente atiende y administra diariamente, inclusive los domingos. Mientras está de vacaciones le dedica todo el tiempo, pero cuando empiezan sus clases su madre la ayuda, quien está muy contenta porque Yelka aporta en la economía de su casa y es independiente, por lo que ha obtenido responsabilidad, la que siempre demuestra en todas las actividades que realiza. Yelka tiene planes para el futuro, uno de ellos es de surtirse de más productos que le permitan mayores ganancias. Es la primera vez tiene un préstamo con MFP, y está muy animada a seguir adelante con esta nueva experiencia de ser una integrante que aporte al desarrollo de su banco comunal. Yelka está solicitando este préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de más abarrotes; como fideos, arroz, azúcar y menestras.
texts.en:
Yelka is 22 years old. She lives together with her parents in a house that they obtained with a great deal of effort. Yelka has sold everyday essentials (bodega) for a year now. Her desire to obtain her own income motivated her to develop her own business that she handles and administrates daily, including Sundays. While she is on vacation, she dedicates all of her time to the business, but when classes start her mother helps her. Her mother is very happy because Yelka supports the houses expenses and is independent, since she has taken responsibility. Responsibility is a trait she has shown in every activity she partakes in. Yelka has plans for the future, one if which is to stock up with more products that will enable better earnings. This is the first time that she has a loan with MFP, and is motivated to continue with this new exerience of being a member that helps in the development of her comunal bank. Yelka is asking for this loan so that she can invest in buying more groceries, like noodles, rice, sugar, and broths.

Translated from Spanish by Matt Capetola, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy more merchandise.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita S. is a 29-year-old mother of three: Raniel, seven years old; Patricia S., six years old; and her youngest, Angel. They live in a peaceful community of Minante 2 in Cauayan City. She is married to Ramuel S. Jr, her partner in business and in taking care of their three children. Most of his time is devoted to maintaining their small farm lot where they generate their major source of income. 

Prior to starting a community store, Lolita was engaged in the food vending business for almost two years. Then she decided to shift into poultry production (livestock) and the sari-sari store (community store) business. She is requesting a loan of PHP10,000 to purchase more goods for her store to increase her weekly income and support her children’s education and her poultry raising business.

loans.use: To purchase goods for her store

loans.name: Emilia

texts.en:
Emilia is an entrepreneur who is married to Noli M., a lease jeep driver. She is already 28 years old and blessed with three children named Fritzie, who is eight years old, Gerald, who is five years old, and their youngest Manuel Jay M., who is four years old. The family is living in a rural area of Barangay Minante 2. 

For almost three years, Emilia has been engaged in a vegetable and fish vending businesses that she schedules twice a day. She also has ventured into a direct selling business of personal collection items that is generating a monthly income averaging PHP 4,000. She dreams of having a more progressive business, which she can accomplish by having a business stall near her house. Thus she is requesting a loan amounting to PHP 5,000 to improve her business activity and reach her business goals.

loans.use: Business Improvement

loans.name: Alvin

texts.en:
Alvin T. is 25 years of age and works as a "tricycle" (local three-wheeled motor vehicle) operator in their village. He lives in Barangay Minante 2, about 3 kilometers away from the city of Cauayan proper. Alvin is still single. According to him, he does not want to hurry marrying his girlfriend because he believes that entering into married life needs proper planning since poverty strikes in their place.

Alvin is hardworking; he plans to use his loan amounting PHP 7,000 as additional capital for his livestock and barbecue business to help his parents. And the other part of the money will be used in purchasing motorcycle spare parts and equipment to repair his "tricycle". He is confident and proud enough to handle a business since according to him he has enough experience that made him tough.

loans.use: Additional capital for livestock and barbecue business

loans.name: Leonila

texts.en:
“Do not do unto others, what you do not want others do unto you” is a simple quotation that Leonila always keeps in mind. She is a vegetable vendor at her age of 57 years old. She maintains a vegetable garden where she gets some of her products to be sold to her regular customers in their village. She is married to Narciso D.. They are blessed with 5 children namely; Laina, 38 years old, Narciso D. Jr., 36 years old, Leonardo, 34 years old, Leonalyn, 32 years old, and last is Nowella, 30 years old. Only her eldest child graduated from college and some did not due to financial difficulties and early marriage.

Since Leonila does not have a vending stall, she just roams around their village selling her different kinds of vegetable, some harvested in her garden while most are bought from the city market of Tuguegarao. Out of her vending business, Leonila is able to generate an income of PHP 750 weekly. She is thankful that through the business she is able to help her husband with their financial needs. She wants to request a loan amounting to PHP 5,000 which will be used in the improvement of her business and in venturing to other types of business where she could generate higher income.

loans.use: Business Improvement

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann E. is already 42 years old, happily married to Donato E., a "tricycle" transport operator; they are blessed with 12 children. Two of them are already married while the remaining 10 are still young. They are Ronald-18, Regielyn – 17, Bernadeth – 15, Jessa – Ann - 13, Reynald – 11, Angelica – 9, Fernalyn - 8, Reah-Mae – 6, Raymond - 4 and their youngest is Princess - 2 years old. They live in a rural area of Minante 2 Cauayan city. They are just tenants; the lot where their house is located is not their own. She is thankful to their landlord for supporting her family. They live simply and they believe that “a family that prays together stays together”.

Mary Ann plans to borrow money for her business expansion amounting to PHP 5,000. It will be used in the repair of their motorcycle which they use in their business. According to her, some of the amount will also be used as starting capital in a poultry business because she plans to raise broilers so she can help her husband to generate more income for their family.

Mary Ann worked as a flower gardener before, however, they were not able to sustain this business, but now she realizes its importance and really regrets its loss. She hopes that someday they will be able to surpass the hardships in life that they are experiencing. She will always find a way to send all her children to school for she believes that it is the only treasure that she can give to them.

loans.use: motorcycle repair and business capital

loans.name: Liza

texts.en:
Mrs. Liza E., 49 years old and married, lives at Aloran, Misamis Occidental. She has 3 children. Her husband is a "tricycle" (local three-wheeled motor vehicle) driver. In order to help her husband, she decided to open up a "sari-sari" store (mini grocery store) as additional source of income. She was able to manage the business successfully, in fact, she was able to expand it and do some minor renovation of their store.

Liza joined Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative to access their financial services as well as their insurance and other benefits given to members. Now she is applying for PHP 20,000 to purchase basic commodities for sale. In the future, she wants to see all her children finish their studies.

loans.use: to purchase basic commodities for sale

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.en:
Mrs. Lilibeth B., 41 years old and married, lives at Talairon, Oroquieta City, Mis. Occ. Her husband is a private driver of a delivery truck. She has 3 children. With her desire to help her husband, she decided to open a “sari-sari” (variety) store, in front of their house, starting up with a capital of only PHP 500. Her family only rents the land where they live at PHP 500/annum. Her primary customers were her neighbors & friends.

With the increasing demand of customers, she thought of expanding her business and joined Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative in June 2002 to gain access to their credit facilities. She is thankful to Paglaum MPC, that her purpose of accessing additional capital has materialized. Now, she is applying for PHP 14,900 to buy cases of soft drinks & beverages for sale. She dreams of owning a parcel of land someday. She also plans to renovate her store.

loans.use: to purchase soft drinks & beverages for sale

loans.name: Ermelinda

texts.en:
"Hardworking woman" best describes Mrs. Ermelinda B., a 54-year-old widow who lives in Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. Blessed with four children, Mrs. Ermelinda remains strong in order to survive. Being a single parent is not that easy for her. After the death of her husband, she found ways to earn a living. That’s why she opened a “carenderia,” or small restaurant.

The business is doing so well with hard work and God’s help. She was able to send her children to school and able to sustain the needs of her family. She got her capital from Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative when she joined the organization in June 2003. She has availed herself of several loans already. Now she applies for a PHP 15,000 loan to buy kilos of meat and spices for her carenderia and grocery items for her sari-sari (variety) store. She really wants to have a comfortable life ahead.

loans.use: To buy kilos of meat and spices for her restaurant

loans.name: Sauda

texts.en:
Sauda has owned a small food-vending store and has sold bites in the Ilala neighborhood of Dodoma for seven years. She belongs to the Kitanzini group loan. She currently earns an average monthly profit of $250. Every day she works for 16 hours at her business.

She is requesting her first loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more food items for sale and other materials for preparing bites. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business, improve her home, pay school fees for her children and save money for future use.

Sauda is 28 years old, married, and has three children: ages 8, 4 and 2.

loans.use: To buy more food items for sale and other materials for preparing bites

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina has been a clothes and bites seller in the Ilala neighborhood of Dodoma for two years. She belongs to the Kitanzini group loan. She currently earns an average monthly profit of $60. Every day she works for six hours at her business.

She is requesting her first loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more clothes (Vitenge) to sell and buy other items for preparing bites. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business, pay school fees for her children and to get more food for her family.

Amina is 30 years old, single, and has two children: ages 11 and 2.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to sell

loans.name: Sarvat

texts.en:
You can see in the picture a person who has improved his business with Kiva's help. In  December 2006 he applied for the first loan amount of US$ 1000. Sarvat repaid this loan successfully. Now he needs a loan of 2000 AZN to open a second shop, where he will sell home appliances. He has a lot of customers and he needs help and that is why he would like to take on an employee. 

"I remember how my business and my living condition were before 2006. Kiva helped me to raise not only my business, but my living conditions also. Thanks! "

loans.use: to open a second shop and take on an employee

loans.name: Agatha

texts.en:
Agatha has been a soap and charcoal seller in the Ilala neighborhood of Dodoma for 4 years. She belongs to Kibwana group loan (Group code 2022). She currently earns an average monthly profit of US$ 40. Every day she works for 8 hours at her business.

She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more soap and charcoal for her business. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business, pay school fees for her children, and to get more food for her family.

Agatha is 34 years old, married, and has four children: ages 16, 13, 11 and 7.

loans.use: To buy more soap and charcoal for her business

loans.name: Semeni

texts.en:
Semeni has been a fish and charcoal seller in the Ilala neighborhood of Dodoma for 4 years. She belongs to Kibwana group loan (Group code 2022). She currently earns an average monthly profit of US$ 200. Every day she works for 12 hours at her business.

She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more fish and charcoal for her business. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business, to pay school fees for her children and to get more food for her family.

Semeni is 32 years old, married, and has two children: ages 7 and 3.

loans.use: To buy more fish and charcoal for her business

loans.name: Halim

texts.ru: Холмуминов Халим проживает в городе Турсун-заде. Возраст 51 год, женат и имеет восьмерых детей.Имеет среднее образование . По профессии шофер. Занимается перевозкой грузов. Имеет свою грузовую автомашину , которую и использует для перевозки. Кроме этого занимается разведением крупно рогатого скота. Имеет хозяйство , где в наличие имеет двух коров и одного бычка. Кроедит планирует использовать для того, чтобы увеличить поголовье скота. Погасить кредит планирует в течение 15 месяцев.
texts.en:
Halim H. lives in the town of Tursun-zoda. He is 51 years old, married and has eight children. He has a secondary education and is a driver by profession. He transports goods. He has own pickup truck which he uses for the transportation. Besides this he also breeds cattle. He has own stock where he has two cows and one calf. He plans to use the loan to increase the head count of cattle. He plans to pay off the loan within 15 months.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase head count of cattle

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.en: Mrs. Magdalena N. is 61 years old and married with 5 children. She lives in Minaog, Dipolog City. She owns a sari-sari (grocery) store and a small carinderia (restaurant). She is requesting a loan for the purpose of acquiring additional capital for her store. She is very optimistic because her location near the airport brings in many regular customers. She has been a good member of Paglaum MPC for almost 3 years, and believes that with them, she will succeed.

loans.use: additional food and grocery items for sari-sari store

location.town: Minaog, Dipolog City, Zamboanga del Norte

loans.name: Coletha

texts.en:
Coletha E. is a 20-year-old, single woman. Coletha owns and operates a small grocery store in the Ilala neighborhood of Dodoma. She is a member of the Kiguo loan group (Group code 2013). She currently earns an average monthly profit of $125, and she works at her business for 9 hours every day.

She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more grocery items in order to expand and improve her business. More specifically, she is hoping that this loan will enable her to: generate an increase in her profits; expand her business; provide more food for her family; and save money for future use.

loans.use: To expand and improve her business by purchasing additional grocery items.

loans.name: Agatha

texts.en:
Agatha C. is a married woman with five children (ages 34, 33, 30, 27 and 19). She also cares for two other dependants. She owns and operates a small home products shop in the Ilala neighborhood of Dodoma. She is a member of the Darajani loan group (Group code 2020). Every day she works for 15 hours at her business.

She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more commodities for her business. More specifically, she is hoping that this loan will enable her to: generate an increase in her profits; expand her business; provide more food for her family; pay for her children's school fees; and save money for future use.

loans.use: To expand and improve her business by purchasing additional commodities.

loans.name: Maribeth

texts.en:
Maribeth G. is a 33-year-old, married woman who lives in Upper Dicayas, Dipolog City. She has been a reliable member of the loan cooperative for approximately 3 years. Because of her membership, she and her husband, who is a utility man, were able to save some of their income.

For a living, she operates a sari-sari store. Now, she is seeking a loan in the amount of 14,000 PHP ($300) because she wants to purchase additional grocery items. In addition, she hopes to begin selling rice and electronic goods in the near future. She and her husband are eager to improve their family's standard of living.

loans.use: To expand and improve her business by purchasing additional groceries, rice, and electronic goods

loans.name: Tashbubu

texts.ru: Ташбубу кредитуется в КИВА не первый раз. 2 прошлых займа она получала на покупку сырья для производства ручных ковров и погасила вовремя. Эти займы сыграли в ее бизнесе определенную роль и теперь ее бизнес имеет стабильность. Ташбубу планирует получить новый займ для покупки сырья (шерсти) так как наступает сезон стрижки у овец и цена на шерсть будет низкой. Новый займ планирует погасить в течении 6 месяцев.
texts.en:
Tashbubu has applied for Kiva loans before. She used her two previous loans to purchase raw materials and repaid the loans on time. The previous loans helped Tashbubu stabilize her business. This loan Tashbubu will use to purchase wool during sheep shearing season, while the wool price is low. Tashbubu plans to repay this loan within 6 months.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase wool for rug manufacturing

loans.name: Amina D.

texts.en:
Mambo (greetings) from Tanzania! This is Amina K., a 28-year-old, married woman from Mbeya. She has two children, who are 5 and 9 years old. In addition, she is responsible for supporting two other dependants, who are orphans.

Since 2004, Amina has been operating a clothing sales business. She purchases clothes at wholesale prices and then sells the clothes at retail prices for a profit. She works at the business 9-12 hours per day, 7 days per week, and she is assisted by two family members. Amina currently earns approximately $150 per month from her business operations. She is now requesting a loan in the amount of $400 in order to purchase more clothes in bulk for her business. In the future, she plans to open a new business. Amina thanks you for your support!

ABOUT SELFINA: SELFINA is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback micro-finance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are not considered to be credit-worthy by financial institutions because they lack tangible assets that can serve as collateral. As such, low income women in Tanzania typically receive poor financial support and in turn only limited access to basic needs and services. Fortunately, SELFINA has been a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through micro-leasing to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women in Tanzania. Simply put, SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women through an arrangement called a sale and leaseback transaction. More specifically, when a client needs working capital, SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extends a loan to her to facilitate the transaction, and then leases the equipment back to her. One of the primary advantages of micro-leasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To expand and improve her business by purchasing additional clothes in bulk

loans.name: Gulzar

texts.en:
Gulzar A. says hello to all Kiva lenders. She owns and operates a cafe, where she works as a cook. She already received a loan in the amount of $1,000 in February 2007, which she used to diversify her cafe's menu. As a result of the loan, which she successfully repaid, she increased the number of her clients, which made her very happy.

She is now applying for a second loan because her cafe does not adequately accommodate her customers. In particular, she is seeking a loan in the amount of $2,500 (2,000 AZN) in order to expand her cafe and to purchase tables and chairs. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To expand her cafe and to purchase tables and chairs

loans.name: Costansia

texts.en:
Costansia K. is married with four children, ages 28, 26, 24 and 19. 

Costansia owns a milling machine in the Ilala neighborhood of Dodoma.  She works at her business for 10 hours each day, and earns an average monthly profit of $155.

She requests her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more maize and sunflower oil for her business.
She hopes that through this loan, she can increase her profits, enabling her to grow her business, improve her home, provide more food for her family, pay school fees for her children, and save money for future use. 

She belongs to Darajani Group loan.

loans.use: To buy more maize and sunflower oil for her business.

loans.name: Enea

texts.en:
Enea S. is a married woman with four children (ages 25, 23, 20, and 17). She also cares one other dependant. She owns and operates a poultry business in the Ilala neighborhood of Dodoma. She is a member of the Frelimo B loan group (Group code 2028). She currently earns an average monthly profit of $200, and she works for 12 hours at her business on a daily basis.

She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more feed for her poultry. In particular, she hopes that this loan will enable her to: generate an increase in her profits; expand her business; provide more food for her family; and pay for her children's school fees.

loans.use: To expand and improve her business by purchasing additional feed for her poultry

loans.name: Anna W.

texts.en:
Mambo (greetings) from Tanzania! This is Anna M., a 42-year-old woman from Mbeya. She is single, and she has one child. Since 2007, has been operating a crop-selling business: she purchases crops from the farming villages and then sells the crops in her town. She works at her business 1-4 hours per day, 6 days per week, and she is assisted by one employee. Anna currently earns approximately $380 per month from her business.

She is requesting a loan in the amount of $400 in order to purchase a large quantity of crops from the village. In the future, she plans to open the same business at a new location. Anna thanks you for your support.

ABOUT SELFINA: SELFINA is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback micro-finance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are not considered to be credit-worthy by financial institutions because they lack tangible assets that can serve as collateral. As such, low income women in Tanzania typically receive poor financial support and in turn only limited access to basic needs and services.

Fortunately, SELFINA has been a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through micro-leasing to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women in Tanzania. Simply put, SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women through an arrangement called a sale and leaseback transaction. More specifically, when a client needs working capital, SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extends a loan to her to facilitate the transaction, and then leases the equipment back to her. One of the primary advantages of micro-leasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To expand and improve her business by purchasing additional crops fpr resale purposes

loans.name: Abdunabi

texts.ru: Холмуминов Абдунаби житель города Турсун-Заде . Живет в одном из отдаленном кишлаке. Возраст 45 лет , женат и имеет пятерых детей. Занимается  только животноводством и сельским хозяйством. Откармливает бычков для продажи. В данный момент хочет получить кредит для того, чтобы увеличить поголовье скота. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 15 месяцев.
texts.en:
Abdunabi Holmimunov lives in the town of Tursun-zoda. He lives in one of the remote villages. He is 45 years old, married and has five children. He is in the animal husbandry and agriculture. He raises calves for resale. At this time he wants to get a loan to increase his cattle headcount. He can pay off the loan within 15 months.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase headcount of cattle

loans.name: Bahodur

texts.ru: Холмуминов Баходур житель города Турсун-заде. Женат и имеет троих детей. Возраст 36 лет. Занимается животноводством уже 10 лет. Планирует получить кредит сроком на 15 месмяцев. Использовать кредит планирует для того, чтобы увеличить поголовье скота. Это поможет ему улучшить положение бизнеса и получить дополнительный доход.
texts.en:
Bahodur H. lives in the town of Tursun-zoda. He is married and has three children. He is 36 years old. He does animal husbandry for already ten years. He plans to use the loan to increase the headcount of cattle. This will help him improve his business and get additional income.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase headcount of cattle

loans.name: Asha H.

texts.en:
Mambo (greetings) from Tanzania! This is Asha N., a 31-year-old woman from Mbeya. She is married, and she has a 7-year-old child. In addition, she is responsible for supporting two other dependants who are orphans.

Since 2003, Asha has been operating a crop-selling business. Specifically, she purchases crops from the nearby farming village and then sells the crops in town for a profit. She works at the business 9-12 hours per day, 7 days per week. Asha currently earns approximately $80 per month from her business. Now, she is requesting a loan in the amount of $400 in order to purchase more crops in bulk. In the future, she plans to sell a wider variety of crops to further expand her business. Asha thanks you for your support!

ABOUT SELFINA: SELFINA is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback micro-finance facility.
