Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are not considered to be credit-worthy by financial institutions because they lack tangible assets that can serve as collateral. As such, low income women in Tanzania typically receive poor financial support and in turn only limited access to basic needs and services. Fortunately, SELFINA has been a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through micro-leasing to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women in Tanzania. Simply put, SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women through an arrangement called a sale and leaseback transaction. More specifically, when a client needs working capital, SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extends a loan to her to facilitate the transaction, and then leases the equipment back to her. One of the primary advantages of micro-leasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To expand and improve her business by purchasing additional crops in bulk

loans.name: Atuganile A.

texts.en:
Mambo (greetings) from Tanzania! This is Atuganile M., a 28-year-old woman from Mbeya. She is married, and she has three children who are between the ages of 12 and 16. In addition, she is responsible for supporting two dependants who are orphans.

Since 2005, Atuganile has been operating a cosmetics shop. Specifically, she purchases cosmetics at wholesale prices and then sells the cosmetics at retail prices for a profit. She works at the business 9-12 hours per day, 7 days per week, and she is assisted by one employee. Atuganile currently earns approximately $200 per month. She is requesting a loan in the amount of $625 in order to purchase a large quantity of cosmetics for her business. In the future, she plans to start a new business. Atuganile thanks you for your support!

ABOUT SELFINA: SELFINA is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback micro-finance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are not considered to be credit-worthy by financial institutions because they lack tangible assets that can serve as collateral. As such, low income women in Tanzania typically receive poor financial support and in turn only limited access to basic needs and services. Simply put, SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women through an arrangement called a sale and leaseback transaction. More specifically, when a client needs working capital, SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extends a loan to her to facilitate the transaction, and then leases the equipment back to her. One of the primary advantages of micro-leasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To expand and improve her business by purchasing additional cosmetics

loans.name: Diana J.

texts.en:
Mambo (greetings) from Tanzania! This is Diana S., a 20-year-old woman from Mbeya. She is married, and she has a 1-year-old child.

Since 2005, Diana has been operating a clothing-sales business. In particular, she purchases clothes at wholesale prices and then sells the clothes at retail prices for a profit. She works at the business 9-12 hours per day, 6 days per week. By doing so, Diana earns approximately $120 per month from her business. She is now requesting a loan in the amount of $400 in order to purchase additional clothes in bulk. In the future, she plans to open the same business at a new location. Diana thanks you for your support!

ABOUT SELFINA: SELFINA is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback micro-finance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are not considered to be credit-worthy by financial institutions because they lack tangible assets that can serve as collateral. As such, low income women in Tanzania typically receive poor financial support and in turn only limited access to basic needs and services. Fortunately, SELFINA has been a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through micro-leasing to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women in Tanzania. Simply put, SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women through an arrangement called a sale and leaseback transaction. More specifically, when a client needs working capital, SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extends a loan to her to facilitate the transaction, and then leases the equipment back to her. One of the primary advantages of micro-leasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To expand and improve her business by purchasing additional clothing in bulk

loans.name: Philomena

texts.en:
Philomena is an oil and snacks vendor in the Ilala neighborhood of Dodoma. She belongs to the Frelimo B group loan (Group code 2028).  She currently earns an average monthly profit of $125. Every day she works for 12 hours at her business.

She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more food, oil, and other items for snack preparation. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business, improve her home, get more food for her family, and pay school fees for her children.  

Philomena is 43 years old, married, and has five children: ages 23, 20, 17, 14, and 5. She also cares for two additional dependents.

loans.use: To buy more oil and other ingredients

loans.name: Dora B.

texts.en:
Mambo (Greetings!) from Tanzania! This is 38-year-old Dorah K. from Mbeya. She is single with 4 children between the ages of 4 and 15. Dorah has been running a soap-making business since 2007. In her business, she purchases raw materials like red palm oil and caustic and makes soap, which she then supplies to shops and homes.

She works at the business 12 hours each day, 4 days per week and is assisted by one employee and her brother. Dorah currently earns about 300 USD a month from her business. She is requesting a loan of 400 USD to expand her business by purchasing more red palm oil, white palm oil, and caustic soda so she can produce more soap in bulk for resale. In the future, she plans to increase the range of her business. Dorah thanks you for your support!

ABOUT SELFINA:

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase soap ingredients

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina owns a small charcoal store and is a snack vendor in the Ilala neighborhood of Dodoma. She belongs to the Frelimo B group loan (Group code 2028).  She currently earns an average monthly profit of $25. Every day she works for 6 hours at her business.

She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more charcoal, wheat flour and cooking oil for snack preparation. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business, get more food for her family, and pay school fees for her children.  

Amina is 38 years old, married, and has four children: ages 18, 16, 13, and 9.

loans.use: To buy more snack ingredients

loans.name: Aziz

texts.en: Aziz lives in the town of Khachmaz. He is 35 years old and married. He has been in the dairy business for 4 years. Now he needs a loan of 2000 AZN to buy two cows to improve his dairy business.

loans.use: To buy two cows

loans.name: Anna N.

texts.en:
Mambo (Greetings!) from Tanzania! This is 25-year-old Anna R. from Tukuyu. She is married with one child, three years old. Anna has run a clothes selling business since 2002. Her business is to purchase clothes wholesale and sell them retail.

She works at the business for 9-12 hours each day, 6 days per week. Anna currently earns about 100 USD a month from her business. She is requesting a loan of 400 USD to purchase more clothes in bulk for her business. In the future, she plans to increase the variety of products in her business. Anna thanks you for your support!

ABOUT SELFINA:

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase clothes for resale

loans.name: Dominika

texts.en:
Dominika M. is 35 years old and married, with three children ages 15, 6 and 3. She sells bites (snacks) in the Ilala neighborhood of Dodoma. She has been selling bites for seven years. She works 12 hours per day at her business and earns an average monthly profit of $310.

Dominika is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania to buy ingredients so that she can expand her business by selling more bites. She hopes that this loan will help her increase her profits, thereby enabling her to grow her business, improve her home, provide more food for her family, pay school fees for her children, and save money for the future.

loans.use: To buy more items so she can prepare more bites for sale and expand her business.

loans.name: Eddah I.

texts.en:
Mambo (greetings) from Tanzania! This is 50-year-old Eddah M. from Tukuyu. She is married with four children between the ages of 11 and 18. Eddah has been running a soft-drinks and poultry-keeping business since 2000. She purchases drinks wholesale then sells them retail, and she keeps chickens. She works at the business 12 hours per day, 6 days per week and is assisted by 4 employees. Eddah currently earns about $350 USD a month from her business. She is requesting a loan of $700 USD in order to purchase soft drinks and poultry feed in bulk. In the future, she plans to increase the number and variety of products in her business. Eddah thanks you for your support!

ABOUT SELFINA:
SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of microcredit in Tanzania through microleasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed noncreditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro-leasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase soft drinks and poultry feed in bulk

loans.name: Lucita

texts.en: Lucita G. is a 55-year-old married mother of five.  Three of her children have finished school, and her youngest daughter attends college.  Her husband is a laborer.  Lucita plans to use the money from this loan to buy inventory for her "sari sari" shop.  "Sari sari" is Tagalog for "various kinds," and these shops sell an array of basic foodstuffs, beverages, and everyday commodities.  The stores are usually operated out of the owner's home, are neighborhood watering holes, and retail in small units—selling single cigarettes, for example.  Sari sari shops fill an important economic and social niche in Filipino life, especially in rural areas.  Lucita learned the sari sari trade from her mother, and had a store before that was destroyed by a typhoon. She hopes to fully rebuild and expand her operation, and use her income to support her children and grandchildren's education.

loans.use: To buy inventory for a small general store

loans.name: Leluna

texts.en:
Leluna has owned a small charcoal store in the Ilala neighborhood of Dodoma for five years. She is part of the Kondoa group loan.  She currently earns an average monthly profit of $175. Every day she works at her business for 12 hours.

She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more charcoal to sell in order to improve her business. She hopes that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.  

Leluna is 25 years old, married, and has one 7-year-old child.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal to sell

loans.name: Daines

texts.en:
Daines has owned a small food-vendor store and a small garden, and has been a clothes seller in the Ilala neighborhood of Dodoma for 23 years. She belongs to the Kondoa group loan. She currently earns an average monthly profit of $50. Every day she works for eight hours at her business.

She is requesting her first loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more clothes (vitenge) and food items in order to expand her business. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business and save money for future use.

Daines is 48 years old and married, with one child who is 32.

loans.use: To buy more clothes (vitenge) and food items in order to expand her business

loans.name: Khalidshah

texts.en: Khalidshah was born in1955. This man has 10 years of experience in the cattle-breeding business. Now he needs a loan of 2000 AZN to buy four calves for improving his business. This man lives in Khachmaz town.

loans.use: To buy four calves

loans.name: Rukia

texts.en:
Rukia is a fruit seller in the Ilala neighborhood of Dodoma. She belongs to the Donbosco group loan. She currently earns an average monthly profit of $170. Every day she works for nine hours at her business.

She is requesting her first loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more fruits for resale. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business, improve her home, get more food for her family and pay school fees for her children.

Rukia is 34 years old, married and has three children: ages 13, 9 and 7.

loans.use: To buy more fruits for resale

loans.name: Eunis

texts.en:
Eunis sells clothes and chickens in the Ilala neighborhood of Dodoma. She belongs to the Donbosco group loan.  She currently earns an average monthly profit of $95. Every day she works at her business for 12 hours.

She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more clothes ("vitenge," Tanzanian traditional clothing) and chickens to expand her business. She hopes that through this loan her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business, so she can get more food for her family and save money for future use.  

Eunis is 32 years old, married, and has two children, ages 10 and 5.

loans.use: To buy more clothes and chickens to expand her business

loans.name: Sophia

texts.en:
Sophia owns a small charcoal store and call center in the Ilala neighborhood of Dodoma. She belongs to Mjimwema "A" group loan.  She currently earns an average monthly profit of $125. Every day she works at her business for 12 hours.

She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more charcoal for her business. She hopes that through this loan, her profits will increase and she will be able to grow her business, so she can pay school fees for her child and get more food for her family.  

Sophia is 44 years old, married, and has five children, ages 29, 26, 24, 17 and 13.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal for her business

loans.name: Kristina

texts.en:
Kristina has owned a small food store in the Ilala neighborhood of Dodoma. She belongs to Wazo "A" group loan (group code 2011).  She currently earns an average monthly profit of $25. Every day she works at her business for 6 hours.

She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more food items for her business. She hopes that through this loan, her profits will increase and she will be able to grow her business, so she can pay school fees for her child and get more food for her family.  

Kristina is 40 years old, married, and has one 19-year-old child.

loans.use: To buy more food items for her business

loans.name: Ana Corita

texts.en:
Ana Corita N. is 48-year-old widowed mother of four. To earn a living, she runs a sari sari shop and raises pigs.

"Sari sari" is Tagalog for "various kinds." Sari sari shops sell an array of basic foodstuffs, beverages, and everyday commodities. The stores are usually operated out of the owner's home, are neighborhood watering holes, and sell items in small units -- single cigarettes, for example. Sari sari shops fill an important economic and social niche in Filipino life, especially in rural areas.

Ana Corita only recently opened her sari sari store, after learning the tricks of the trade from her daughter-in-law. She intends to use the money from this loan to buy inventory for her shop, and to buy two piglets to raise. She hopes to earn enough to be able to help support her children and grandchildren.

loans.use: To buy inventory for a small general store and to purchase two piglets.

loans.name: Zaria

texts.en:
Zaria S. is 20 years old, married, and has one child 5 years old. Zaria has owned a small grocery store in the Ilala neighborhood of Dodoma for 5 years. Every day she works for 10 hours at her business. She currently earns an average monthly profit of $155. She belongs to Mjimwema "A" group loan (Group code 2029). 

Zaria is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more grocery items in order to increase her current stock. She is hoping that through this loan her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business, to get more food for her family, and save money for future use.

loans.use: To buy more grocery items in order to increase her current stock.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina U. is a 34-year-old married mother of three. One of her children is in primary school and two attend high school. Her husband is a fisherman. To earn money, Gina runs a sari sari store.

"Sari sari" is Tagalog for "various kinds." Sari sari shops sell an array of basic foodstuffs, beverages, and everyday commodities. The stores are usually operated out of the owner's home, are neighborhood watering holes, and sell items in small units -- single cigarettes, for example. Sari sari shops fill an important economic and social niche in Filipino life, especially in rural areas.

Gina began her sari sari store after hearing her neighbors complain they had to travel too far to buy basic items. Now that she's established, she'd like to begin selling soft drinks and gasoline from her store as well. She plans to use the money from this loan to buy more inventory for her shop, and hopes to have enough income to help her husband buy a new fishing boat.

loans.use: To buy inventory and expand the range of offerings for a small general store.

loans.name: Mary Aoko

texts.en:
Mary Aoko O. is a 32 year old mother of two children, ages 6 and 4.5. Her husband works as an auto mechanic while Mary sells small fish called Omena. She started her business a long time ago and will use the loan to purchase more fish. One challenge she has faced lately is extending credit to customers who do not pay her back.

Mary recently joined the K-MET volunteer Community Health Worker (CHW) group in Kisumu, Kenya. As a community health worker, she will be trained by K-MET and will then begin visiting members of her community who are sick with a variety of illnesses. Her volunteer work will include distributing Nutriflour (vitamin-enriched flour) to malnourished patients, providing reproductive health education, referring patients to local clinics and hospitals, and providing basic health care.

loans.use: Purchase fish for resale

loans.name: Jonah

texts.en:
Jonah O. is a 24-year-old father of two children aged 3 and 1 and a half. He repairs bicycles and when he can afford it sells spare parts. He is looking for a loan because he currently cannot afford the spare parts needed to repair bikes. He wishes that borrowers could come see where he lives.

Jonah recently joined the K-MET volunteer Community Health Worker (CHW) group in Kisumu, Kenya. As a CHW he will be trained by K-MET and will begin visiting members of his community who are sick with a variety of illnesses. His work will include distributing Nutriflour (a vitamin-enriched flour produced by K-MET) to malnourished patients, providing reproductive health education, referring patients to local clinics and hospitals, and providing basic health care.

loans.use: spare parts for bikes

loans.name: Jacob Odungo

texts.en:
Jacob Odungo O. is a 53-year-old father of three and husband of two. All his children are in school. He makes charcoal ovens and needs the loan to buy the metal sheets with which he makes the ovens.

He recently joined the K-MET volunteer Community Health Worker (CHW) group in Kisumu, Kenya. As a CHW he will be trained by K-MET and will begin visiting members of his community who are sick with a variety of illnesses. His work will include distributing Nutriflour (a vitamin-enriched flour produced by K-MET) to malnourished patients, providing reproductive health education, referring patients to local clinics and hospitals, and providing basic health care.

loans.use: buying metal sheets for making ovens

loans.name: Nicholas Otieno

texts.en:
Nicholas Otieno A. is a 27-year-old father of three children aged 6, 4 and 1. He is in the "boda-boda" business. In Kisumu, a boda-boda is a bike with a seat on the back where passengers can sit. It is simultaneously a very affordable way to get a ride and a tough way to make a living. If Nicholas is able to make a profit, he hopes to expand and purchase a poultry coup to provide extra food and security for his family and maybe sell eggs. He is concerned that he will be driven out of business by those in the "piki-piki" (motorbike) business.

Nicholas recently joined the K-MET volunteer Community Health Worker (CHW) group in Kisumu, Kenya. As a CHW he will be trained by K-MET and will begin visiting members of his community who are sick with a variety of illnesses. His work will include distributing Nutriflour (a vitamin-enriched flour produced by K-MET) to malnourished patients, providing reproductive health education, referring patients to local clinics and hospitals, and providing basic health care.

loans.use: Spare parts for bikes

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is a 28-year-old mother of three children aged 5, 3 and 2. She is raising them alone in Nyamasaria slum where she lives. She runs a small kiosk where she sells ice-cream, soda and other small items. She will use this loan to maintain her kiosk and buy more stock.

Nancy recently joined the K-MET volunteer Community Health Worker (CHW) group in Kisumu, Kenya. As a CHW, she will be trained by K-MET and will begin visiting members of her community who are sick with a variety of illnesses. Her work will include distributing Nutriflour (a vitamin enriched flour produced by K-MET) to malnourished patients, providing reproductive health education, referring patients to local clinics and hospitals, and providing basic health care.

loans.use: To purchase food stock

loans.name: Lauren Adhiambo

texts.en:
Lauren Adhiambo O. is a 22-year-old mother of two children aged 10 and 7, both of whom are in school. She lives with her husband and sells fruit in Obunga at a small kiosk. She will use this loan to purchase more stock. She wanted borrowers to know that she is also an orphan, and will use the loan and profits from her business to pay for her children’s school fees.

Lauren recently joined the K-MET volunteer Community Health Worker (CHW) group in Kisumu, Kenya. As a CHW she will be trained by K-MET and will begin visiting members of her community who are sick with a variety of illness. Her work will include distributing Nutriflour (a vitamin enriched flour produced by K-MET) to malnourished patients, providing reproductive health education, referring patients to local clinics and hospitals, and providing basic health care.

loans.use: To purchase more fruit

loans.name: Rosemary Janet Awuor

texts.en:
Rosemary Janet Awuor is a 32-year-old mother of three children aged 16, 7 and 3. The older two are in school and she is raising them by herself. She runs a small fish shop where she sells Omena fish. She purchases her stock from fisherman at Lake Victoria. She says that transporting her goods can be a challenge.

Rosemary recently joined the K-MET volunteer Community Health Worker (CHW) group in Kisumu, Kenya. As a CHW she will be trained by K-MET and will begin visiting members of her community who are sick with a variety of illness. Her work will include distributing Nutriflour (a vitamin enriched flour produced by K-MET) to malnourished patients, providing reproductive health education, referring patients to local clinics and hospitals, and providing basic health care.

loans.use: More Fish Stock/Transport Fees

loans.name: Suzanne Anyango

texts.en:
Suzanne Anyango O. is a 25-year-old mother of two children aged 6 and 2. Her older child is in school and she uses the profits from her small kiosk, where she sells soda and other small items, to pay for their fees. Her husband also provides additional income for the family.

Suzanne recently joined the K-MET volunteer Community Health Worker (CHW) group in Kisumu, Kenya. As a CHW she will be trained by K-MET and will begin visiting members of her community who are sick with a variety of illness. Her work will include distributing Nutriflour (a vitamin enriched flour produced by K-MET) to malnourished patients, providing reproductive health education, referring patients to local clinics and hospitals, and providing basic health care.

loans.use: To purchase food stock

loans.name: Elizabeth Nelima

texts.en:
Elizabeth Nelima S. is a 29-year-old mother of two children, aged 12 and 4. Her husband died two years ago and she is raising her two kids alone. She is HIV positive and says that it is a challenge raising two kids alone in addition to running her business. She sells items like maize, beans, and rice in Kisumu from a small stall and uses the profits to pay for her boy’s schooling. She plans on sending her daughter when she is old enough. This is her first loan and in part, it will be used to offset transportation costs associated with bringing her food to the market.

Elizabeth recently joined the K-MET volunteer Community Health Worker (CHW) group in Kisumu, Kenya. As a CHW she will be trained by K-MET and will begin visiting members of her community who are sick with a variety of illness. Her work will include distributing Nutriflour (a vitamin enriched flour produced by K-MET) to malnourished patients, providing reproductive health education, referring patients to local clinics and hospitals, and providing basic health care.

loans.use: To purchase food stock

loans.name: Elizabeth Atieno

texts.en:
Elizabeth Atieno A. is a 48-year-old mother of six children; some are in college but the others are still waiting to go. She sells second-hand clothes in Manyatta slum, where she also lives. Her main challenge, she says, is a lack of money, and she will use this loan to pay for more clothes. She will use the profits to pay for school fees for her children.

Elizabeth recently joined the K-MET volunteer Community Health Worker (CHW) group in Kisumu, Kenya. As a CHW she will be trained by K-MET and will begin visiting members of her community who are sick with a variety of illness. Her work will include distributing Nutriflour (a vitamin enriched flour produced by K-MET) to malnourished patients, providing reproductive health education, referring patients to local clinics and hospitals, and providing basic health care.

loans.use: To purchase more clothing stock

loans.name: Winnie

texts.en:
Winnie A. is a 19-year-old mother of two children aged 6 and 3, and is raising them alone. The older child is already in school. She sells small fish called Omena and has been running her business for 6 years. This is her first loan. She hopes to receive the loan as it will allow her to buy fish from a cheaper seller, albeit one located farther from the market. She says the business helps her and her children, and the profits will be used to pay for their school fees.

Winnie recently joined the K-MET volunteer Community Health Worker (CHW) group in Kisumu, Kenya. As a CHW she will be trained by K-MET and will begin visiting members of her community who are sick with a variety of illness. Her work will include distributing Nutriflour (a vitamin enriched flour produced by K-MET) to malnourished patients, providing reproductive health education, referring patients to local clinics and hospitals, and providing basic health care.

loans.use: To purchase more fish

loans.name: Pamela Akoth

texts.en:
Pamela Akoth O. is a 24-year-old mother of two children and is raising her kids alone. She is pictured here with her daughter Renise Catherine Awuir. She has a small kiosk where she sells tomatoes, charcoal and other small items. This is her first loan, and she will use it to buy stock for her kiosk.

Pamela recently joined the K-MET volunteer Community Health Worker (CHW) group in Kisumu, Kenya. As a CHW, she will be trained by K-MET and will begin visiting members of her community who are sick various illnesses. Her work will include distributing Nutriflour (a vitamin-enriched flour produced by K-MET) to malnourished patients, providing reproductive health education, referring patients to local clinics and hospitals, and providing basic health care.

loans.use: Food Stock

loans.name: Mercy Awuor

texts.en:
Mercy Awuor O. is a 27-year-old mother of one girl, aged five. She sells cereal to schools and is looking for a loan to expand her business. She regularly sells out of supply but cannot yet afford new stock. She will use this loan to purchase more cereal so that she can sell to more schools. Her husband also works as a businessman. When asked about what else she would like to share with potential lenders, she wanted to let everyone know she has been saved (by Jesus), likes socializing and likes people who talk progressively and don’t gossip.

Mercy recently joined the K-MET volunteer Community Health Worker (CHW) group in Kisumu, Kenya. As a CHW she will be trained by K-MET and will begin visiting members of her community who are sick with a variety of illness. Her work will include distributing Nutriflour (a vitamin enriched flour produced by K-MET) to malnourished patients, providing reproductive health education, referring patients to local clinics and hospitals, and providing basic health care.

loans.use: To purchase more stock

loans.name: Kitimbwa Group (C)

texts.en:
Suzan N. runs a small bookshop in a rural area of Uganda called Kayunga. Kayunga is about 2 hours north-east of Kampala. Suzan sells books, record books, different kinds of paper, pens, chalk, and other such things at her shop.

Suzan is requesting a loan of 400,000 Uganda Shillings (USH) to restock her store. This will be her second loan and she is already seeing a change in her life because of the loans she is taking. Previously, she was only making about 20,000 USH per week, but now she makes more like 30,000 USH per week. She explains that this is because of two factors; first, she is able to purchase the items in her shop for less money because she can buy them in bulk, and second, because she is able to have more items so more customers come to her shop.

Suzan has four children and no husband. The fathers of the children help her with paying school fees for their children, but they offer no support for the children’s daily lives. Now, with the profit that she is making in her business, she is able to cover her share of the school fees as well as make her children comfortable when they are at home.

loans.use: To purchase more paper, books, chalk, pens, and other book store items

loans.name: Galina

texts.en:
Galina has run a business for more than two years, and her field of activity is retail trade in merchandise stands. The company was registered on 14th December 2006 in order to start the business; until that time, she worked as a seller for another company.

Galina has requested to borrow a loan for a large assortment of goods, and this is the second loan borrowed from Microinvest. She wants to install two booths and to purchase goods (dishes). Galina has no intention to enlarge the business, just to maintain the current business.

loans.use: To maintain the business

loans.name: Kitimbwa Group (B)

texts.en:
Herbert is a motorcycle mechanic. This is a very lucrative business because there are so many people in Uganda with motorcycles. Particularly in rural areas, boda bodas (motorcycles) are one of the main forms of public transportation. Riding on the back of a boda boda is sometimes the only option for getting from one point to another.

Herbert usually buys used boda bodas at between 300,000 and 600,000 Uganda Shillings (USH). He then spends two or three days working on fixing them and then resells them for between 750,000 and 800,000 USH. He has two people who help him in making the repairs to the boda bodas.

Herbert is requesting a loan of 300,000 USH. This will allow him to buy a few pistons, some rings, and some indicators for the bikes he is working on.

Herbert and his wife have seven children ranging from two months to fifteen years of age. Four of his children are in school now, and the rest soon will be. Herbert’s wife works primarily on raising the children and tending to the garden that their family uses for food. Thus, it is Herbert’s task to bring in all the money needed to run the family.

loans.use: To buy a few pistons, some rings, and some indicators for his motorcyles

loans.name: Stinga

texts.en: Mr. I. Stinga deals in several types of activities, namely, raising of pigs, cultivatI. of cereals and repair of motor home, for which he has all the necessary equipment. I. owns 5.6 hectares of land in Zîrneşti, Cahul district. Near his house, there are two greenhouses built with a total area of approximately 6 hectares where he grows tomatoes and cucumbers. I. sells pork and vegetables at the wholesale market in the district. Business is profitable because of permanently increasing demand for agricultural products, and there are chances of further business development. The purpose of the loan is to purchase food for pigs and film for greenhouse.

loans.use: to purchase food for pigs and film for greenhouse

loans.name: Cravcenco

texts.en: A. owns arable land in the Prut valley. The soil is perfectly suited for growing potatoes. A. raises pigs also. He holds other land where he grows grain. He sells potatoes and pork at the wholesale market in the Cahul town. This is the first loan borrowed by Antolie from Microinvest. The purpose of the loan is to buy potato seeds and film for greenhouse. His business is profitable because of permanently increasing demand for agricultural products.

loans.use: to buy potato seeds and film for greenhouse

loans.name: Lupu

texts.en: A. and Lidia have 2.5 hectares of arable land that they use for agricultural production. The cereals that they harvest are used for rearing pigs. They currently have 2 pigs, and expect to buy 4 piglets for fattening. In the future, A. and Lidia intend to increase the number of animals they raise, which is the purpose of the loan. They sell the meat in the meat market in the town of Causeni. Besides working at home, A. works in construction.

loans.use: To increase the number of animals they raise

loans.name: Jessenia Esther

texts.es:
La Sra. Jessenia D. se dedica al comercio, tiene una pequeña tienda en la cual vende varios productos de uso personal, tiene 2 años de tener su negocio el cual le ha dado mucho para poder sostener a su familia, ella tiene 2 hijos que son lo mas importante para ella en esta vida, ella tiene todas las ganas de superarse y salir adelante con sus hijos, pero para eso necesita hacer crecer su negocio y esto lo podra lograr con mucho esfuerzo.
ella necesita el credito para comprar mas mercaderia y poco a poco hacer crecer su negocio. por tal razon esta solicitando el dinero.
su meta es llegar a tener un mercadito bien surtido y grande.
texts.en:
Jessenia D. is a businesswoman and owns a small store in which she sells a variety of personal products. She has owned her business for two years and has been able to support her family with her earnings. She has two sons who are the most important part of her life. She has the desire to overcome her obstacles and help her sons. In order to do so, she must expand her business, which will require a lot of effort.

Jessenia is requesting a loan to purchase more merchandise so she can begin expanding her business. Her goal is to have a well-stocked store with a variety of products.

Translated from Spanish by Priya Bapat, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of deodorants, gel, creams,  nailpolish, nailpolish remover, sodas, churros, sweets, hairdye, nail files

loans.name: Bordian

texts.en:
Bordian G. owns 1.38 hectares of arable land. This year, he will cultivate sunflowers and corn on 7 hectares on arable land. He has a car that he uses to transport goods to order, but most of all he do this for his best customers.He processes sunflowers to produce oil for sale and uses maize for breeding. He also raises 2 cows and 3 pigs near his house.

The purpose of the loan is to purchase seeds and fertilizer, and to buy gas to transport the goods.

loans.use: purchase of seeds, fertilizers and gasoline

loans.name: Jorge Alberto

texts.es:
El Sr. Jorge C. es tecnico en laboratorio y hace 1 1/2 año que inicio con su laboratorio clinico en donde realiza todo tipo de examenes de sangre, eses y orina.
El Sr, Jorge ha sabido ganar su clientela por la atencion que les brinda y tambien porque el laboratorio esta ubicado en un lugar cerca de varias clinicas medicas, entonces muchos de los medicos mandan a su laboratorio los clientes para que se hagan los examenes que necesitan. ademas que es el unico laboratorio clinico en esta parte de la comunidad.
El es soltero y de el depende su madre y dos sobirnas a las cuales el les brinda todo, alimentacion, salud, estudios, ropa etc.
el esta muy feliz ya que una de sus sobrinas esta en el colegio y es muy buena estudiante. el dice que ellas son los ojos de su vida.
texts.en:
Jorge C. is a laboratory technician. A year and a half ago, he started his own laboratory clinic where he provides every type of exam for blood, feces and urine. Jorge won his clients through the attention he provides them and the laboratory's location. His business is located near many medical clinics and many doctors send their patients to his lab to take necessary exams. His lab is the only one in that part of the community.

Jorge is single and takes care of his mother and two nieces. He provides them with everything: food, healthcare, schooling, clothing, etc.

He is very happy now that one his nieces is in high school and is a good student. He says that his nieces are the ojos de su vida or “apples of his eye.”

Translated from Spanish by Priya Bapat, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy reagents for exams (glucose, pregnancy, etc.)

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Carmen Del Socorro

texts.es: La señora Carmen del Socorro C. tiene la edad de 36 años habita en el reparto Juan Ramón Padilla junto a su esposo él cual trabaja como electricista para apoyarle con los gastos del hogar; ellos tienen a su cargo dos hijos una adolescente de 13 años y niño de diez los cuales estudian, los planes hacia su familia es mejorar las condiciones de infraestructura del hogar para que sus hijos vivan cómodamente y por ende mejorar económicamente y la vez la  venta de la producción. Ella desde hace quince años se dedica a la agricultura durante este tiempo la mayor dificultad que se le ha presentado es la falta de financiamiento para la compra de fertilizantes ya que estos carecen de mantenimiento lo cual no se desarrolla lo suficiente  para la venta de primera; inicio la activad de agricultora ya que por parte de su esposo hubo motivación par la misma y delegados de la zona del programa reforma agraria  quienes les brindaron un lote de una manzana para que la trabajará. Ella con el financiamiento va a comprar fertilizantes para inducirlo al cultivo y obtener una buena cosecha y vender a buen precio al mercado
texts.en:
Carmen del Socorro C. is 36 years old. She lives in the Juan Ramón Padilla division with her husband, who works as an electrician to support the family. Together, they care for their two children, a 13-year-old girl and 10-year-old boy, who are both in school. Her family plans to improve the infrastructure of their home so they can live comfortably and thereby improve their econonomic situation and increase their sales.

Since the age of 15, Carmen has worked in agriculture. During this time, the most difficult challenge she has faced is not having enough money to buy fertilizers, the lack of which prevents her from selling top-quality products. She began farming because of her husband and because of the agricultural reforms which provided her with her own farm lot. With this loan, she will purchase fertilizers so she can have a good harvest and obtain good prices at the market.

Translated from Spanish by Priya Bapat, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertilizers for farming

loans.name: Grime Pastora

texts.es:
la Sra. Grime F. se dedica a la venta de productos de consumo popular, ella tiene una pulperia que esta ubicada en su casa de habitacion y opera bajo el nombre de Pulperia GEMELAS, esto le permite no descuidar su hogar y asi trabaja todo el dia, ya que su pulperia la abre desde las 6:00am y la cierra a las 10:00pm, ella tiene 12 años de tener su negocio, el cual esta muy agracedida con todas las personas que le ayudaron a salir adelante durante todos estos duros y largos años. se nota que ella a sabido administrar muy bien su negocio, sus clientes la prefieren ya que ella es muy especial con ellos, su trato y lo que mas les gusta a los clientes es el precio que vende los productos que es muy apto para la economia de su comunidad, ahi la mayoria de la gente es de escasos recursos.
ella es madre de dos hijas y su compañero de hogar es propietario de una fabrica de bloques para construccion que esta ubicada en la aldea de Ojo de Agua.
juntos los dos salen adelante y logran cubrir con todos los gastos de su hogar, pero ahorita necesita surtir mas su negocio, hacerlo mas grande para poder dar una mejor atencion a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Grime F. is a businesswoman and sells popular consumer products. She runs a pulpería (small store) from her home called Pulpería GEMELAS. Because of the store’s location, she is able to work and also care for her home. Grime works all day – her store opens at 6 am and closes at 10 pm. She has owned her business for 12 years. She is thankful to all the people who have helped her be successful during these hard and long years.

Grime knows how to administer her business very well. Her clients prefer her store now that she has developed a relationship with them and treats them well. What her clients most like about her store is that the prices of her products are affordable for the members of her community, most of whom have few economic resources.

She has two children and her partner owns a cinder block factory, located in the town of Ojo de Agua. Together, they are creating a better life and are able to cover all of the household costs. However, they now need to increase their stock and expand their business, so they can provide a better service for their customers.

Translated from Spanish by Priya Bapat, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase lard, soap, sugar, toilet paper, sodas, canned juices, chicken, eggs, beans, butter, corn flour, cheeses, oil, churros, pastas, pills, salsas, soups, etc

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Francisco Javier

texts.es: El señor Francisco Javier Z. C. tiene la edad de 45 años habita en la comunidad el Edén ubicado en el municipio de Ticuantepe, junto a su esposa la cual le ayuda con las cosas del hogar y en los cultivos, ellos tienen a su cargo tres hijos dos jóvenes que estudian su secundaria y un  pequeñito de cuatros años, los planes hacia su familia es mejorar las condiciones de vida ya que su casa esta construida de madera y quiere que en un futuro se le apoye para construir su vivienda , el desde hace treinta años se dedica a la agricultura la mayor dificultad que se le ha presentado es la falta de financiamiento ya que sus cultivos carecen de fertilizantes e insumos , el inicio con sus propios esfuerzos para poder mantener  a su familia , el quiere financiamiento para la compra de insumos y poder vender a mejor precio en el mercado.
texts.en:
Francisco Javier Z. C. is 45 years old. He lives in the community of Edén in the Ticuantepe municipality with his wife, who helps him in the house and on the farm. Together, they care for their three children, two children in secondary school and a four-year-old boy. Their plans for the family are to improve their quality of life and their house, which is made of wood. In the future, they hope to be able to build a better home.

Since the age of 30, Francisco has worked in agriculture. The biggest challenge that he has faced is not having enough money to purchase the fertilizers and other supplies that his crops need. He began farming on his own in order to support his family. He wants a loan so he can purchase necessary supplies and obtain better prices for his products at the market.

Translated from Spanish by Priya Bapat, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase agricultural supplies for crop production

loans.name: Rakib

texts.ru: Ракиб по профессии телефонист, работает в местном узле связи. Ему 44 года, женат и воспитывает 4 детей. Несколько лет назад он купил небольшой участок земли с 3 комнатным домом. Его жена нигде не работает и сидит дома. Ракиб рядом со своим домом начал строительство нового дома. Год назад он пришел в Микроинвест и получив займ покрыл крышу жестяным шифером. Погашения займа произвел вовремя и источником денег для погашения была его заработная плата и дополнительное занятие животноводством. Сейчас Ракиб собирается купить доски для того, чтобы сделать деревянный пол в своем новом доме.
texts.en:
Rakib, a 44 years old communications specialist, works at a local communications hub. Rakib is married and has 4 children. A few years ago, Rakib purchased a small parcel of land with 3-room house. Rakib's is a housewife. Recently, Rakib began construction of another house on his property. A year ago, he obtained a Microinvest loan to cover the new house with tin roof. The previous loan was repaid promptly. Rakib will use this loan to purchase wood flooring for his new house.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase wood flooring materials

loans.name: Bendecido Por Jehova. Group

texts.es:
El Grupo Bendecido por Jehova son mujeres responsables con deseos de salir adelante, son vecinas cercanas con mucha experiencia con sus actividades diarias. el grupo se conforma de la siguiente manera:
Sra. Bessy R. tiene 40 años de edad, tiene un año de dedicarse a su negocio que son la elaboracion de tortillas, ella se levanta a las 5:00am para empezar su produccion y luego tiene que venderlas desde las 7:00am hasta las 12 del medio dia, tabimbien vende productos lacteos., ella antes tenia una cafeteria donde vendia golosinas, pero tuvo unos problemas y tuvo que deshacerse de su negocio y ahora quiere empezar de nuevo para salir adelante.
Sra. Heimy tiene 22 años de edad y tiene 2 años de dedicarse a la venta de joyeria como ser aritos, argollas, relojes, tambien vende monederos, carteras, zapatos, cadenas de plata, desde niña le han gustado las ventas ya que antes trabajaba como impulsadora de una empresa privada, pero ella mejor decidio poner su propio negocio y asi solo trabajar para ella, esto tambien lo hizo ya que no tenia a nadie que le cuidara su hijo, y pagar una niñera le salia muy caro. su esposo trabaja en cafe maya una empresa privada, el viaja todas las semanas para distribuir el cafe por varias comunidades. ella necesita el credito para comprar telas para fabricar carteras, comprar escencias de perfumes y ropa interior, la meta de ella a corto plazo  es tener un negocio grande.
Sra. Roxana V. tiene 28 años de edad, tiene 2 años de dedicarse a su negocio, ella vende zapatos para dama, carteras, cortinas, mochilas, set de lociones, jeans, camiasas, tenis, ella tiene 3 hijos.
tiene muchos clientes fijos la visitan a su casa para comprarle el producto, ella es muy amable y sociable, esto es una caracteristica que no todas las personas la tienen y por eso sus clientes la buscan. ella antes trabajaba en una farmacia, pero mejor decidio poner su propio  negocio y le da mas ganancias que el salario que tenia en la farmacia. ella necesita el credito para comprar mas ropas, cortinas, carteras y sandalias. el sueño de ella es tener una tienda bien grande.
texts.en:
The Groups "Blessed by Jehova" are responsible women with a desire to get ahead in life. They are close neighbours with a lot of experience in their daily activities. The group is consists of the following members; Bessy Rodrigues is 40 years old, she has had a business making and selling tortillas for the past year. She gets up at 5am to begin her production and then she sells the tortillas from 7am till midday. She also sells dairy products. Previously she has a cafeteria where she used to sell sweets and snacks, but she had some problems and she had to give up the business, and now she wants to start again in order to keep moving forward. Heimy is 22 years old and she has spent the last two years selling jewellery such as earrings, rings and watches. She also sells purses, wallets, shoes and silver chains. Since she was a small child, she has liked retail sales, and previously she worked as a sales assistant in a private company, but then she decided it would be better to set-up her own business and only have to work for herself. She also decided to do this because she didn't have anybody to look after her son, and paying for a nanny was very expensive. Her husband works in Cafe Maya, a private company. He travels every week to distribute coffee in various communities. She needs the credit in order to purchase fabric to make wallets, buy perfume scents and underwear. Her short term aim is to have a big business. Roxana V. is 28 years old, she has 2 years experience with her business. She sells shoes for women, wallets, curtains, rucksacks, lotion sets, jeans, shirts and sneakers. She has three children. She has a lot of faithful customers who visit her in her house to buy these products. She is very friendly and sociable, and as these are characteristics that not everyone has, this is why her customers seek her out. Previously, she worked in a pharmacy, but she decided it was better to set-up her own business and it gives her more income than the salary she earned in the pharmacy. She needs the loan in order to buy more clothes, curtains, wallets and sandals. Her dream is to have a larger shop.

Translated from Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase prodcuts and stock for their businesses

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Shohida

texts.ru: Шохида одна из активных клиентов Микроинвест. Вот уже несколько лет она сотрудничает с Микроинвест и за это время ее бизнес получил мощное развитие. Начинала с одного магазина, сейчас у нее 3 торговые точки. В планах у Шохиды продолжать увеличивать товарооборот и в будущем самой выезжать за товаром на оптовые рынки Китая. Свой новый займ она собирается погасить в течении 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Shohida Z., one of the active Microinvest clients, has been collaborating with Microinvest for several years. During these years, her business has grown significantly. Beginning from a single stall, Shohida's business now has 3 sales locations. Shohida plans to continue business expansion. In the future, she wants to purchase wholesale and ship products directly from China. Shohida plans to repay this loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Amalia

texts.es:
¿Por qué inició el negocio?   Para poder sacar adelante a mis hijos, ya que yo sola me hice cargo de ellos y tenía que sostenerlos y además quería darles estudio a los tres. 
¿Cuándo comenzó el negocio? (Fecha)  En Agosto de 1987



Amalia empezo el negocio vendiendo ropa y productos cosmeticos, después lo hacia  de casa en casa con su  maleta de ropa, pero su sueño era tener un negocio mas grande y establecido en un lugar fijo. Ahora que sus hijos están grandes y casados pude ver cumplido su sueño  ya que cuenta con un negocio establecido, porque ya esta grande y ya es cansado  vender de casa  en casa o en mercados ambulantes. 
 
Ella ha logrado preogresar en su negocio ya que  comenzo vendiendo de casa en casa, luego ya me establecío su  propio local, y gracias al negocio ha podido construir dos locales comerciales pequeños los cuales renta a otros comerciantes.

Ahora necesita un prestamo por MXN $12,000 que pagara en 12 catorcenas para  comprar mercancía como regalos y novedades para tener bien surtido mi negocio y poder ofrecer una mayor variedad de productos a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Why did I start this business? In order to help my children succeed, since I am their sole caregiver and I had to raise them and I also wanted all three to be able to attend school. I started the business in August 1987. Amalia started her business selling clothes and cosmetics, later she sold door-to-door with a suitcase of clothing, but her goal was to have a larger business in an established location. Now that her children are grown and married she has accomplished her goal of an established locale, since she is older now and it is tiring work to sell door-to-door or as a traveling salesperson. Thanks to the business she has been able to build two other small commercial shops, which she rents out to other business owners. Now she requires a loan of $12,000 MXN to pay back in 12 installments to buy merchandise such as gifts and novelties in order to have a varied inventory for her business and offer the best selection to her clients.

Translated from Spanish by Pamela Carreón, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Romana

texts.es:
Romana inicio su negocio primero pusieron su  ferretería en la bajada del mercado Francisco I. Madero  en Tampico, y de esta manera lograron su sueño, ya que en la actualidad, aparte de esa Ferretería tienen otros dos negocios más pequeños en la bajada del mercado y les ha ido muy bien desde entonces. 
 
Su negocio ha tendido grandes progresos comenzaron  con un negocio y gracias a su esfuerzo  pudimos tener dos ferreterías mas, una de las cuales ya se la traspasaron a su  hija y también le está yendo muy bien.

Ella necesita un prestamo de MXN $12,000 que pagara en 12 catorcenas para comprar artículos de ferretería para poder tener mas surtido el negocio y que sus clientes siempre encuentren lo que buscan.
texts.en:
Romana began her first business as a hardware store in the market Francisco I. Madero in Tampico, and with this business was able to fulfill her goal of building two other smaller businesses in the same market and they have done well. They have been successful enough to be able to transfer ownership of one of them to her daughter, who is also doing well. She now requires a $12,000 MXN loan to repay in 12 installments to buy hardware materials to offer a varied inventory so her clients can always find what they need.

Translated from Spanish by Pamela Carreón, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Cristina

texts.es:
Cristina  inició el negocio ya que siempre le gustaron las ventas y además era una forma de ayudar a su esposo con los gastos de la casa que cada vez eran mas fuertes, además de los estudios de sus hijos ya que en esa época estában atravesando por una situación difícil económicamente hablando.

Comenzó el negocio en Abril de 2000 haciendo tandas con perfumes y los números los vendía entre  amistades y vecinos. Posteriormente, con los préstamos que recibía de una institución financiera empezo a comprar más perfumes y ropa para dama y caballero.
 Desde que empezo ha ido teniendo más clientes en sus negocio  y no se queja ya que le ha ido bien y de esta manera ha podido contribuir al mejoramiento de su familia.

 
Ella necssita un prestamo por MXN $4000 que pagara en 10 catorcenas para  comprar ropa de temporada para caballero y dama y así tener una mejor variedad que ofrecerle a mis clientes.
texts.en:
Cristina started in her line of work because she enjoyed sales and it was a way to help her husband with the household expenses, which were increasing, and with their children's school expenses; plus they were going through some tough economic times. She began the business in April of 2000, selling perfumes to her friends and neighbors. Later, with loans which she received from a financial institution, she began to buy more perfumes and women's and men's clothing. Since the beginning she has had many customers and has done well, which has allowed her to help improve her family's quality of life. She needs a loan of $4000 MXN, to repay in 10 installments, in order to buy men's and women's current style clothing, thereby providing a better variety of merchandise for her clients.

Translated from Spanish by Pamela Carreón, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Maria Elizabeth

texts.es:
Elizabeth  inició el negocio  porqué es una persona muy activa y siempre le han gustado las ventas y como la pensionaron le quedaba mucho tiempo libre además de que puede contribuir con los ingresos familiares.
 Comenzó el negocio En Marzo de 2005 con una mesita en la cochera de su casa y al poco tiempo ya tenía muchos clientes ya que no hay ningún negocio de este tipo cerca de su casa que venda comida por las mañanas, entonces un cliente le sugirió que buscara un lugar  en la avenida principal de la colonia para que estuviera mejor ubicada, por lo cual puso su negocio a media cuadra de su casa y desde entonces le ha ido mejor. 
 
Poco a poco ha ido afianzando su negocio y ha podido comprar algunas cosas que le hacían falta, como ollas de mejor calidad, mesas y sillas para que sus clientes puedan disfrutar la comida también compro una estufa un poquito más grande y una sombrilla  para cubrirse del sol y la lluvia.


Ella  necesita un prestamo por MXN $4000 que pagara en 10 catorcenas  para   comprar materia prima para elaboración de mis comidas tal como carne, tortilla, verduras, pan francés aceite, frijol, vasos y platos desechables, etc.
texts.en:
Elizabeth started her business because she is an active person and has always enjoyed sales. At the time she had been laid-off so she had time on her hands, plus she wanted to contribute to the family income. She began the business in March of 2005 with a little table in her garage and in no time she had many customers since there was no other business near her home that sold food in the mornings. One customer suggested she find a locale on the neighborhood’s main avenue to be better situated, which put her about half a block from her house. Since then she has done even better. Slowly she has financed her business and has been able to buy needed items such as better cooking pots, tables and chairs for the customers' enjoyment of her food, as well as a bigger stove and an umbrella for protection from the sun and rain. She needs a loan of $4000 MXN, to be repaid in 10 installments, in order to buy raw cooking materials such as meat, tortillas, vegetables, French bread, oil, beans, disposable glasses and plates, etc.

Translated from Spanish by Pamela Carreón, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy raw materials

loans.name: Wassim

texts.en:
Wassim is a 24-year-old man who lives in Tripoli, in northern Lebanon. He has owned a barber shop for four years. He requested a loan of $1,000 from Al Majmoua in order to purchase new tools for his work and to do some maintenance work on his car. This is the first time that Wassim has requested a loan.

Wassim is special in his work because he is known for his good work. His clients are his friends, neighbors and others. He decided on starting this business because of his experience and his need for cash. In the future, Wassim plans to expand his business as well as start a new business in car trading.

loans.use: to purchase new tools for his work and do some maintenance work on his car.

loans.name: Walid

texts.en:
Walid is a 52-year-old man who lives in Tripoli, in northern Lebanon, with his wife and their three children. Walid has owned a car wash garage for 15 years. He requested a loan of $1,000 from Al Majmoua in order to purchase new tools for his garage and pay his daughter’s wedding expenses. This is the first time that Walid has requested a loan.

Walid is special in his work because he is the only one in his neighborhood who cleans cars. His clients are his friends, neighbors and people from his region. He decided on starting this business because he needed to improve his financial situation. In the future, he plans on improving his business and opening a bakery.

loans.use: To purchase new tools for his garage and pay his daughter’s wedding expenses.

loans.name: Norberto

texts.es: El señor Norberto S. tiene la edad e 46 años habita en la Borgoña ubicado en el municipio de Ticuantepe, junto a su esposa la cual le apoya en realizar las actividades del hogar; ellos tiene tres hijos dos de ellos ya son casado y un joven de 18 años que actualmente estudia su secundaria, los planes hacia su familia es logra comprar un terreno  para heredarle a cada uno de ellos. Don Norberto desde hace veinticinco años trabaja como agricultor y comerciante la mayor necesidad es la falta de financiamiento, el inicio la labor de agricultor con sus propios esfuerzos, el necesita financiamiento para la compra de fertilizantes para abonar sus  cultivos de piña y den un  mejor resultado en cuando a la calidad y sean vendido en un mejor precio lo cual esto generaría buenos ingresos.
texts.en:
Noberto S. is 46 years old and lives in Borgoña, located in the municipality of Ticuantepe, together with her wife who helps him with all their home tasks. They have three children, two of whom are already married and the youngest of whom is 18 years old and is currently studying in secondary school. Their plans in regards of their family is to be able to buy a plot of land in order to leave an inheritance to each one of them. Don Noberto has worked for the last 25 years as a farmer and trader. His main problem is the lack of financing. He began his agricultural work with his own resources, but he needs finance in order to purchase fertilizer to cultivate his pineapple crops and give a better quality result, so that the crop can be sold at a better price which will generate a good income.

Translated from Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase agricultural products to improve production.

loans.name: Sultonboy

texts.ru: Атамбою исполнилось 50 лет. он женат и имеет 5 детей. Работает в ресторане, который находится в центре города. Кроме основной работы в летнее время занимается сушкой абрикосов. Сейчас хозяин ресторана предложил ему заняться изготовлением шашлыка для кухни ресторана. Так как Султонбой ранее имел опыт в этой деятельности он согласился. Сейчас он собирается получить займ, чтобы приобрести мясо и уголь для своего бизнеса.
texts.en:
Sultonboy is fifty years old, married and has 5 children. He works at a restaurant in the middle of the city. In addition to his job, Sultonboy dries apricots in the summer. Sultonboy's boss suggested him to make kebab for his restaurant. Sultonboy has made kebab in the past, so he agreed. Sultonboy will use this loan to purchase meat and coal for his business.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase meat and coal

loans.name: Mounira

texts.en:
Mounira is a 52-year-old widow who lives in Saida, in southern Lebanon. She has been working as a seamstress for eight years. She sews at home and also cooks when she is asked to. Mounira requested a loan of $500 from Al Majmoua in order to purchase thread for her sewing and some raw materials for her cooking. This is her second cycle and she has always paid on time.

Mounira is special in her work because she does it well and has experience. Her clients are her friends and neighbors. When Mounira first started her business, she didn’t have enough money. She decided on doing her business because of her experience and her precise work. In the future, she plans on expanding her sewing business and opening a restaurant.

loans.use: To purchase thread for her sewing and some raw materials for her cooking.

loans.name: Nisrine

texts.en:
Nisrine is a 29-year-old woman who lives in Saida in southern Lebanon with her husband and their three children. Nisrine has owned a hairdressing salon for seven years. She also has been selling makeup for four years.

Nisrine requested a loan of $500 from Kiva's partner Al Majmoua in order to purchase makeup and accessories for her salon. This is the first time that Nisrine has requested a loan.

Nisrine is special in her work because she knows how to treat her clients and she is good at her work. Her clients are her friends and neighbors. She decided on doing her business because of her experience as well as to supplement her family’s income. In the future, she plans on expanding her business and opening a makeup shop.

loans.use: To purchase makeup and accessories for her salon

loans.name: Hanan

texts.en:
Hanan is a 37-year-old widow who lives in Saida, southern Lebanon with her six children. Hanan has been working as a seamstress since 1990. She requested a loan of 500 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase thread for her work. This is the first time that Hanan has requested a loan.

Hanan is special in her work because of her good work and quality of work. Her clients are her friends and neighbors. She decided on doing her business because she had to improve her family’s financial situation especially since her husband’s death.

loans.use: to purchase thread for her work

loans.name: Tohir

texts.ru: Тохирчон работает в ресторане. Ему 43 года, женат и имеет 2 детей. старший сын работает здесь же в ресторане - помогает отцу. Жена Тохирчона нигде не работает,  и ее основное занятие это изготовление различных овощных салатов, которые предлагаются тут же в ресторане. Тохирчон решил получить займ для закупки различных овощей и приправ. займ собирается погасить в течении 6 месяцев.
texts.en:
Tohir works in a restaurant. He is 43 years old, is married and has 2 children, his older son works here at the restaurant – helping his father. Tohir’s wife doesn’t work and her main occupation is the preparation of a variety of vegetable salads that are offered at the restaurant. Tohir decided to take out a loan for the purchase of a variety of vegetables and dressings, he plans to pay back the loan over 6 months.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Cenelia Maria

texts.es: Cenelia  es una joven madre que  tiene una bebita de 3 años, está solicitando refinanciamiento de su 4rto crédito para invertirlo en mejora de su vivienda como es construccion de la cocina ya que no tiene, trabaja como docente del Nerpe Rafaela Herrera desde hace 6 años con dos plazas,  Cenelia actualmente esta cursando su 3 er  año en la universidad URACCAN, a pesar que es madre soltera ayuda a sus padres con los gastos familiares, es una joven con alto espititud de superacion profesional, responsable, honesta, trabajadora, vive en colonia la Fonseca a 30 km  de Nueva Guinea, su sueño es  construir su cocina para mejor comodidad para su familia, seguir  estudiando y tener estabilidad laboral, ya que son familias muy humildes de escasos recursos económicos.
texts.en:
Cenelia is a young mother who has a small baby aged three, she is asking for financing from her fourth loan in order to invest the money in improving her home, by constructing a kitchen (she doesn't currently have one). She has worked for the last six years as a teacher in Nerpe Rafaela Herrera, but with two jobs Cenelia is also currently studying in the third year of University at URACCAN. Despite being a single mother she helps her parents with the family expenses. She is a young woman with a high sense of professionalism, responsible, honest and hard-working. She lives in the suburb la Fonseca, 30 km from New Guinea. Her dream is to construct a kitchen to make her family more comfortable, to continue studying and to have secure employment, as her family are very humble and have few economic resources.

Translated from Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Kitchen construction

loans.name: Geyling Mara

texts.es: Geyling es casada, tiene  un hijo de 8 meses, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo que trabaja en la finca a 15 kilometros de la colonia, y se encarga de los gastos familiares,  está solicitando refinanciamiento de su 5to crédito para invertirlo en mejora de su vivienda (terminar de repellar lacosina y hecharle el piso), trabaja como docente desde hace 10 años,  ella asume con los gastos familiares de sus padres ya que son de escasos recursos economicos y de los compromisos adquiridos,  es una joven responsable, honesta  trabajadora  y muy querida en su comunidad  pues ayuda a muchos niños campesinos de su comunidad,bella vive en la colonia San Pablo a 25 km de Nueva Guinea, es una docente que ama su trabajo, actualmente esta estudiando su 3er año en la universidad URACCAN Recinto Nueva Guinea. Expresa que se siente agradecida con la Institución de AFODENIC ya que con los créditos anteriores ha comprado electrodomésticos y a mejorado la vivienda donde ella vive, su sueño es tener una vivienda bonita y trabajo para así sacar a su hijo adelante y ayudar a su madre con los gastos del hogar.
texts.en:
Geyling is married, and she has an eight-month old son. She depends on the support of her husband who works in a finca around 15 kilometres from their suburb. She is in charge of managing the family budget, and is asking for financing through their fifth loan in order to invest the money in improving their house (finishing the plastering and laying the floor). She has worked as a teacher for the past 10 years, and also meets the expenses of her parents as they have very few economic resources and many commitments. She is a responsible young woman, honest and hard-working and very loved in her community as she has done a lot to help the labourers' children in her community. She lives in the suburb of San Pablo 25 kilometres from New Guinea. She is a teacher who loves her work and currently is studying her third year in the URACCAN university in Recinto, New Guinea. She expressed her gratitude for AFODENIC's help as with the previous loans she has bought domestic appliances and approved the house in which she lives. Her dream is to have a beautiful house and to work to ensure her son gets ahead in life and to help her mother with the household expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Replaster the kitchen and lay a floor

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Mambo (Greetings) from Tanzania! This is 40-year-old Elizabeth Kang’opo from Mbeya. She is married with 5 children, between the ages of 11 and 21. Elizabeth has been running a crop-selling business since 2002. Her business is to purchase crops from farmers on a wholesale basis and sell them in town for a higher price. She works at the business for 12 hours per day, 6 days per week.

Elizabeth currently earns about 90 USD a month from her business. She is requesting a loan of 400 USD in order to purchase rice, groundnuts, beans and maize in bulk. In the future, she plans to increase the quantity of crops she buys in order to get more profit. Elizabeth thanks you for your support!

ABOUT SELFINA:

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility.

Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase rice, groundnuts, beans and maize in bulk

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To increase the number of bags of crops in her business inventory

loans.name: Ester

texts.en:
Mambo (Greetings!) from Tanzania! This is 20-year-old Ester M. from Mbeya. She is married and has no children of her own, but she is responsible for supporting one dependant.

Ester has been running a videotape business since 2006. She buys videotapes wholesale and sells them retail. She works at her business for 16 hours per day, 7 days per week and is assisted by her husband. Ester currently earns about $300 USD each month from her business. 

She is requesting a loan of $400 USD to purchase more video tapes and VCDs in bulk. In the future, she plans to add more videotapes, DVDs (digital video disks) and VCDs (video compact disks). Ester thanks you for supporting her!

ABOUT SELFINA:
SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase more videotapes and VCDs in bulk

loans.name: Fausta

texts.en:
Mambo (Greetings!) from Tanzania! This is 30-year-old Fausta S. from Mbeya. She is married and has two children aged 6 and 13. Fausta has been selling clothes and kitchen utensils since 2000. She buys the items wholesale and sells them retail to earn a profit.

She works at her business for 9 - 12 hours per day, 6 days per week and is assisted by her husband. Fausta currently earns about $300 USD a month from her business. She is requesting a loan of $400 USD to purchase more clothes and kitchen utensils in bulk. In the future, she plans to open a new business. Fausta thanks you for your support!

ABOUT SELFINA:
SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes and kitchen utensils in bulk

loans.name: Flora

texts.en:
Mambo (Greetings!) from Tanzania! This is 43-year-old Flora M. from Tukuyu. She is married and has five children between the ages of 9 and 26. Flora has been running a “kuku” business since 1997. 

"Kuku" is a popular micro-business in Tanzania, especially amongst SELFINA clients. In fact, if you are a regular lender on Kiva.org, you might be tired of reading about kuku! Who or what are"‘kuku," you may ask. "Kuku" means "chickens" in Swahili, and raising them for sale is popular for a number of reasons. First, they require little start-up capital. You can start with one or two chickens and either add to them as you go or wait for them to multiple naturally. 
Second, they require little space, so sometimes you can just let them run around in your garden or compound. Third, while they are growing. they produce eggs, which can either be sold to provide a supplementary source of income or eaten to provide a supplementary source of protein. I’m sure there are hundreds of other reasons why raising kuku is so popular. Maybe they are friendlier than other animals -- or prettier, but this is all time and space will allow.

Flora works at the business for 13 hours per day, 6 days per week and is assisted by one employee. Flora currently earns about $150 USD per month from her business. She is requesting a loan of $400 USD to increase the number of chickens in her project. In the future, she plans to open a fish business. Flora thanks you for her support!

ABOUT SELFINA:
SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To increase number of chickens in her project

loans.name: Frolence A.

texts.en:
Mambo (Greetings!) from Tanzania! This is 38-year-old Frolence A. from Tukuyu. She is married and has two children aged 10 and 18. Frolence has been running a grocery business since 2005. She buys drinks wholesale and sells them retail. 

She works at the business for 9-12 hours per day, 7 days per week. Frolence currently earns about $150 USD each month from her business. She is requesting a loan to buy more drinks like beer, whisky, and soft drinks for her business. In the future, she plans to increase the varieties of drinks in her grocery shop. Frolence thanks you for your support!

ABOUT SELFINA:
SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks like, beer, whisky, and soft drinks for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more drinks in bulk for her business

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Mambo (Greetings!) from Tanzania! This is 23- year-old Irene M. from Mbeya. She is married with one 3-year-old child. She is also responsible for supporting one dependent whose parents died of HIV.  

Irene has been running a timber business since 2002. She works at the business for 9 - 12 hours per day, 6 days per week and is assisted by her husband. Irene currently earns about $350 USD a month from her business. She is requesting a loan of $400 USD to purchase more trees for timber processing. In the future, she plans to buy additional machines for timber processing. Irene thanks you for your support!

ABOUT SELFINA:
SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase more trees for timber processing
